title: Quiet and well-located if a bit worn
text: Definitely worn around the edges and tired decor. Some of the bedding had holes though it was clean.  But, warm and cozy library with interesting food and good coffee. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great midtown location near good restaurants. Quiet and comfortable

title: Great experience
text: Great and very convenient midtown location, spacious rooms and amenities.  Wonderful service and we loved the fact we could open the windows! There is also a nice and quaint space with a library where you can have coffee, juices, fruits and snacks

title: Dated quaint hotel
text: The club lounge and the staff there are the best part of this hotel in addition to the location.  After a lengthy airport commute, it's great to be able to grab water and snacks as well as to do so throughout the day.  I love that the selection is always refreshed and that newspapers were available. The manager at the front desk was brusque and the doorpeople did not always mind the door.  In addition, the hotel would not consider nor would they provide any further discount or comps for my travel to my travel agent.  The carpet and most of the furniture in the room were beyond worn and in need of an update.  It is well located in terms of central park, Moma and the theatre district.  It's charming, but definitely in need of an update.

title: Old, worn, and overrated
text:
When I write these reviews of high-end hotels, I often think, “Would I rather stay in an average Hilton Garden Inn by the interstate? In this case, the answer is yes.

On the plus side, the service is friendly, and—and this is a big thing—our room was quite large by New York standards. It didn’t have ceiling lights, but they almost made up for it with lots of small desk lamps. The street noise is average for New York hotels: noticeable, but not terrible.

On the minus side:
The furniture and carpet seem like they are several decades old. The sofa was built before people figured out how to make a sofa that is actually comfortable to sit in.
The heating system works, but it is too binary. When on, it pumps out huge amounts of hot air, so you get rapid shifts in temperature.
The bathroom is small and has no horizontal surfaces to put things on except the back of the toilet.
The breakfast is, as advertised, “continental,” meaning muffins, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and granola bars. In a four-star hotel, I would prefer to pay for a good breakfast.

All of this would usually add up to three stars, but there’s one more problem. The hotel only has one small elevator, which means the wait times can be very long. You need to leave an extra 5-10 minutes if you are going anywhere. I gave up and started using the stairs.

I think the reason this whole chain gets such spectacular ratings is that the staff are extremely friendly and they send you an email later begging for a review. (On the other hand, the Hotel Giraffe is significantly better.)

title: Old-school Vibes
text:
Excellent boutique hotel situated in Midtown East. What sets this place apart is the service. The doormen, bellhops, house staff, and the front desk are excellent- welcoming, courteous, accommodating, and professional. It's a throwback to another era, with a tapestry covered, chandeliered elevator and a small but welcoming lobby with an umbrella stand and doorman.

The junior suite was very spacious, perfect for three of us. Robes, slippers, and high-end toiletries elevate the stay. The reading room was a great space for 24/7 snacks and beverages, plus a light breakfast buffet. I appreciated being able to take a cappuccino and the New York Times back to my room. Valet parking was also a great service for $40/24hrs. 

These amenities are what set the Hotel Elysée from similarly priced rooms at other midtown & Manhattan hotels.

Special recognition to Nick, who helped me with a late-hour reservation change with understanding and efficiency.

title: A Gem in the East 50’s
text:
The Hotel Elysée is a charming small hotel well located in  the east 50’s - an easy walk to theater and some excellent restaurants. The rooms are very comfortable and well-appointed. The staff - everyone we met- were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Whenever we returned to the hotel we were greeted at the door and the front desk with a friendly “welcome back” 
A special treat is the hotel’s very comfortable lounge for guests where they provide breakfast and soft drinks and snacks through the day. The lounge has cushioned chairs and sofas and an adjoining library - very comfortable  for reading in the afternoon. 
All in all a great place with a fabulous staff, all at a very reasonable price.

title: Simply Posh in the Heart of NYC
text: Sweet spot in the midst of NYC; pristine clean w/classic timeless decor, calming ambiance, walk to everything. Restaurant with superb bartender & good eats attached & right there! easy walk to MOMA, Times Square, Central Park and oh so much more!, .. looking forward to my next stay.

title: Great NYC Choice
text: Excellent location, good value, very comfortable and highly recommended. I will stay here again when I am in NYC.  The staff was professional and the resources very good. An extra treat is the second floor lounge for late afternoon snacks/drinks and morning continental breakfast.

title: Charming old world European Hotel in a great location.
text:
The old-world friendliness and customer service stand out at this little hotel!
From the fresh flowers in the lobby to the carefully crafted European snack cookies - the Hotel Elysee exudes charm.  Our room was cozy and very comfortable.  Loved the bedding and marble bath with wonderful shower pressure!  Look forward to returning soon!

title: Charming, clean and comfortable
text: A wonderful friendly hotel. Delightfully old-fashioned - I had a HUGE room in comparison to most modern hotels. Comfortable bed, extremely clean, safe and quiet. They have an extremely useful club room for guests to use during the day with free breakfast, real coffee, and snacks. Great location.

title: Already was better.
text: Very good, but it was better. Breakfast and amenities throughout the day were much better and with more options. Very good location. Old facilities, but well maintained. Restaurant called Monkey Bar is excellent, although it has become more expensive after the pandemic.

title: Highly recommended!
text:
Excellent hotel in a great location in the heart of the city just a short walking distance from central park. The staff was extremely accommodating and always there to help.
The rooms was very spacios and the bed the most comfortable I`ve had in a long time.
Definitely coming back!

title: A little bit of Europe in the City
text: We love staying at the Elysee. The staff is very welcoming and the rooms are clean, nicely appointed and the service has always been outstanding. We do miss the happy hour that they had before covid and would love to see bagels added to the morning breakfast offerings. btw... the sweetest people work on the delightful mezzanine lounge and they remember us when we stay there! Truly an oasis in the city! Hospitality plus!

title: Gorgeous Hotel - Quiet and relaxing with a great location!
text:
This hotel was gorgeous and the quality/service was incredible!

My wife and I came to NYC for a family celebration and spent our weekend here. The rooms were spacious and the beds were quite comfy. All staff members we interacted with were friendly and helpful. They provided us with delicious restaurant recommendations (highly recommend the Monkey Bar attached to the hotel if you can get a reservation) and set up reservations for when we arrived. They were also more than accommodating with our arrival and departure schedules when plans shifted around some. I should also note that the whole hotel is furnished with beautiful French antiques and florals which really add to the charm of the experience. 

The location of the hotel was also wonderful. So many shops! There are also lots of delicious restaurants only a few blocks away, and if you are up for a little longer walk, you can easily get to Time Square and Broadway

The hotel also offers a complementary breakfast which later turns into a snack/coffee/tea room. We found the breakfast was more than substantial with yogurts, pastries, and some other options. It was great when we were in a hurry one morning, but also great when we were having a relaxing morning with tea/coffee before heading out for brunch.

It was an amazing weekend and I will absolutely be coming back next time I am in NYC.

title: Not just a wonderful hotel...a wonderful experience!
text: Hotel Elysee is the only place to stay when visiting NYC!  From the exceptional staff to the beautiful French decor, you are immediately swept away in "Old World" charm.  Spotless and overly comfortable, I will stay at no other hotel. PERIOD.

title: Great experience, comfortable bed
text: Lovely hotel, the bed was very comfortable and the room was cozy. Unfortunately something came up and we were only able to stay one night.  The front desk was very helpful in changing our reservation. We will look to stay there again on our next visit to NYC.

title: Relaxing Hotel in Manhattan
text: This is a lovely hotel in downtown Manhattan. The staff are very friendly as well as helpful. The hotel serves a complimentary continental breakfast in its lounge, which is open all day with free coffee and snacks. The lounge is what made this hotel so perfect. We were able to sit and relax while reading the newspaper and sipping our coffee. The rooms are very nice and the hotel has a restaurant. This hotel is a real gem.

title: Another wonderful stay
text: I have been coming to this charming boutique hotel for many years and have never been disappointed. It is in midtown Manhattan near restaurants and museums. It has a European feeling. One free amenity there in a gracious room called the Library is .breakfast. There is a large variety of snacks and beverages available at all times. The staff is attentive to one’s every need. I highly recommend Hotel Elysee.

title: Another great visit
text: We've been staying here for ten years. It's the best location, great food and the service is excellent. I bring a small group here every other year and this is the only place in the city our group will stay!

title: Beautiful historic hotel
text: Great 5 nights stay for the Christmas holiday in the Vaclav Havel suite. Staff was very accommodating.  Location is perfect.  On East 54TH Street between Park Avenue and Madison Avenue. Short walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockafeller plaza, 5TH Avenue shopping,Radio City music hall, Broadway theater district.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
I have stayed at the hotel,several.times over the past few years. A friend often stays here with her husband and recommended it to me.
I love the location. I often visit NYC when there are art exhibits I want to visit. For example,  MOMA and The Metropolitan Art Museum. I enjoy walking to both.
I also enjoy the morning coffee and delicious breads, yogurt..etc
And the afternoon snacks
(I remember a time before COVID where were cued get cheese and crackers as part of the afternoon snack. I miss that.

My first issue occurred when I got my room key. I had arrived early afternoon and my room was not ready so I walked a couple of blocks to MOMA
The man at reception took my mobile number and said he would call when the room was ready. He thought in 90 minutes. I never received a call. That is not my issue . Although Why say you will do something without being asked by the guest and then not follow through??

When I arrived back at the hotel, a different person was at the desk to hand me my room key. Instead of writing the number on the card holder and showing it to me, he said the number out loud
I am a single woman and I try to careful when I travel. I know for sure saying room a number out loud is a GIANT NO NO! For safety of the guest.
Women, especially single travelers need to feel safe whenever they travel, in fact, all travelers do
I almost said something and almost requested a different room.
But, I turned around and I was alone in the reception area, except for a couple of employees
So I did not say a thing and took my key
However, I kept thinking about it.
I returned to the front desk later that day and shared my concern with the desk person. This was not the person who handed me my key
I thought I was clear in my concern. The desk person offered no apology, never said anything.
Just listened
I may be incorrect, but I do not think he understood my concern
I finally said, this important for all desk staff to know. Saying a room number out loud is a safety issue. I asked him to share my concerns with management
I did not ask to speak to a manager. That was a mistake on my part,

Now the room itself.
The bed was fine.
The cushions on the couch and the side chair have seen better days. The couch cushions were very uncomfortable due to a lack of firmness. I enjoy reading on the couch, but that was impossible
All someone needs to do is replace the cushion so you do not sink when sitting down.

Housekeeping does a good job. But, I think someone needs to check out the room to sit on the couch and then provide cushions that are comfortable. Check the shades and if one shade is tattered on the side, replace it

This hotel is charming, but my room needed to be better maintained. Presentation and comfort are important, especially when you hope your guest will return again

I will return to visit NYC and maybe this hotel
Or maybe not

title: A haven in a big city
text: This hotel is a charming place to stay while visiting New York . The location is convenient walking distance to shoppping and places of interest. The staff are helpful with any requests and my room was great. Will stay there again on my next visit to New York.

title: Just what we needed!
text: Welcoming staff. Warm and comfy stay.  Very clean. Well located for our visit to Rockefeller Center and play without the crowds on 5th Ave. Continental Breakfast a  convenient plus.  Look forward to returning in late December with our family.

title: Great Location!  Welcoming Staff!
text: From the superb location to our cozy room to the welcoming warm staff, we loved our stay! The second floor club space was especially appreciated, as we could grab a light breakfast - along with the morning papers - or a late snack at the end of a busy day. And, the Monkey Bar on the  first floor provided a fun spot to  enjoy a cocktail. We'll plan to make the Hotel Elysee our home once again on our next visit to New York!

title: More than satisfied.
text: Very nice clean rooms. Staff was all friendly and knowledgeable. Great location. Will stay again next visit. Walking distance to  museums and shopping. Doorman was always prompt and was able to get us a cab when needed. All in all another nice day at  the Hotel  Elysee.

title: Home away from home.
text:
Elysee is our home away from home when in NYC. We've stayed many times. It's like a little piece of Europe off Madison Ave.
The employees are friendly and remember us every time we arrive. The rooms have old world charm. We have already booked three stays for 2024.

title: A Real Gem
text: Everyone there is friendly and helpful and the hotel is in an ideal location.  The fact that the Monkey Bar is downstairs is just another plus. The prices are actually reasonable for mid-town Manhattan -- this is where we stay when we come to visit New York.

title: fabulous boutique hotel
text: Boutique hotel in walking distance to most attractions. The rooms are full of charm. The 2nd floor library with day long snacks and coffee/tea was a welcome respite from the busy holiday corwds ooutside. Thank you!

title: Love the location and staff was pleasant but not the caliber of hotel we expected.
text: Great location but it’s very tired and the guest services aren’t great.  The breakfast, while included, was very minimal.  Room felt smaller than the square footage indicated.  There are better choices at comparable prices.  This hotel needs a good refurbishing!

title: Lovely, lovely, lovely.
text: What a wonderful experience.  The staff is lovely, the location is perfect, the Monkey Bar is historic (and always crowded - I recommend the midtown pour).  We had a wonderful time! We particularly liked the breakfast room.  Guests were chatty if you wanted to chat with coffee, but it was also a nice way to start the day quietly if you preferred.  We wanted an East Side location but quick access to museums, shopping, Broadway and this was perfect for us.

title: Excellent stay at Hotel Elysee!
text: We love Hotel Elysée for the simple fact that I think of it as an “old school”type hotel with the decor and excellent service to match.  I prefer this type of hotel. The second floor refreshment station is terrific and service was always excellent and prompt. Terrific Door Men too!! Having the Monkey Bar in the lobby and Schumer’s Liquor store across the street is also a plus.

title: Great location, friendly staff, well-designed rooms
text: The room on the 12th floor was roomy, the bed very comfortable, the location terrific for what we had in mind (two exhibits at the Met and window shopping the Christmas lights), the guest lounge is a wonderful amenity, and the price is right!

title: My favorite hotel in New York City!
text: I have been staying at the Hotel Elysee for decades and it never disappoints! The staff is friendly and professional, the decor charming and cozy, and the location convenient. I stay at the hotel several times per year.

title: Great NYC Marathon Stay
text: Another great stay at Hotel Elysee!  We have stayed there for years and this time stayed before running the New York City Marathon.  Was a perfect spot for that--easy for runners and spectators alike!  Always great customer service, fantastic location, and just an all-around great spot to stay in Midtown Manhattan!

title: Quiet respite in the busy city
text: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Elysee in November 2023. We arrived by car and were greeted by the wonderful staff. Our room was spacious and comfy. We stayed for 2 nights, by the time we left we felt like family. The club room was perfect for coffee. Snacks and a respite from our gallivanting around the city. We were close to everything. When we need a car the doorman arranged for one instantly. I simply cannot express how wonderful the staff is. Highly recommend.

title: decades
text:
The doorman was very friendly and helpful. The front desk was helpful.
The bed was comfortable enough, and the bathroom was clean.
But the rooms need to be updated!  The upholstery on the chairs was soiled and dirty from decades of use. The furniture is dented and scratched and in poor condition. 
In the past, there were lovely cheeses, crackers, and hot d'ouvres in the late afternoon, but now it's mostly junk food and sugar, except bananas and oranges. 
I would not stay there again.
Mary Anderson
Seattle

title: Business trip
text: Amazing rooms and there are always friendly people at the front desk. Great location that has easy access to everything. Always quiet and restful stays whenever I stay here. While the elevator is a bit slow the service makes up for it

title: Like home.
text:
Great location for my business and walkable to theatre.
Comfortable "old world" rooms, lobby and service.
Congenial clientele from all over the world and of all ages.
Convenient guest lounge with beverages and snacks.
Monkey Bar for memorable dinners.
Would be nice to see the scaffolding be removed from the front of the building.
Highly recommend.

title: Hurrah for The Elysee!
text:
The Elysée is our favorite place to stay in NYC with its perfect location, its warm and helpful staff, its terrific breakfast/wine room, and its lovely and comfortable bedrooms.  It is such a charming, place and offers such good value.  We recommend it enthusiastically to all of our friends.
                The Edges -  Atlanta

title: Excellent Elysee
text: I have stayed at The Elysee many times in the past and have always enjoyed the location, comfortable rooms and the excellent service the staff provides with always friendly smile. Old school ambiance and professional staff are exceptional and greatly appreciated.

title: Wonderful hotel in Brooklyn
text: Wonderful service throughout the hotel. I interacted with the Front desk, restaurant, server and bar tenders at the lobby bar, house keeping and found everyone to be professional and very helpful. Room was great too! I also used the gym and liked it. Overall a wonderful stay.

title: Best NYC Boutique Hotel
text: Hotel Elysee is my favorite NYC boutique hotel! I’ve stayed there 6-7 times over the years. The staff always remembers me and does a great job welcoming and accommodating my visit. Love the balcony rooms, so worth the extra money. It’s on a quiet street, yet also close to Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, great restaurants, subway stations, etc.! This will always be my go to hotel when I visit NYC!

title: Top Notch
text: A lovely, quiet hotel tucked away from the bustle with top notch service and true "boutique" surroundings.  Any time I am booking my group of business travelers in New York, I try to book the Hotel Elysee.  It is always a wonderful stay!

title: yet another excellent stay at the Elysee
text:
First and foremost: the staff is helpful and forthcoming. This starts when you call about the reservation and lasts all the way through your departure. The (must) have an amazing customer system because they do remember you even if it has been years since last time.

The rooms are comfortable - I particularly like the queen room with balcony - and the availability of the lounge for a coffee or tea after a busy day is a nice feature too. It used to be even better when there was some cheese and wine in the afternoon - now gone - but alas, the world changes.

If there was one feature to reflect on it would be the shower head - a fix one, rather than a flexible one. So - a very minor item, completely reflecting the excellence of Elysee. Far from the glammy impersonal profile of all too many hotels.

The location a block from 5th Avenue and a few steps from Madison on a calm street, close to Central Park adds to my reasons to come back to the Elysee. Good Italian restaurant across the street too.

title: Great NYC Stay
text: Great location, friendly staff, rooms were comfortable with everything you need and housekeeping staff were great.  We enjoyed meeting in the library where you could read the daily paper, enjoy a cup of coffee and relax  before heading out on your next NYC adventure.

title: Satisfied, Repeat Customer
text: The excellence of The Elysee starts with its wonderful staff. I'm a regular visitor from Boston. My son and I were there for a recant weekend. Juan at the front desk and team were all superb. Of course, the midtown location is very convenient, too, and the rooms - and their value for the price - are good.

title: Perfect location and service
text: This is our go to hotel in the city.We go yearly to see a broadway play and enjoy the fine restaurants with granddaughters. The famous Monkey Bar is now reopened, as is the beautiful restaurant. Service is terrific, they will valet your car and location midtown great for MOMA and Rockefeller Center. Coffee, drinks and snacks are available 24 hours and your stay includes a lovely continental breakfast. The hotel is old and in need of redecorating but still very charming and we love going there.

title: Disappointing accommodations
text: The staff are wonderful - friendly, helpful, courteous. However, our room left much to be desired; the upholstery on the sofa and chair were so disgustingly dirty that we put bath towels on them to sit. The window shade wouldn't come down all the way and a staff person came to fix it and broke it; he said ti would b fixed the next day, but it wasn't. I ordered ice to be delivered to our room at 10 PM so it would be there when we returned from the opera, but it hadn't been delivered. We have like the Elysee in the past, but were quite disappointed this time.

title: Thank you Elysee staff
text: The real plus about the Elysee is the staff. They are efficient , friendly and helpful. A great location in the center of Manhattan with a General Manager who runs a friendly and tight ship. Always happy to stay at this historic hotel

title: Go-to NYC hotel
text: Hotel Elysee is my go-to hotel in NYC. It's comfortable, feels safe and cozy, has great service, a wonderful location, and perfect simple breakfast with newspapers. I'm always happy there and recommend it.

title: Highly recommend
text: My husband and I went to NYC for a long weekend to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and the Hotel Elysee was the perfect choice for our stay! The staff is wonderful, the hotel has a quaint and homey vibe and is close to what we had planned for the visit. Very clean, charming, the club room was so convenient for coffee and snacks as needed. Great hotel!

title: A hidden gem!
text: I stayed for one week in October. The hotel is perfectly situated in midtown with easy access to major attractions and subway. As a native New Yorker and still a resident of the suburbs, I was quite comfortable with the location. The staff were kind and accommodating. The lovely attendant in the second floor club room always had a smile and a pleasant greeting  for the guests. The rooms are dated and could use updating but are meticulously kept and immaculate. The doormen and porters were so kind and generous with their time and assistance. True gentlemen.  Highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel perfectly situated in Manhattan
text:
Gracious staff at a lovely boutique hotel in Manhattan with an exceptional check out time of 1 pm.
Our room was very spacious and beautifully appointed. The “ club  room” on second floor was an added bonus where we could sit and read newspapers or chat over a cup of tea. Continental breakfast was plentiful.
Tea, coffee and soft drinks with snacks available 24/7.

Parking was a pleasure as staff parks car as well as retrieves for you. 

We will be sure to stay here again.

title: Wonderful experience
text: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The breakfast is good and it has many oprions. The location is amazing in the city center!! The rooms are clean and always well organized and the hotel staff is always happy to help. Especially, he receptionist Jiri was very helpful, polite and he was willing to help us with the issue that we had with our last-minute reservation!

title: A touch of Paris in NYC.
text: A wonderful, elegant hotel with excellent morning continental buffet, beautiful rooms with chandeliers, very convenient location. Staff friendly and very helpful. It is expensive but it is worth every penny.

title: Good not great!
text: It would be great if there were electrical outlet access at the desk in the room. Since I travel for business it would be a plus. Additionally, I would recommend removing the tub/shower combo and convert to shower only to improve functionality in the small bathrooms. Thank you.

title: Hotel Elysee....A lovely hotel
text: Hotel Elysee is a charming boutique hotel. When we travel to NYC this is the only hotel we reserve. The staff is lovely, the rooms are comfortable and well maintained. We enjoy our morning cappuccino in the 2nd floor lounge and chatting with Erica who has worked there for years. The location is great and convenient to the subway, many shops,Rockefeller Center and Central Park. The first time we stayed here was 1996! We've been back many times in the last few years primarily during the US Open Tennis tournament and to enjoy NYC at Christmas time. If you like a small boutique hotel rather than a large hotel the Elysee is for you. Another plus is the Monkey Bar!

title: Lovely hotel, but wine and cheese and magnificent breakfast is gone.
text:
We love the Library Collection and have stayed at all of them bar one, including the one in Budapest. This is the first one since Covid and we were disappointed to find the wonderful daily wine and cheese is no more, but even worse the magnificent former breakfast is now a shell of it’s former self - now more like something you’d expect at a lower end hotel chain. Very little in the way of healthy options, and only two choices of fruit.

The rooms are lovely and the staff are wonderful and very helpful as usual. The location is excellent.

We do hope that the lack of wine and cheese and lack of excellent breakfast is just part of the recovery from Covid and that these features will soon return.

title: Quiet, traditional small hotel - very pleased with the Elysee
text: Excellent, traditional, quiet, small hotel in midtown east. We were here for several nights and were very happy we chose the Elysee.  Our room was spacious, with a large wardrobe, desk, two beds and a couple of armchairs - all very comfortable.  Bathroom was very good with a bathtub and shower.  The lounge on the 2nd floor was great, with snacks, tea, coffee and soft drinks available all day.  We would stay here again.

title: A  hidden gem of a hotel in mid-town Manhattan - can't wait to go back!
text: My family and I had  an extraordinary stay here.  We  love this small, charming hotel!  We all appreciated  the friendly, very helpful  staff and the small size of the hotel, which made it feel very home-y, not corporate.  We also really enjoyed the "Club room"'s library -like feel with its great snacks anytime, plus morning breakfasts.  Plus the mid-town  location was  perfect for all our sight-seeing. We are recommending the Elysee to all our friends, and can't wait  to go back!

title: Many thanks for a goood time
text: The room was very spacious, the whole interior of the rooms and floors was really nice. Good service at the reception, in the clubroom and for the room we rented. The hotel situated Midtown Manhattan is a good start for everything you want to visit in NYC

title: A Boutique Hotel With Lots of Charm
text: The location was perfect, close to subways and within walking distance to mid-town and Central Park. Our king room was spacious and comfortable. The guest lounge on the 2nd floor was nicely stocked with assorted snacks and refreshments during the day and the continental breakfast was a nice treat. The Monkey Bar, a restaurant & bar located inside the hotel, had a varied menu but it's pretty pricey. The staff was friendly and very helpful getting us a taxi when it was raining. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: A smaller, boutque hotel with only 6 rooms per floor.  Room size was large and clean.  Great location, friendly staff. Nice second floor common room with refreshments, snacks all day + constinental breakfast each morning.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: I love this hotel.  Great location.  Rooms are decent size. Their common room is very comfortable.  I have never taken advantage of their cocktail hour but have heard it is lovely.  The staff is friendly and very efficient. I even caught one of the front desk men picking up the trash in front of the hotel.  They must be proud-and for good reason.

title: Quiet, refined, pleasurable.
text: This hotel is far enough from Times Square to avoid the noice and chaos.  This is a small, intimate and classy hotel with very nice furnishings.  I can't say enough about the 2nd floor area where a continental breakfast is offered.  Very quiet with classical music playing in the background.  The breakfast is generous and you can fill up for your day ahead. My family occupied 3 rooms  for 3 nights and we all agreed that this hotel was a wonderful respite from crowded streets and noise.  I highly recommend despite the higher room prices.

title: Home away from home!
text: We loved our stay! The only place we like to stay when going to NYC. The staff is friendly and attentive, location is fantastic, snacks/coffee/tea/breakfast is a huge perk! Already planning on coming back soon!

title: A real luxury hotel in the heart of midtown New York
text:
A real luxury hotel in the heart of midtown New York.
We stayed seven nights at the hotel, and we loved it.
Giving that it was our first time in the hotel, we felt from the first moment like home.
The room was beautiful, and very quiet.
The club was wonderful. And Erica from the club was great.

title: Classic New York
text:
Great location.  Booked a suite, lots of space, very comfortable bed. My only issue with the room was the bathroom.  I understand that it is an old school hotel, but no counter space at all and the tub/shower, the shower curtain is creepy.  
Big bonus is the Monkey Bar restaurant and bar are just off the lobby.  No “real” breakfast option, but they do have a lovely room (open 24 hours a day) that offers bottled water, soft drinks, coffee, tea, yogurt, etc.  
Staff was great.  Would probably stay again!

title: Charming and convenient hotel!
text: Lovely hotel, excellent room, great coffee and breakfast pastries!  I booked a last minute stay here because it was convenient to my meeting and ended up being totally delighted by the hotel - super recommend.

title: Love Love Love this hotel!
text: This hotel is not only beautifully quaint but provides old fashioned great customer service. All staff is personable and ready to provide whatever is needed. A great location without being in the noisy center.

title: Already booking my next stay at the Hotel Elysee
text: Excellent location, clean, friendly staff, good rates.  Everything I could have needed and will definitely book again. Very happy with the experience and love the historical charm of this hotel. Recommend to anyone looking in the area

title: Quality old school hotel
text:
This hotel has a certain charm. Small lobby with a really great location. Terrific service. 
Very reasonable price, included breakfast, which is coffee danish fruit etc
Monkey bar attached which I am not a big fan of but you can get a cocktail

title: Bargain Choice/Great Location
text: Although a little dated the Hotel Elysee is a good choice for NYC. The location is excellent and the staff very helpful. We needed a suite because we were traveling with our granddaughter and we’re given a spacious two rooms. It would have been three times the price at any other hotel. Complimentary breakfast included. The adjoining Monkey Bar and restaurant a bonus.

title: Great spot, huge value, incredible service
text:
Exceptional service - just above and beyond.  Just a really nice place an very, very reasonably priced.

The large breakfast lounge that is open all day is a really nice perk for gathering with people or even just having a coffee/reading the paper

Ask the front desk to get you an impossible to land reservation at Monkey Bar next door - food is amazing.

title: I could never stay anywhere else in NYC
text: This is such a charming, well-located, friendly hotel.  The rooms are so pretty, the beds delicious, the comp snacks an unexpected treat.  The last time we stayed here, the restaurant--called the Monkey Bar--was closed for renovations, but we were able to have both a yummy lunch and a rave-worthy dinner there this time.  We treated ourselves to a car service from and to the airport that the hotel arranged, and you should too.  Make sure James is your driver--he's the best.

title: A Great Experience - as always
text: We have stayed at The Elysee on several occasions over the last few years, and as always, our experience was great.  The staff is most courteous and accommodating, the location is great for us, and the price is certainly most reasonable.  We are always delighted to recommend The Elysee!

title: it was a wonderful and relaxing stay.
text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary in New York.  The hotel was perfect.  Very comfortable and charming and the service was exceptional!  The staff was very helpful, accommodating and followed through with all of our requests.  The hotel experience contributed to a perfect weekend away.

title: Superior service
text: From the moment I arrived, the staff at the hotel was attentive and helpful.  I arrived early but was able to get into my room.  They have 1pm check-out which was perfect for my needs.  The lounge area is a wonderful place to relax, work, or just get breakfast or a snack throughout the day.  I have stayed here before as well as several other Library Collection hotels in NY, Prague, and Budapest, and all have impressed.

title: Staying at the Elysee is always great
text: All of the staff are friendly & efficient and the services are comprehensive. Some staff, such as Erica, have been there foe many years & we look forward to seeeing them.Staying at the Elysee like coming home to a great family.

title: Old style comfortable hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text: This is an old fashioned boutique hotel. Elevator is called a lift and the 13th floor is labeled 12a. Despite its low key appearance it was a comfortable and relaxing stay. The front desk staff was always cordial and helpful as was the bell man service. The breakfast and lounge area had a quaint but relaxed atmosphere. The continental breakfast was always stocked w fresh coffee, pastries, bananas and juice. The rest of the day always stocked w waters sodas coffee and snacks. Plus the staff for this lounge was great a smile always evident. The rooms were fine, good beds and linens/ plus no obvious street or hallway noise. The old style bathrooms were fine. Overall nice plus to stay in NYC / located close to subway and walking distance to theater district. If u want to avoid the chain hotels this is a great choice. (Plus the famous Monkey Bar is adjacent to the hotel.

title: Comforting experience
text: Smaller hotel.  They pay attention to each guest.  Bedroom and bathroom separated by small entry room with closet and desk.  Useful if one in party is awake while other asleep.  Comfortable lounge with extended hour food/beverage availabilty including cappucino machine.  This is now our first choice Manhattan hotel.

title: Hospitality in Manhattan.
text: This is the best  hospitality I’ve ever seen in a Manhattan hotel, and at a reasonable price.  There’s a comfortable lounge with snacks, beverages, and reading material. Super location. It’s definitely my first choice when I go to NY!

title: Always a perfect stay
text: Love the way we're greeted--just like old friends!!  Hotel has great service and is so helpful.   We never want for anything when we stay at Hotel Elysee!!  Breakfast is an added treat!!  Perfect way to start your day!!

title: I would recommend this hotel highly.
text: The service is excellent, and the rooms are well equipped, but the best thing about the hotel is the second floor lounge, where you can get comfortable with breakfast, a snack, a newspaper or a friend all day long.

title: excellent boutique hotel
text:
excellent staff, always available to help!
monkey bar and restaurant are excellent - FUN, yummy, historic
2nd floor lounge with snacks all day,  fancy coffee maker, newspapers, great place to hang out in comfortable seats
great mid-town location

title: Nit what it used to be
text: The hotel has lost its elegance. The rooms have become shabby. The furniture and upholstery show wear and tear. My carpet was dust laden. They do not offer a good breakfast other than tiny soggy pastries, yogurt and old hard boiled eggs. There were nats flying on the bananas. There is no longer a wine hour.

title: A personable small hotel in a great location.
text:
The Hotel Elysee is a small, intimate hotel with a personalized touch. The rooms and public areas are very clean. The included breakfast foods, while of limited variety, are presented in a gracious, spacious lounge setting, and are always fresh., well-presented, and restocked regularly. 
The food, service, and atmosphere of the attached Monkey Bar Restaurant and lounge add to the hotel's lure.

title: Our standard NYC destination
text: Nice to be back at our go-to hotel in NYC, especially since the second floor is back in operation.  Comfortable bed, nice room and helpful staff make the Elysee a pleasure.  It's quieter on the back side of the building.

title: Aaaaah!
text: Have stayed at the Elysee for years.  Why? Because it's just a wonderful all around European boutique hotel in mid-town Manhattan.  Great housekeeping service. Great front desk service (always 2-3 representatives there at all times so you don't have to wait).  Great value, too!

title: Hotel Elysee guest of many decades
text: I have been staying at the Hotel Elysee since the 1960s. It is my favorite hotel in NYC. The front desk and housekeeping staff are excellent. All are very friendly and helpful. I love the traditional decor. J'adore l'Hotel Elysee!

title: Loved, Loved, Loved it!!!
text:
Both my husband and I found the Elysee to be perfect.  The decor throughout the property is beautiful, and it's so French, which is what had attracted me to this hotel in the first place. We really loved the old-world charm, and we found the hotel to be very clean.

Our room was a deluxe queen,  and it was more spacious than I had imagined.  It was very comfortable and extremely charming.  There was a lot of storage space, and we had plenty of room to move around comfortably.

The lounge on the 2nd floor was a bonus.  It's such a lovely, inviting room, where we found ourselves spending quality time 3 times a day........breakfast time, late afternoon after touring, and before retiring to our room at night. The beautiful classical music played in the background added to the elegance of the room.  Furthermore, it was a bonus to be able to have a lovely complimentary breakfast there, as well as drinks and snacks at our disposal throughout the day.

The staff members of the Elysee were always kind, friendly and helpful, and  they made us feel very welcome at all times.

The location of the hotel couldn't be better.  It's situated in an elegant part of the city, close to the luxury of 5th avenue, and it's central to many major tourist attractions.

The price of our stay was very reasonable, and we felt that we had definitely  gotten our money's worth.

Thank you, Hotel Elysee, for a wonderful stay!  We look forward to being your guests again in the future.

title: Top notch; Exceeded our expectations
text: Hotel Elysee exceeded our expectations.  From the friendly desk staff to the helpful dining recommendations to the cleaning staff, etc. Being on the 11th floor was ideal - never heard the street noises. The bed was very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. Loved the way the room was decorated; reminding us of a classic Bed & Breakfast, but with all the conveniences of a hotel. The Club Room was also very nice and again, the staff was top notch. The location was ideal for walking to museums, shopping, and dining.  We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Manhattan.

title: You were always my first choice when I come to New York and I do come often
text:
it is my second time staying with you this year for six days at a time. The staff is helpful. The place is clean. I love Erica on the second floor. She is the biggest asset to the hotel.

The concierge at the front desk always a pleasure with helping me with restaurants and reservations the doorman everyone the entire staff is amazing

title: A wonderful stay for the weekend
text:
This was a great stay at a great hotel. An affordable room coupled with a good location and timely customer service will always make a 5 star review for me. All of the staff were very accommodating and friendly. There is a bar downstairs called “The Monkey Bar” that is pricey but has a great ambiance. 

I would definitely stay here again, we enjoyed our room thoroughly.

title: Great value for New York City
text:
Lovely hotel offers great value. Not modern but very comfortable.  Great continental breakfast and the Monkey Bar restaurant attached to the hotel. 
Best location. Coffee always available and cookies too!

title: worth staying.
text: I stay in this hotel monthly and i truly enjoy it.  The price is right.  The rooms are dated but clean.  The staff is kind and helpful.  The 2nd floor snack and coffee room is a great treat that most hotels don't offer.

title: So welcoming!
text: The staff are lovely. Everyone had a sincere smile and wanted to be helpful and ensure we were comfortable and had what we needed. We loved the lounge on the second floor that was beautifully stocked with snacks and beverages all day. The lobby restaurant felt like we were visiting family. The decor is elegant. We would return gladly.

title: absolutely marvelous
text: A fabulous find (totally by accident)  The hotel is sooooo charming.  Daniel, Joseph and Juan are just wonderful.  Daniel's restaurant recommendation--Piccolo Cucina was over the top amazing.  Thank you, Daniel!   My room 54 was wonderful and quiet just as I requested.  The guest lounge was a huge plus--comfy and cozy.  The king bedroom price-- very reasonable.  A total joy, my new favorite and now always my choice for a New York city perfect stay.

title: My favorite hotel!
text: SO happy to be back at the Elysee!  The staff is superb and even remembered which type of room we prefer.   Everything was wonderful and I felt very well taken care of.  The Club House is a welcome respite, whether for breakfast or just an afternoon rest up with refreshments.

title: Needs an update
text: We have enjoyed staying at this lovely, boutique hotel for years. Many of its staff are long time employees and they are lovely. However, this time was a disappointment. Gone is the lovely happy hour in the lounge. Previously there was wine, cheese, nuts etc replaced by sodas and packaged snacks. Breakfast was also fair at best. Additionally, the rooms are very dated. Please renovate and bring this hotel back to its splendor.

title: Not what it used to be
text:
Had to switch rooms because there was a thunderous noise coming into the room. Room 154 on 15th floor. They showed me equally as bad rooms on the third floor that faced a noisy compressor and dingy. I just decided to stay in first room and had a bad nights sleep. 
Next day I found a different front desk person to help me and was given a much quieter room in the back on the 13th floor. I had to take him into 154 just to have him hear the noise and that I wasn’t crazy. Then he offers to have engineer do something with giant fan on the roof. No thanks!!! I was given room 133. The room was well worn and the privacy curtains didn’t close. There is an office across the way so I had to rig the curtain on a pull chain for privacy. At least it was a quiet room. I’ve stayed before and never had this experience. The hotel needs severe updating. The staff in the lounge are lovely. It’s nice having coffee and light things for breakfast in the morning and afternoon.

title: GREAT service!
text: Front desk and breakfast service personnel make this place. Not to be cliche… but these folks make you feel like family. My wife daughter and I have stayed at the Elysee several times. Each stay is consistent and the staff are so nice and helpful. Very comfortable stay.

title: Impressive
text: Pretty boutique hotel. Small, conveniently located, friendliest staff, beautifully clean rooms and a generously stocked lounge for the guests to use! If you want to stay somewhere relaxed, friendly and in the best location then look no further. We will absolutely return, our go to hotel in Midtown.

title: Love love love.  A gem!
text: Well I absolutely loved this hotel.  Not only is it extremely well located it is extremely charming.  There is a proper door man for one thing, and a group of engaged and helpful people at check-in in who were extremely personable and addressed my every concern.  The Club Room is well appointed and I am currently sitting there drinking a free Diet Coke, using the fast Wi-Fi, and listening to classical music on the radio as I write this.  My room is quite large for New York standards and had robes and slippers, free water, and a good sized bathroom.  I was almost deterred by comments that the hotel needed updating but I disagree.  The hotel is old school but it fits the setting.  If I stay in Chesterfield, Missouri, a brand new Residence Inn with furniture straight from IKEA is fine but in New York City one wants to feel a little bit of history, a tiny bit of faded glamor.  That said, everything was in perfect repair and if you buy handsome brass fixtures to start you can be pardoned for not replacing them when they simply continue to work beautifully.  I had lunch at the iconic Monkey Bar which was fantastic and so full of ambience I almost wept.  My air conditioning worked a treat—I like it shatteringly cold and it did not disappoint, but it was easily adjusted up to normal people temps.  I don’t want to share this place with the rest of you but I feel it would be hateful not to so here you go.  A gem!

title: Beautiful property but slightly less grand
text: We’ve loved this charming boutique hotel for over a decade. It offers great service, pretty decor and a wonderful location. I really hope they’ll consider resuming their generous wine/cheese happy hour and the complimentary breakfast service (abundant fresh fruit, juice and bagels, etc.)  which has been greatly minimized. Also that view of the garbage bags strewn on the outside scaffolding was rather sad. I hope you return to your best grand self, Hotel Elysee!!

title: Wonderful Boutique hotel in quiet, safe area of Midtown Manhattan
text: Wonderful boutique Hotel in mid Manhattan:  We hate big, impersonal chain type hotels. This is the opposite. It's a refined, boutique type hotel in a safe and quiet and centrally located place in Manhattan. The room was big , beautifully decorated  and with all the modern features. It was very quiet. The fine continental breakfast is served in a really nice and big lounge. It's not cheap. ( about $450/day total) but it really adds to a nice experience in New York.

title: Stylish hotel
text: The location is great, staff extremely friendly and the club on the first floor extremely useful for a stop during the day. I liked very much the appearance from the late 20th century, with old furniture and style. Maybe the two things I liked less were the breakfast, which was quite basic, and the noise of the air conditioning, which must have been from the late 20th century as well. :) But being in the middle of things was really priceless.

title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee, NYC
text: The entire staff of this wonderful hotel was welcoming, helpful and thoughtful.  The "Club Room" was a comfort stop, especially with its early-morning pastries and coffee.  We will absolutely stay there again!

title: An institution that never deceives
text: Elysée is like an old friend, so are its GM and team. I have been coming back to this property where you are taken back in time but where everything is perfectly maintained, the team skilled and happy to help. My go-to property in NYC

title: Viaje de aniversario, que tuvimos que posponer por pandemia
text:
*Excelente hotel 
*Excelente servicio
* Excelente trato del personal
*Excelente ubicación para vistar muchísimos lugares a pie
*Limpio
*Almohadas, excelentes!
*Buena iluminación
*Buenos desayunos americanos

title: Tourist trap
text: What appeared to be a reasonable rate quickly ballooned to $400/night due to their multiple add on charges, none which I occurred. I can only conclude that The Hotel Elysee is unfortunately just another tourist trap

title: Best little hotel in NYC!
text: What a gem in the city!! We came with our two young kids and our parents.  We had adjoining rooms which was perfect.  Everything about this hotel is spot on.  Second floor has breakfast every morning and snacks all day.  It’s so great and casual when you have early risers, coffee drinkers…and kids! Rooms were elegant, old school and very clean.  Staff is incredibly nice and helpful.  I don’t want to stay anywhere else now but the Elysee!  It made our trip even more special.

title: We love the staff here!
text: The staff here are so helpful and kind, the location can't be beat, the 2nd floor lounge has a great breakfast and a perfect spot for quiet reading.  I would ask for a room away from the street and high up.

title: Wonderful Hotel and Staff!
text:
We absolutely loved this hotel!  Everyone who works here is friendly and they are willing to go above and beyond to help you out.  Both of the doormen, Noel and Gary, were always willing to run down the street and hail a cab for us.  

They have a free breakfast each morning and free snacks 24 hours a day, which we definitely indulged in.  I am missing the cappuccino machine.  We were told that in the past, they have offered a discount to eat at the restaurant at the hotel.  They are supposed to be starting this again sometime in the future.  

We were only supposed to stay for four nights, however, our flight was canceled twice.  The staff was able to keep us in the same room or move us to another room during the week of Christmas, so that we didn't have to find another hotel.

The hotel is beautiful, our rooms were large, and it is in a great location for walking.  

I only have positive things to say about Hotel Elysee and would highly recommend staying here.  It is a little spendy, but I got a Black Friday deal, which saved me 25%.  I wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

title: Excellent service
text: I have stayed at the Elysse by Library Hotel Collection many time over the past ten  years and the service has always been exceptional. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of MOMA, shopping and dining.

title: Another Library Collection Gem
text: We previously stayed at the sister hotel, Casablanca, which we loved. When there was no room at the inn for a return visit, we turned to the Elysee. From the moment Daniel spent half an hour helping me to book our ideal room, I knew that this place was just as special. Relaxed atmosphere, helpful and attentive staff, lounge with complimentary refreshments, and an inviting, homely decor. The whole place is also really quiet, except for the a/c heating was a bit intrusive.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: A really lovely small hotel, which is exactly what I was hoping for. Excellent service, very clean, European feel. Great location. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely go back. It is a bit dated but that is more than compensated for with all the positives.

title: Gorgeous hotel
text: We were visiting from the suburbs to see a magic show (Chamber Magic) that was close to Hotel Elysee. Parking was easy, as was check-in. This was a classy hotel in a great location. Breakfast was delicious. The elevator is slow, which is to be expected.  It was my husband’s birthday and we were upgraded to a balcony room.  It was huge and spotless. We will absolutely return.

title: lovely, warm European style hotel
text: This was the most comfortable and pleasant hotel we've stayed in NYC - and it was reasonably priced (for NYC). We upgraded to a larger room with a sofa and patio, which was worth it. They had a great breakfast and snacks all day! And the staff were so helpful. They appear to have many repeat visitors and we will now be the same. So much nicer than the big chains or modern but sterile high rises.

title: Quiet comfort and convenience
text: Solid and super quiet.  Imagine going to NYC and sleeping well, not hearing any sirens or trucks, and waking up totally refreshed.  Well welcome to hotel Elysee.  We booked 2Queens and found the room plenty spacious. The hotel is historic and therefore solidly built. No slamming doors. No sounds from folks above or next to us - supremely quiet!!!  The staff was very kind and helpful. Free drinks, coffee, and snacks throughout the day.  Functional wifi.  Full cable tv (no Netflix).  Awesome dinner at Monkey Bar which is like a 1950s retro steakhouse with awesome food/drinks/class/service — book early or you will be stuck with a 5pm or 9pm slot.  Highly recommend.   I’ve stayed in almost every Marriott and Hilton in NYC and I can’t even remember those stays.  Highly recommend this Hotel - I will be back.  Five stars.

title: Big fancy rooms, nice boutique in great location
text: A grand old dame in very nice shape, near Park Ave.  Room was on 11th floor right next to elevator, but we never heard it because there's an entry hallway in room that gives privacy & quiet. Barely heard traffic outside. Hotel felt like a high-end private club.  Room was spacious, had chandelier and higher end decor & fixtures. Shower pressure could've been a little stronger. Great club level on 2nd floor that offers free snacks & beverages (not sure hrs, but open every time we went there). Very short walk to Rock Ctr, St Patricks, Central Park, and endless other iconic destinations (even Times Sq). Neighborhood was quiet, for Manhattan, and felt very safe. Attentive staff.  Price was only a few dollars more than a mediocre mid-town (36th) budget chain shoebox-sized room we stayed at earlier during our trip.  Elysee has a well deserved legendary reputation.

title: Regal hotel with a retro cool restaurant.
text: Wow just wow. From the service to the beautiful room it was wonderful. A regal hotel. The Monkey restaurant/ bar will take you back in time. What a retro hip cool vibes. We didn’t get a chance to eat there this time. We will be back and make sure we got reservations.

title: A Touch of Class in So Many Ways
text: This lovely, quiet and historic hotel in the heart of the upper east side of Manhattan, is simply an oasis. With large rooms - mine even had a huge patio, and a wonderful lobby staff and service, you feel right at home in its elegant decor. I've stayed at two other Library Hotel Collection properties previously, and Hotel Elysee was just as good. Plus the add day refreshments and super late check out (1:00) are a bonus.

title: It is like home
text: It is like coming home.  Such a warm welcome from the delightful staff.  So good to hear the Monkey Bar is opening soon!  Lovely safe little hotel.  Great dining across the street.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The lounge on the second floor is a welcome retreat to read and have a light breakfast.

title: a French hotel in NYC
text: Large rooms; friendly and helpful staff.  They called the day prior to arrival to see if we needed anything.  I asked for both rooms  close together and they accommodated.   The atmosphere is very French.  Nice complimentary breakfast.

title: Simply elegant
text: Simply lovely. We had a Junior Suite which provided us lots of space to stretch out and relax.   Great views from windows on three sides!   The staff are welcoming and helpful.  The lounge was a nice place to relax with a cup of coffee or tea.

title: A magical place
text: Beautiful spacious room with comfortable beds and the best sheets. Quiet, cozy, and magical place in NYC. The staff were all lovely people and the room was spotless each day. We loved the library lounge. The all day snacks and perfect coffee and treats in the morning with my favorite newspapers was such a delight! We will be back to stay again. Thank you!

title: An oasis in the heart of the city
text: This was our second stay here this year, and again it was excellent! The room is very comfortable, the ambiance is old world, the staff are helpful and friendly (we appreciated the advice on locations to watch the fireworks), and the second floor library with its refreshments available at all hours was an oasis during busy days. We have already booked again for this fall.

title: Fabulous stay!
text: This most elegant hotel was the first leg our our holiday and the minute we entered it, i knew i had chosen well. It is so elegant and the room was just immaculate. But what sets this hotel apart from others is the sheer humanity of the people who work there. The care they put into their guests is beyond the call of duty. Erica the fabulous lady who makes sure the lounge runs smoothly with it's free drinks, snacks and lovely breakfast pastries is quite a wonderful human being and thank you for the lovely chats we had where we even got a bit teary. Gary the doorman who sat with me outside in the evening when i could not sleep. Our talks where just true and honest and Sir you are a true gentleman, as was Carlos the other night doorman who opened the lounge for me to get drinks at 3am! Our room was kept spotlessly clean but we never saw a cleaning lady, thanks for that and i hope you got your few dollars we left you. The interior of the hotel is so classy, as i am admiring the wall paper  and touched it i realised it was actually brocade fabric, how good can it get? We left at 5am for the airport and had hugs with Erica and Carlos as we left. I was so sorry to leave, our 5 days of little heaven was not enough but i hope to return one day, i really could not imagine wanting to stay anywhere else if i visit New York ever again. Superb to say the least!

title: The best is here!
text: I always enjoy staying at the Elysee; the rooms are well-kept; the service is always good; any issues are resolved promptly.  I'm sure it will be even better when the Monkey Bar next door re-opens later this year.

title: An oasis in the noise of the city!
text: Lovely, comfortable hotel with loads of history.  Looking forward to returning when the on-site bar/restaurant (Monkey Bar) reopens. Hotel’s Club Room, serving light breakfast and all day coffee, snacks etc. was great. Everyone employees couldn’t be nicer or more helpful.  Will return a third time!

title: European Elegance
text: Staying at the Hotel Elysee is like staying with family. I should know, I’ve been staying there for 20 years.  It’s an elegant, European experience in the heart of Manhattan.  The front desk staff is knowledgeable, professional, generous, kind & welcoming.

title: We Shall Return
text: For the past twenty four years my brothers and our wives have spent an extended weekend in New York. Each time we select a different hotel and have never repeated the choice. Next year may very well be different. The Hotel Elysee is the best hotel we have stayed at over the past two-plus decades Every element that makes a hotel great was there - from the genuine hospitality of the entire staff, the  comfort but not over stuffy or too severe accommodations of our rooms, and the offerings and more than ample lounge on the second floor. The Hotel Elysee is a real gem and refuge in the middle of New York.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Excellent staff! They are always helpful with ready answers to all our needs. The 2nd floor is a gem for breakfast and any rime of the day coffee or tea. The rooms are comfortable and the beds are very good.

title: You’ll Love It
text: Absolutely the best hotel in New York City. It has everything you want including a dedicated staff who anticipate all you wants. I love the second floor hospitality room especially since my husband is a very early riser and I like to sleep in. It’s a great place for him to go.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Great boutique hotel in well-located area.
Very friendly , helpful staff.
The second floor lounge was a nice bonus. 
Coffee, fruit, yogurt, sodas, sweets….. all fresh and nicely presented. 
This was our second stay here. It won’t be our last.

title: Excellent place and great value
text: Stayed here for 4 days recently based on reviews here on TripAdvisor.  It did not disappoint.  We had a king suite for my wife, teen daughter and myself and did not feel cramped.  The 2nd floor lounge is a great feature as it is quiet, spacious and well stocked with snacks and refreshments.  Hotel is close to many mid town attractions.  The staff was capable and friendly.  I will stay here on future trips to the city.

title: Ottimo hotel Midtown Manhattan
text: Ottimo hotel, piuttosto piccolo, ma intimo. Ben arredato anche se avrebbe bisogno di un po’ di manutenzione. La stanza è di dimensioni accettabili visto che siamo a New York, solo il bagno è veramente minuto anche se molto bello, è tutto in marmo. Ho apprezzato la club room del 2 piano, un luogo accogliente e molto rilassante dopo prendere una caffè veloce la mattina con un ottima macchina Lavazza, o un te a pomeriggio. La posizione è perfetta per me, tra la Madison e Park avenue, molto centrale,  ma soprattutto lontana dal rumore di queste due grandi strade.

title: Amazing Stay with Incredible Service and Location!
text: The staff was incredible!  They reached out prior to our arrival to identify opportunities to improve our stay with help with reservations/tickets.  When we had an issue with the air conditioner, they made accommodations to help resolve the issue quickly.  In addition, the hospitality room was a very nice touch and much appreciated for having an opportunity for a drink/snack when necessary.  Overall, we had a great stay and would highly recommend Hotel Elysee to anyone visiting New York.

title: Business Trip
text:
European style hotel is an oasis in Midtown.  Staff is exceptionally friendly and courteous.

Plenty of hotels that are larger, more well known, and much more expensive nearby.

My “go to” for 25 years

title: 2nd visit as great as the 1st!!!
text: Everyone from the front desk to house keeping made us feel welcome & appreciated. Very positive good energy. I love the size of the hotel and the great old fashioned & comfortable ambiance...like someone's home!!

title: Mid-week theater night complemented by the perfect hotel room
text: We found the perfect boutique hotel for mid-town.  It was a wonderful (actually oversized) room and value.  The lounge was a perfect respite providing refreshment and an ideal light breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

title: Charming Old world hotel
text: We had a couple of issues with AC and no working mini fridge but they fixed the AC and provided us with another fridge. It’s a charming old world hotel with very friendly staff and an awesome library/breakfast/snack room on 2nd floor. It’s really central to many places and the room was quiet.

title: One Of The Best Value Hotels In New York
text:
It’s difficult in NY to find a perfect location, one that’s safe with lovely rooms that won’t break the bank. Did I mention that for a nominal price you get a great continental breakfast, unlimited water, snacks and cappuccinos?  
I’ve stayed here many times. Part of the Library Collection where the other 3 hotels are in different parts of the city. 
I do not work for the hotel. I just love the fact that I’m made to feel like family whenever I come to NY.

title: Lovely hotel in the heart of the City
text:
My husband and I stayed for two nights while celebrating our Anniversary and we had a great experience from check it to check out. When we arrived around 11:30am, we were unexpectedly pleased to find that our room was already available for check in. The room was spacious with two big windows that let in a ton of light. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were WAY too soft for my liking. The hotel is on a quiet street so we didn't hear the typical NYC noise all night which we appreciated. 
The club room on the second floor was a nice perk...there are snacks, coffee, soda and water available all day. The only thing missing was a carafe of hot water to make tea. There were plenty of assorted tea bags available but no hot water. 
The doormen were all super nice and helpful...one recommended the Greek restaurant across the street so we had dinner there one night and it was excellent.
We typically stay closer to Times Square and this hotel is a bit of a walk (about 20-25 minutes) from the heart of Broadway/Times Square. But it is closer to Central Park and the streets are less crowded and quieter so it was a good trade off. 
Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely stay here again next time we are in the city!

title: Best Little Hotel in NYC
text: We love the hotel, it is our go to place to stay while in NYC.  The staff is excellent and alway helpful.   Our desk clerk Greg was most helpful.  He was able to direct us to resturants in the neighborhood and several places in the city,

title: Class and Convenience
text:
Lovely property; accommodating staff; quiet and convenient location! If they had a “rewards” program, I would book all my NY travelers here!  And you actually GET something for the “resort” fee…all day access
to refreshments in the Club Room, and gym access nearby.

title: Best hotel stay ever!
text: My daughter and I visited for a few days to celebrate her birthday, and it was one of the best experiences we’ve ever had at a hotel. The staff made us feel at home and we’re very accommodating, the rooms felt like we were stepping back in history but with modern amenities, and the lounge had the drinks and snacks that kept us going as we walked miles around the city. My friend had stayed here a few times before and raved about it, so we thought we’d check it out, and now I see what she was talking about! I definitely plan on staying here again, and I hope the next time, they will have been able to bring back the wine and hors d’oeuvres! 😊 Thank you for a wonderful and memorable stay. I see why Tennessee Williams lived here for so long!

title: Consistently excellent
text: We have stayed at the Elysee many, many times and will continue to visit whenever we are in New York.  On our most recent visit, our room was clean and comfortable, the hotel location was perfect and the staff were warm, friendly and helpful.

title: At last!
text: Finally had the chance to take our trip to Hotel Elysee after COVID disrupted our plans for March, 2020. We were NOT disappointed! Everyone was so helpful and friendly helping us utilize our credit from our cancelled trip AND we received an upgrade to a Junior Suite. The location was fantastic and we will definitely be back.

title: Great visit
text: Very convenient location, close to several subway stations. In midtown but somewhat removed from the craziness of actually being in midtown. Very friendly and helpful staff, their lounge/refreshment area was a lifesaver. Couldn’t recommend the hotel more.

title: Fair
text: The hotel is very pricey for that area.  The room itself is small and is difficult to regulate the temperature.  There was no coffee pot.  I was brought a coffee pot that was broken.  Then told if they brought me coffee, it would be $5.  I was brought another coffee pot that worked.  It’s unique but dated.  I understand they are trying to preserve the historical appearance, but it does need some updating.  The bar and restaurant were still closed with a lot of construction in front.  I would not stay there again.  I would choose a place more updated.

title: Best Hotel Experience
text:
This hotel is the simply the best it’s world beating 
The reception team are so well run , and operate calmly and professionally at all times 
Breakfast pastries are served by a long-standing team member who makes sure everything is smooth 
The Leadership  of this hotel does an outstanding job maintaining the standard .

A few more charge points in the rooms at some point please

title: GREAT HOTEL!!
text: Great hotel and wonderful staff!! Rooms were HUGE compared to other NYC hotels. Very clean. Elevator worked fine. Loved the 2nd floor lounge for our family. Nick was awesome! We will stay here again and again.

title: Beautiful hotel with need of restoration
text: I love hotels like the Elysee but it urgently needs to have taking care of the antique furniture, at least polish them from time to time. Joseph was an extraordinary member of the hotel. Uncomfortable for dining in.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel
text: It was wonderful from the moment we pulled up in our car to the moment we walked out the front door and our car was waiting.  Our accommodations were very nice and the service was excellent. The staff was most attentive to our needs.  The hotel is in a great location, making getting around easy.  This was our second stay and we will be back again.

title: Great place to stay!
text: The hotel is in an excellent location, and the rooms are very comfortable.  The staff is outstanding, always  friendly and very helpful.  The second floor is open all day with coffee and snacks, and chairs and couches where you can relax outside of your room. A great place to stay!

title: Outstanding hotel staff and stay
text:
Absolutely amazing hotel with thoughtful, caring, and exceptional staff from our reservation call, remembering us from that call at check-in, early check-in, a spectacular room, wonderful breakfast and respite snack area, cleaning crew, bellman getting our taxi, etc. etc. This place is top-notch. Great location. The best part is the outstanding crew that will take care of you.
Thank you so very much for such a special stay for my daughter‘s graduation trip, just mom and Josie.

title: Stay Elysee!
text: The Hotel Elysee is an incredible hotel in NYC.  I have lived in and visited Big Town for more than fifty years and I have had the opportunity to stay in many hotels in the City; from The Chelsea to The Edison to The Plaza to The Pierre to The Mark. The Elysee rises above all.   The Elysee’s strength is made of the ladies and gentlemen who are there and say hello, take care of your luggage, serve you coffee, take care of your housekeeping, help you with directions and smile and help.  And smile and help!  We stay at Elysee!

title: Boutique Hotel in Mid Town
text:
Fantastic Boutique hotel in the heart of the Central Park district.  Service was fantastic, Conceirge floor open 24 hours was very convenient and well stocked.  I cannot over emphasize the service by the front desk team which helped us with five rooms, people arriving at different times, canceled flights, and more.  

The hotel itself reminds one of being in the heart of Paris.  Rooms are quant and well appointed.  Our young adults really enjoyed them,  Highly recommend.

title: Mid week visit to the Big Apple Hotel Elysee
text: We love the location, the size of the rooms, the very efficient and friendly staff, the breakfast and all day snacks. Looking forward to the reopening of the Monkey Bar and evening wine and snacks. We will be back!

title: Great location between Park and Madison
text:
The location between Park and Madison made for a short walk to Central Park, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, The Rockefeller Center, and Times Square.

The Lounge on the second floor had terrific espresso coffee, some fruit, hardboiled eggs, and a broad assortment of pastries each morning. Bottled water and soft drinks were available all day. While they do not serve alcohol, the helpful attendant was able to provide wine glasses and a corkscrew for the bottle of wine we purchased across the street.

Staff, from the door men, to reception, to housekeeping, were always friendly and helpful with suggestions for restaurants and things to see.

We had a street view room on the seventh floor and I was concerned about noise, but it was not a problem.

The “Old World” charm of the building and furnishings made us feel like we were in Europe.

title: Mt favorite.
text: Hotel Elysee is my favorite place to stay in New York. It is a quiet retreat in the city. The rooms are comfortable and traditional, with modern amenities but also with a warmth and  charm that I love. The lounge for guests is a wonderful feature, with a good espresso machine and Continental breakfast, as well as water and snacks throughout the day. The staff is quiet and competent. Though no longer family-owned, I think, Elysee has done a good job keeping up the standard repeat guests love so much.

title: Noisy A/C & street noise, run-down rooms, rusty pipes
text:
Crashing of shattering glass at midnight as garbage collectors slammed trash into trucks, noisy a/c (old units) rust in pipes caused water in the bathtub to be brown. Bedding & curtains look like they haven't been replaced since the 90s.
The club lounge is great and a nice respite after a day out in the city. Much better hotels in NYC for the price.

title: Charming small hotel with tons of character!
text:
If you look like hotels with character, this is a great choice. It has a charm not often found in larger chain hotels. 
Pleasant staff, room and hotel were very clean, and our room floor 12a was exceptionally quiet, with zero street noise. 
The hotel offers a complimentary selection of snacks and beverages, and a light breakfast in the morning.
My only hesitation in recommending it more was the very slow internet connection- measured only 20 Mbps as my best speed over two days-luckily I was there on business!

title: A romantic stay with a great location.
text:
Stayed for an engagement weekend and couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay. The hotel has old world European charm and is in a great location.  You
can easily walk to some of NYC’s best restaurants and Central Park. We had a room with a terrace which is rare for this price point in the city. Unfortunately, the restaurant was closed and there is no room service, but the second floor lounge had complimentary snacks and coffee. The staff were all helpful and there’s a good deal for valet parking that beats any garage. The hotel is very romantic for a special stay.

title: Old and Tired
text: Dated hotel. Should’ve been renovated a decade ago. Way too much money for the experience. Location is good that’s the only redeeming feature.  Would be ok value at half the price.  Food and beverage sucked.

title: Excelente
text: La gente del hotel fue muy amable ! Hizo que nuestra estancia fuera muy confortable! La habitación espaciosa , y con todas las comodidades . La ubicación es perfecta . Y a pesar de estar en zona céntrica el hotel es silencioso

title: This is a great hotel!
text: We just completed a weekend stay with multiple rooms. The staff is wonderful and worked to accommodate our every need. We had some travel delays due to the current crazy airline situation and they worked with us even on that. There is a lounge that provides a continental breakfast, along with snacks and soft drinks during the day. This was a life saver for our large group as everyone arrived on different schedules. The location is great, near lots of things but still off the direct path. You can walk to broadway shows or up to Central Park. We first stayed here 25 years ago and were happy to see that it is still a lovely oasis in the heart of NYC. Thank you Hotel Elysee for making our trip great!

title: Amazing oasis in New New York Centrally Located
text: This is a hidden gem in New York City.  Old word charm with excellent service. Front desk manager Jacob was knowledgeable and very helpful.  Continental breakfast was excellent and the the club room was warm and welcoming with great snacks and refreshment were excellent

title: Felt like home.
text: Lovely people working at the hotel!!  The bed was super comfortable. The lady at the breakfast was particularly capable and very kind. I appreciated the flexibility with my reservation since my plane was delayed for 8 hours.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: They were extremely welcoming and the service was excellent. The location was perfect for seeing the sites of New York. The Library and Lounge was wonderful for relaxing and they were stocked with plenty of drinks and snacks.

title: Charming NYC hotel
