text: A wonderful hotel that is now our new first choice for NYC hotels. The staff was wonderful and I loved the 2nd floor lounge.  The pastries, yogurt & warm hard boiled eggs made for a perfect breakfast. The room is so pleasant that sometimes we should sit up there in the evenings before going to our room.   The room was clean and charming with daily maid service.  Two minor complaints: the queen bed is much smaller than a normal queen and I would not chose it again.  Also, being an older hotel there were few outlets for charging devices.  The outlet next to the bed was near the floor behind the night table and was so loose the plug kept falling out.  I was told that new lamps would soon provide better charging options. I look forward to my next stay.

title: Another happy experience at Elysee!
text:
We have stayed there in the past and return when we are in NYC. It is
a pleasant experience.
There were no grab bars in the bathroom. As senior citizens this is important.
Love the "library" in a.m. - coffee, fresh fruit, yogurt, breakfast treats and newspapers.

title: Don’t miss out on this experience!
text: Absolutely wonderful!  We are repeat guests—5th time—and are delighted by every aspect on each visit.   Rooms are wonderfully appointed, staff is friendly and attentive, and service is great!  Hesitate to be to effusive as it may limit availability when we wish to visit again!

title: Great stay!
text: As usual the stay was top notch in all aspects. From the front desk, to housekeeping, to the way you are treated in the Breakfast room. Every employee we met I would hire in a minute, they impressed me that much.

title: Long awaited Return
text: Great to be back at the Elysee! Impeccable service. Great central location. Continental breakfast and all day snacks were a terrific convenience. Staff was wonderfully helpful. We were able to book a suite with help from a credit due due to a canceled trip during the pandemic, and we really enjoyed the extra space and amenities!  Looking forward to coming again soon.

title: Excellence in a relaxed mode!
text: The staff was responsive when I requested having my room serviced asap as I was expecting a guest!  The services provided in THE CLUB ROOM  , continental breakfast, and snacks during the day greatly add to the convenience and opportunity to meet other guests.  The hotel offers old charm and is sparkling clean. Definitely my favorite in NYC and Europe!

title: Always a great visit!
text: This was my second time visiting this hotel. Another great experience!! Nice rooms, great amenities, and the best staff. Made reservations and then updated restaurant for us when our flights were delayed.  Thanks for making our crazy travel day brighter!

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: This hotel was reminiscent of older European hotels  that we have stayed in.  The rooms are good sized for New York.  If you are looking for a glitzy modern hotel this is not the hotel for you.  The hotel was built in 1926 and the rooms are are decorated in traditional furniture pieces that are showing wear. That being said the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.  The amazing staff and customer service more than make up for the age of the hotel.  The staff goes out of their way to make sure that your stay is a great experience. The second floor lounge is a definite perk with continental breakfast and snacks during the day.  The location of the hotel is superb with restaurants and shopping at it’s doorstep.  Try Cellini across the street for excellent Italian food.

title: Love the location and the service
text:
This was our fourth stay at Elysee and our 10th or 12th at the Library Collection properties. So obviously we love their hotels and service. This was our first stay since 2019, pre-Covid, so we were pleasantly surprised to see that staffing and service levels were at pre-Covid status, despite all the problems the hospitality industry has had with staffing. The staff is one of the reasons we go back again and again,  but we also love this location and the rooms are good sized and well-appointed and clean. Everyone, from the front desk to the bellmen to the lounge staff to the housekeepers delivers. 
This time we also ordered the floral arrangement to be delivered to the room, and while it was expensive, it was worth every penny. It was gorgeous and while a few of the blooms (peonies) faded during our stay, the entire arrangement was looking good and smelling wonderful for our entire 5 night stay.

title: This hotel was perfect then crisis made them better .
text:
This hotel was perfect , then our trip went sideways and they were even better ! Beautiful , big , comfortable rooms . Decent price . A bit of an issue with breakfast room due to COVID but they will improve when they can . 
Staff uniformly pleasant and helpful . 
Then I ended up in the hospital ( COVID and , more importantly ) something triggered by COVID ) . The guys at the hotel stepped up . Extensions , room changes etc. , all done with grace . NEVER would we come to NYC and stay elsewhere . Big , big thanks guys !❤️

title: Comfortable midtown European style hot
text: Room was spacious , comfortable and clean. Enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast. We brought our own wine to the evening lounge- very nice. Staff very friendly and responsive.  Nice walk to shopping and Broadway theaters and Lincoln Center.

title: Great location, nice hotel, some complaints though
text: The hotel was lovely. Most of the staff was lovely. There were two employees who were incredibly unhelpful however, and just said no to anything we asked for no matter what it was which was very strange. Also anyone staying there needs to be warned that the staff can almost NEVER get you a cab, don’t even bother asking.

title: Charming hotel in midtown
text: As usual, it was a delightful stay at Elysee.My family and I always enjoy the location, the rooms and the lovely second floor lounge. Check in, check out, maid service, all went without a hitch. the rooms at the back are beautifully quiet. It's an old hotel, but the rooms seem fresh.  We'll be back.

title: A classic NYC boutique hotel experience
text: Subject to one minor issue, everything about our stay was excellent and we will definitely go back when we next visit NYC.  Check-in and checkout was easy, the doormen and Club Room staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms are large and clean, and the location is great-- walkable to the theater district, about 5 blocks to Central Park, and several subway stops within 3 blocks.  The continental breakfast in the Club Room was quite good, and having coffee, soft drinks and snacks there throughout the day was a treat.  My only quibble (and not enough of a problem to affect my 5 star rating) is that the TV in the living room of our suite was too small and we could not get good reception for several stations on that TV and the one in the bedroom.

title: Charming hotel with terrific staff
text: The staff are the standout here - friendly, accommodating and helpful. And they greet you each time you walk in or out, always smiling. They quickly found me a new room when my first didn't suit and even allowed me into the breakfast area early when I needed to grab something before leaving for the airport.  The shower is excellent, the bed nice and comfortable and the rooms are relatively quiet for NYC. I liked having a separate entry area with closet and desk and direct access to the bathroom, good if one person needs to get dressed early/come in late. Plus I love the location - near MOMA, shops on Madison and  5th and easy access to walk to Broadway. That being said, there are definitely areas needing improvement. The rooms need renovation/updating - the decor is tired, the blinds frayed and the upholstery had small rips and tears in it. The bathroom is modern but there is absolutely no space for toiletries and is too small and cramped. I liked the snack area on the 2nd floor - nice place to relax, great to grab something small.  However, calling what they serve first thing breakfast is maybe an overstatement - coffee is excellent but after that just packaged snack bars, hard boiled eggs, plain yogurt (no flavoured ones) and so-so pastries. Several people came in asking where to order the hot food and there isn't any.

title: Great service, clean and comfortable
text: I love the hotel and stay there every time I am in New York. I have not travelled to NYC since Covid began. We were offered an upgrade to a suite that was incredibly comfortable. The hotel staff are attentive to the needs of the guests, and go the extra mile. My only disappointment was the limited options at breakfast and afternoon.

title: still great
text: Our favorite New York City hotel for many years.  Location is great, staff is great, rooms are great. Terrific in every way .....  but they need to workout even just a couple of gluten-free alternatives for breakfast, there were no options at all on our recent visit, which really isn't good enough in this day-and-age.

title: Book a stay here
text:
Every aspect of my stay was excellent. The hotel was built in 1926 so you feel the flavor of the old but well preserved and inviting.
The staff was very helpful and maintenance did a great job. Of course the location was the best.
I highly recommend to make Elysee Hotel your next stay in NYC

title: No Other Place . . .
text:
It may seem selfish to say this in light of the misery occasioned by the Pandemic, but one of the things I missed most -- sorely so -- during the long shutdown was my frequent visits (for both business and pleasure) to Manhattan and my "second home" there: The Elysee, where I've been feeling "at home" over the course of three decades.

It was an abiding absence, on a deep level, and one I hope never to experience again.

What is it about The Elysee that instills such strong feelings of loyalty and belonging? The communal camaraderie of the Club Room breakfasts and evening receptions? The uniqueness of each room? The eclectic furnishings? The Monkey Bar? 

Yes.

 . . . But more than all of these combined it's The Elyse staff and management: from the attentive General Manager, to the expert Front Desk attendants, to the women who host the Club Room, to the helpful and vigilant Doormen, to the Housekeeping and Maintenance staffs: folks who've been there for years, know your name and your preferences, greet you with a smile, and engage you in conversation that's genuine.

There really is no other place like it. I wish everyone could experience it. And I thank them, All, for their hard work and sacrifices staying the course through a very difficult time and for being there, again and as always, just like family.

title: We love this hotel!
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Elysee several times and been pleased each time. The rooms are large for the prices. The beds are very comfortable. That staff is awesome - friendly and ever helpful. The location is relatively convenient. MOMA is just down 54th. We have been able to walk to Central Park, The Met, and Lincoln Center, and a subway stop is right around the corner. For the time being the breakfast is Covid-compromised as to offerings, but it was sufficient - and included.

title: Family visit for Columbia graduation
text: A favorite hotel for many years. The staff is simply amazing! It is our go to spot and location is superb. The rooms are classic style but the 2nd floor sets it apart. They have managed beautifully in spite of COVID restrictions . A home away from home

title: Wonderful Hospitality and Comfortable Rooms
text:
Very friendly staff.  Roomy rooms for Manhattan.  Great "library" lounge for guests with coffee, seltzers, light snacks, fruit.  Really nice.   

Very convenient location.   Short walk to Central Park, theaters, restaurants.

title: Very friendly, smaller hotel; great location
text: Great, quiet, friendly hotel in midtown.  Highly recommend.  The club room, available all day to guests and offering a complimentary continental breakfast, is a comfortable and enjoyable amenity.  I've stayed several times when in town on business and would definitely stay again - either for business or a personal trip.

title: Great Location and Service
text: The best hotel in Manhattan!  The ambiance is great and the service is always top notch.   Great location as well but feels out of the way. I always try to stay here whenever I'm visiting whether for work or pleasure.

title: Great front desk support
text:
I stayed at the Hotel Elysee on May 3.  Two people at the front desk named Nick and especially Jazzmine, were super helpful to me in holding an envelope for 36 hours ahead of a pickup, and then helping me to repack some office reports that I wanted to hand out to colleagues.  As an added flourish, Jazzmine even pulled out a ribbon and theatrically arranged the office papers ! Never before have I opened a package of investor presentations which looked so good !  

 I had no idea that a hotel front desk could be so super helpful !  Thanks, Elysee Team

title: Charming and Gracious
text: The Elysee is a charming, gracious hotel with artistic details and antique (or reproduction) furniture that add to the ambiance.  The staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful.  I appreciated the availability of fruit and snacks available throughout the day.  The hotel is in a great location - walking distance from Central Park, museums and shopping.  It is a good value for the price.  I recommend it.

title: An oasis in a busy city
text: We had a wonderful experience.  Staying at Hotel Elysee is a pleasure. Our room was lovely, the bed comfortable and we loved the 2nd floor lounge. The breakfast was perfect as was the setting. The location is an easy walk to Broadway and many fine restaurants as well as first class shopping. They also have valet parking, a plus in NYC!

title: Great hotel, great location, great price!
text:
We've stayed in NYC many times, and I think this is our favorite hotel.  

First, the location is great, walking distance to a lot of the main sites.  

Second, the staff were all VERY friendly and helpful.

Third, the room was great.  We were in town for a wedding and chose to stay here vs. the hotel were it was being held (in Chelsea). We paid less than that hotel, for a room that was double the size (we had a king-suite).  It's always great to have extra space, and in NYC that's hard to come by without spending a fortune.

The 2nd floor lounge is nice too.  Good place to just chill.

If there's a downside, there's no bar onsite.  It's been closed for renovation but is supposed to be opened soon.  

Not sure when we'll be back in NYC, but this will be our go-to from now on.

title: Our NYC fave
text: Hotel Elysee is one of our favorite NYC retreats. We have a favorite room with a small separate sitting area. We love the 2nd floor common area for a snack or continental breakfast - but in truth we do miss the afternoon wine and cheese. And we look forward to the Monkey Bar opening again

title: excellent stay
text:
A very friendly atmosphere where the excellent staff does everything to feel you most welcome.
The hotel is very clean .In the middle of New Yorks  center it is a very good advice for a short or longer stay.

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL AND SERVICE
text: Everything was first-class at this hotel. The room was comfortable  and sizable, the service was amazing, the location was great, the breakfast room was special with coffee and treats available all day. What a great surprise the Elysee was. We will look forward to returning to this wonderful hotel.

title: Home
text:
I travel monthly to NYC both for business and occasionally with full family in tow.
Daughter studies at NYC University and we try to also visit bi monthly.
We very much enjoy staying at the Elysee Hotel.
The finest NY restaurants are all in walking distance.
The location is ideal, the suites are large and comfortable.
BUT we stay at this hotel because of the staff,
Everyone is pleasant, courtesy and helpful.
It’s our home away from home!

title: A throwback experience
text:
Cute boutique hotel, no room in bathroom for toiletries. No USB ports to charge electronics. Very difficult to access outlets  to plug anything in.
No restaurant or room service.  
I don’t believe I will stay again.

title: Few days in NY
text: The room, the living room, and the porch were all perfect for a few days with three friends meeting in New York. The club room was well used and the icing on the cake! All of the staff were very helpful and even suggested a restaurant across the street for our first night when we were too tired to go far away – it was delicious!

title: Great visit
text: Great to be back in NYC and stay at The Elysee - comfortable rooms, warm, welcoming and helpful staff.  Continental breakfast in the morning and snacks all day in the Lounge!  So happy The Elysee survived Covid!

title: A Keeper
text: This hotel provides a great value for an NYC stay. A fair price with great service and good location. The staff are outstanding - from the doorman to the front desk to housekeeping and the hardworking team that keeps the lounge running all day. Location is excellent for exploring much which is walkable, it's easy to catch a cab or ride the subway, and the building is in the middle of a quieter block. All seems to be well managed both operations and maintenance. The complimentary all-day lounge is a very nice feature. One little word to the wise, it's a smaller hotel and just now is fronted with scaffolding, so it appears pretty unassuming at first glance. Rest assured a pleasant stay awaits. It is not the most modern lodging but it appears updates are made when needed, it has been maintained and is cleaned very well. The staff exude a pleasant helpful culture throughout. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful visit.
text: Very friendly and professional service throughout the hotel.  We especially appreciated the service provided by the ladies in the breakfast lounge.  Loved reading the newspapers provided and relaxing with coffee and donuts in the morning.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great European style boutique hotel
text: My go to hotel in NYC. Rooms are comfy, staff is welcoming and the location is perfect. The lounge area is a welcome place to relax for continental breakfast or just to relax any time of the day. Hopefully the Monkey Bar restaurant and lounge will reopen soon.

title: Lovely getaway in NYC
text: We came by a reservation at Hotel Elysee accidentally, as our friends were staying there so we made a reservation.  We were instantly pleased with the friendliness of the staff, the location, and the sweet accommodations in mid town Manhatten.  Valet service was simple and efficient.  A highlight was the lovely lounge area for guests - as traveling with other people, it is often difficult to coordinate plans in the room.  An added bonus that coffee and snacks were also available for guests.  We will be back.  A gem.

title: All staff, the absolute greatest! That set the tone for everything else to follow.
text: Incredibly responsive, helpful, friendly staff at absolutely every level, every day of our 5 day stay. The room was spacious and well attended to. We needed help with our multiple computers and smart phones; they had it solved totally and quickly. Lovely to enjoy the lounge area any time of day and always sparkling clean. Wonderful stay for the two of us.

title: Excellent service and Cody atmosphere
text: Excellent service and wonderful staff. Cozy atmosphere. Looking forward to the return of pre-covid amenities such as breakfast and the wine and cheese cocktail hour event. Most importantly, the staff is friendly, attentive and highly professional.

title: Long time guest of Hotel Elysee
text: I have been staying at the Hotel Elysee since the mid '60s and it is my hotel of choice in NYC. The staff is terrific, the rooms charming, and the location is very convenient. I would happily recommend the hotel to others!

title: Hotel Elysee by Library Hotel Collection
text: One feels at home here with  the “ residential” feel of this hotel- very friendly staff, spacious rooms and the continental breakfast and all day snacks and beverages is a real plus,The location is wonderful and I appreciate the 1:00pm check out time . It was highly recommended by a friend and we have booked next month again. This is an ideal home away from home hotel

title: Good stay despite poor breakfast
text: We enjoyed again the excellent location  the good executive  luxe room and the friendly service ofthe staff, particularly the front office. However, the breakfast in the lounge is very poor and the service almost absent.

title: It was perfect
text: It was perfect.  Simply beautiful hotel, the staff was pleasant, quick service, and helpful.  The location is great for walking to everything I wanted to see.  We will be staying here the next time we are in New York.

title: Relax like you have travelled back in time
text: We had a great time at Hotel Elysee, the staff was super helpful and really nice, everything was clean to the highest standards. The only point not up to their usual standards were the poor selection at breakfast (particularly if you have any food allergies). Hopefully they will return to their normal that was disrupted by Covid. By the way, the hotel's location is excellent, about 20-minute walk to Central Park, Time Square, and MoMA is even closer.

title: Highly Recommend! Charming Hotel in the heart of the city
text: Hotel Staff was genuine and friendly. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and pleasant. It is a beautiful hotel. Quaint and historic. The bed was so comfy and we loved the pillows. The location was perfect for us. Close to Central Park, 5th Ave and the theater district. There are subway stations within a 5-7 min walk. They are also linked to a car service and can arrange for you to be picked up and dropped off at the airport. They can also get you a cab when needed. I can't say enough about this hotel. I will definitely be staying there every time I visit the city.

title: Hotel Elysee-stay here for an incredible experience you didn’t think existed anymore.
text: This is my third time staying at Hotel Elysee.  I wish I could live here in this hotel. ☺️.  Everyone on the staff is so accommodating, pleasant, and helpful.  This hotel is a real jewel!  Beautifully appointed, homey yet sophisticated…I can’t say enough.

title: Facility
text:
Great location in Midtown. Hotel tired and needs upgrade. No on site restaurant, cafe, lounge. The second floor area is a nothing area. The budget hotels offer full breakfasts or 3/4 breakfasts. Hate to sound negative but it’s true. Too much competition.

Wouldn’t return.

title: A perfect stay
text: Everything about this hotel was wonderful.  The room, the location, the staff, the comfy bed, the marble bathroom, the quiet, the comp snacks and soft drinks.  Everything just perfect.  And when we got home, my brother-in-law asked where we stayed, and when I said "Hotel Elysee" he shouted, "That's where we always stay!"

title: sister trip
text: Very accomodating, friendly and welcoming staff.  The Front desk people were kind and helpful. The doorman was also very nice. We enjoyed  the 2nd floor concierge suite as it was a nice touch.  Fabulous location.

title: European style hotel
text: This hotel is lovely and reminds me of the charming hotels we stayed in while visiting Paris. Ouroom was large, comfortable and very quiet.   The staff made us feel as if we were guests in their home.  We will return whenever we’re in New York

title: Friendly, helpful staff
text: A small hotel in a prime location with a European vibe. Not flashy but clean and comfortable with a warm, excellent staff. All of our needs were met and the recommendations were helpful. We will definitely stay there next time we travel to NYC.

title: A hotel that was all we could wish for.
text: Great location. We enjoyed the second floor lounge which had snacks, soft drinks, and adequate breakfast items, although they don’t claim to serve breakfast.  It was a good place to interact with other guests.

title: Convenient Location with a Warm Welcome
text: The Elysée's friendly staff welcomed us.  Our well-appointed room was clean, comfortable, and quiet.  The included continental-style breakfast was enjoyable, and the break room was a pleasant gathering space for the six of us and our other guests.  This was our second visit, and we plan to stay again.   The hotel is most conveniently located.

title: Good place to stay while in the city.
text: Staff is always friendly and willing to help with information, dinner reservations, and transportation. We especially enjoy the second floor lounge for coffee and visiting with friends who are also staying at the hotel or other guests.

title: Disappointed
text:
Disappointed after staying here multiple times in the past.
Our room was hot…the air conditioning system doesn’t work well . They brought us a fan but refused to give us a discount for our second night stay.  Also…we were required to show vaccination cards after the mandate was lifted.
The tvs are primitive as well. They do not seem to update their rooms.
We will never be staying here again unfortunately.

title: Terrific! All of your staff is OUTSTANDING!
text:
I have been staying at The Hotel Elysee for many years!
The staff at the front desk, go out of their way to welcome new guests, when they arrive, and offer all sorts of helpful information, about NYC! Your doormen, the staff in the library, and the women who service your guest rooms, are all warm, and very helpful!
My only negative comments are about your guests rooms! They are ‘tired’ and need to be refurbished! New wall paper, curtains, and carpets would give your hotel ‘shot in the arm’!! And, it’s time for new art work through out the entire hotel!!!
And, let’s get all of your front desk staff in matching ties and pocket scarfs!

title: Our favorite NYC hotel
text: Our favorite NYC hotel. They’ve done so much to successfully survive the pandemic. So grateful to be back last week to see our front desk, door, and hospitality friends. Amenities coming back ❤️❤️❤️ Hotel Elysee.

title: Small gem in the middle of the city!
text: We have loved staying at the Hotel Elysée for many years. It's almost like home away from home!  The front desk is always so helpful whether it is with dinner reservations or calling their brokers for Broadway shows!  It is a small boutique hotel with a fabulous location in the middle of midtown!  The lounge on the 2nd floor is a great place to gather with friends or family in small groupings for a continental breakfast or wine and cheese at night.  Highly recommend!

title: Very good stay
text:
Everything was pretty good. Staff is amazing and welcoming. The only small suggestion for next time- mattress seemed very uncomfortable this stay around. Otherwise we had a fabulous time. 
Thank you and I look Forward to another stay with you

title: Weekend getaway
text: The hotel is lovely. The room was cozy, yet comfortable, with a nice bathroom. It was also quiet and clean. The club floor amenities were terrific, and the staff were kind and helpful. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We loved our stay, the only issue was the check in as we didn't have the vaccination card ready - please have it ready when you are checking in! Some hotels are very strict about it, whereas others are lifted the requirement. Room is comfortable and the addition of the lounge is perfect if you like coffee!

title: Great trip!
text: LOVE this hotel! Came for a quick weekend to NYC. The staff are incredibly friendly and the lounge is a huge plus. Was able to get breakfast, snacks and plenty of water.  We were very close to central park and ran the park in the morning. Many restaurants are nearby too.   The bed was comfortable and shower was good.

title: The place to stay in NYC
text: This was my first time at the Elysee and it definitely will NOT be the last. It is a lovely place where everything is right including, and especially, the friendly and attentive staff. My room was the quietest ever, impeccable, and furnished with old fashioned good taste. A very nice addition was the lounge with a library and very nice snacks and beverages. My only disappointment was that the famed Monkey Bar was not open. However, a friendly manager gave me and my companion a nice tour of the restaurant. I cannot wait to return and, hopefully, enjoy a drink or two at the Monkey.

title: Our Return to Elysee Excellence
text: This was a return to the Elysee post pandemic and we continue to love it for its central location and dedicated staff. The rooms are well appointed and clean as can be. We look forward to many future stays.

title: Annual trip to NYC
text:
Hotel Elysee is our go to hotel when we visit NYC.  For us, the location is far enough away from the bustle of Times Square, but close enough to walk to see our Broadway show.  The service is always the best.  We were disappointed that the breakfast was changed and scaled back to packaged goods and dry muffins.  We always enjoyed hoping down to the 2nd floor to get something to eat before we started our day. 
 Hopefully, this change is temporary and they will bring back the old breakfast offerings.

title: excellent - charming
text:
it was a great stay - service was  excellent - lovely housekeepers- greg and Jazzman at desk great 
everyone really - location great
great Breakfast recommendation from Greg 

Can t wait for Monkey Bar to open - sad to see it dark

title: College graduation gift
text: The perfect location for us,wonderful boutique hotel with lots of charm,fabulous food and wine store across the street,staff were warm and welcoming,rooms were large and comfortable. Also 5 blocks away was Moma Joes breakfast cart.The Best

title: First Class in Every Detail
text: I almost don't want to rave too much in case it causes difficulty in getting a future reservation :) However, I must say that Hotel Elysee never disappoints. I've had the pleasure of staying her many times and the level of service is consistently superior.  The front desk staff is always pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are impeccable. And the amenities are first class. The first time I stayed here was in 1996 when I brought my three teenagers for their first ever trip to NYC. I chose Hotel Elysee because of the location and size of the hotel. We were treated as valued guests from the moment we stepped in the lobby and this has been the case with every visit since.  I highly recommend this wonderful hotel. Just save a room for me!

title: 10 Minutes from Broadway
text:
Caring Staff. Beautiful Lounge on 2nd Floor
Close to All in Midtown & Broadway Theaters
Clean Rooms & Many Restaurants 
Parking Garage Right Next To Elysee 
Great Area, Quiet & Safe
Better Than Times Square

title: Great Location and Staff. Very clean.
text: We enjoyed our four night stay here because this hotel is well run, very clean with comfortable rooms and large bathrooms. The large elegant lounge is stocked with daily papers and a small library. Simple self-service breakfast fare. Good coffee. Post Covid the afternoon alcoholic drinks and snacks will be re-introduced. Above all, the hotel is in a great location.

title: Very satisfied with this hotel!
text: We were impressed, hotel was super clean and the room was clean and quiet, staff were responsive and very polite. Great customer service, great location. Pleasant stay overall, we will be back for sure!

title: Best hotel i have ever stayed in NY. WIll be back over and over actually as soon as April 2022
text:
great hotel
great service
great location 
friendly people
will definitely revisit and recommend. Staff were friendly, place was clear near all important sites i wanted to see, easy to walk and shop . Great location

title: The Hotel Elysee will always be our New York City go-to.
text: Hotel Elysee is wonderfully old school with spacious rooms and lovely amenities. Centrally located, it is in easy walking range of any number of super low key restaurants. The staff is attentive and responsive. The Hotel Elysee will always be our New York City go-to.

title: Always a treat to stay at Hotel Elysee
text:
We have stayed at the Hotel Elysee on numerous occasions and have ALWAYS had enjoyable experiences. The hotel is spotless and the staff is exemplary. Having coffee and snacks available throughout the day is a nice perk. The location is central to the city.
Can’t wait to return.

title: Excellent !
text: Love the Hotel Elysee !   It's in what I feel is in the perfect location, away from congested areas but within a short walk of central park rockefeller center and more.   Great choice for our stay and will be our go to for future trips.

title: Still a great place to stay
text: I have been staying at the Elysee for many years as has the rest of my family. We have recommended the Elysee to many of our friends as well. Convenient, good location, friendly staff, nice rooms. Boutique.

title: Gem of the city
text: Wonderful hotel. Beautiful and comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Excellent location and value.  Walking distance to many sites;shops;Central Park.  The hotel has a very European feel.  Nicely furnished. Very good lounge

title: HS reunion after 50+ years.  Long-time friends.  The staff made the experience enjoyable and comfortable.
text: Really committed staff.  Truly make guests feel comfortable and appreciated.  The room given to us caused my wife to experience unbearable claustrophobia, so the host found us a substitute that solved the problem and was very comfortable.

title: Bern there many times.  Reliably excellent.
text: This is a fine, small, reasonably priced, traditional hotel.  We have always been happy there.   Clean, friendly, well located.  The famous Monkey Bar is fun.  Nice restaurants across the street.  Never had a complaint.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: Hotel Elysee was fantastic!  The location is excellent and the staff were very kind and helpful.  Our rooms were clean and exactly as described.  The service was consistently excellent.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.  This hotel is a gem!

title: A good stay
text: I loved the hotel. Will definitely return. Housekeeping was outstanding. My room was always refreshed in a timely manner. That’s important to me. I only wish there was easier access to ice. Perhaps there would be a way to make some available on the 2nd floor. Sandra Mallory

title: Great location, friendly staff and terrific price for a two room suite!
text: Great bargain in terms of the location and price for a two room king suite.  Staff was friendly and helpful. The in-room amenities are a bit spare, likely due to COVID restrictions, but they provided a lounge with soft drinks, coffee and snacks which was delightful.

title: Quiet and comfortable
text:
We had a great week long stay at the Elysee and were pleasantly surprised that, despite being in midtown, the hotel was very quiet. Our room was comfortable, warm and very clean. 
The staff were very helpful. We enjoyed using the lounge on the 2nd floor where we were able to have our takeaway breakfast (from the deli opposite). Coffees, teas and snacks are always available and the lounge is very comfortable.
We will definitely return here on our next trip to NYC.

title: Lovely stay
text: Hotel Elysee has an old world and cozy feel and was a lovely place to stay in a fabulous location. The staff was extremely attentive and Jack was especially helpful to us. We stayed in a well-appointed suite, so family could join us for a dinner celebration. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

title: Totally charming
text: Loved this place. My first time staying there. I grew up on the Upper East Side, now live in CT, and it was not on my radar for some reason, maybe it is new-ish. Can't wait to go back! Gorgeous interior, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, great location.

title: nice and cozy hotel in New York
text: Elysee is my favorite hotel in New York. Is small and has a very attentive staff. the club room in 2nd floor is great to chill and have some coffee or tea. It is also very well located near central park and a metro station. Will be back next year for sure.

title: Always warm and welcoming
text: We always stay at the Elysee when we are in New York.  This time we were in the middle of the Covid pandemic and a blizzard.  Under these circumstances, our room was as comfortable as ever, the health and safety precautions were everything we would hope for, and the welcome was as warm as ever.

title: Hotel Elysee is the BEST!
text: The people at the front desk were super helpful with ideas and suggestions.  The service was superb. This hotel is quaint and cute in every way.  And the location is the best! Easy walking to parks, theatres, museums, restaurants, and more.  We will be back!

title: Fine smaller midtown hotel
text: We very much enjoyed our recent stay.  The hotel is close enough to Times Square and Broadway that we could walk to our matinee.  Nice lounge with snacks and coffee in the morning.  Monkey Bar, the famous watering hole off the lobby is currently closed due to Covid.

title: If you enjoyed yesteryear's hotels...
text: The Hotel Elysee has outstanding customer service; the staff is personable, attentive and extremely professional.  If you enjoy a stay with historical details and charming decor reminiscent of the past, Hotel Elysee is for you. If you are looking for modern details like USB ports, controllable thermostats and spacious rooms, you will be more comfortable at a chain hotel.

title: Old world charm
text:
Terrific boutique hotel with old works charm; great midtown location
TV was not high def but otherwise the place is awesome. Will go back soon and hope the Monkey bar will reopen along with normal food offerings

title: Great staff vs Covid
text: On a recent trip to NYC, my wife and I both came down with Covid. The staff at Hotel Elysee could not have been more helpful, with one staff member even stopping at a pharmacy near his home to get us test kits, which were unavailable in the city. But restricted to our room, we wished for a more modern television and updated decor. We miss the community room on the second floor but realize this can't be helped until the pandemic recedes. We love this hotel and its staff.

title: Excellent worker excellent place clean warn you feel like you don’t want to leave
text: Love The atmosphere and the worker and the rooms everything about it so beautiful and the relationship between us and everybody work over there is great . Every time we have been there we really enjoyed.

title: Magical stay
text: We couldn't have chosen a more beautiful hotel for our stay in NYC. The staff went overboard for us and the accommodations were just lovely. The history and charm of the hotel  was an added bonus. Great location too. Special thanks to Joseph, Juan, Jasmine, Noel and the entire staff for making our stay so memorable. We look forward to staying at Hotel Elysee again in the near future.

title: Great  atmosphere
text: This was my second triip to Elysee and ti did not disappoint.  My friend and I shared a room with 2 beds and it was comfortable.  The highlight was the club room as ever, but too bad they do not have it fully up and running.  I am afraid they will never be able to restore it to its former level.  We did not mind bringing in our own wine, but the selection of package snacks was very thin compared to what used to be offerred.  The wallpaper in our room needed a little attention, but not a big deal.  A cozy spot located in a busy area of NYC.

title: Feeling at home!!!!
text: We have been staying at Hotel Elysee for many years and everytime the team makes us feel at home. The rooms are spacious and clean. The stafff is always professional and very friendly. We look forward  to our return trips to NYC.  THANK YOU HOTEL ELYSEE!!!!

title: New York Hotel Elysee
text: Hotel Elysee is a great value. Our room was huge, maybe a little dated, but very comfortable.  Bathroom was nicely appointed. Unfortunately, the Monkey Bar is now closed but there are many restaurants near the hotel. There is a lovely lounge stocked with coffee, non-alcoholic drinks and treats staff. Best part is the location.  Easy walk to theater district, Madison Ave. shops and Central Park.  My new place to stay when going to NYC.

title: Outstanding service with a smile
text: We had the junior suite, which was huge and lovely. The club lounge had fabulous amenities — bottomless snacks, cappuccinos, drinks, fresh fruit — and the staff provided wonderful, cheerful service including great recommendations. Service was notably outstanding - above and beyond. Property isn’t brand new or fancy per se but it’s lovely and the hotel is great.

title: Always a Delightful Experience, but covid is having an impact.
text: As usual, the service at the Hotel Elysee cannot be faulted.  Due to Covid however, the service in the lounge was extremely curtailed, but the daily $25 service fee is still charged.  Instead of the usual breakfast or afternoon refreshments, they had "power bars". Not a good choice.  It could have been improved with the Pepperidge Farm cookies that come individually wrapped. The coffee machine is a good addition.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
We have stayed here several times
The location is great. Midtown
It is an old boutique hotel
Very clean
Furnishing are old. Bathrooms are very small and overall most rooms are somewhat dark
However included in the stay is wifi and a lounge room with refreshments 
Because of COVID pandemic the hotel was closed for about a year
Now after reopening they are no longer offering breakfast or wine in the afternoons
The refreshments available are not great (potato chips, granola bars,green bananas. Tea 
 and coffee
Why not individually wrapped bagels and pastries? How about yougurt?
The room rates are high yet the amenities have gone down

Also the Monkey Bar which is a plus for the hotel is closed 

Still a nice place for a short stay 
Staff is friendly and professional 

Btw TV sets very old 
Most do not work well
FYI

title: Our GO TO New York City Hotel
text: We returned to NYC after a long COVID winter to be warmly greeted by the staff of our favorite boutique NYC hotel. We are never disappointed. The rooms are comfortable, the location is convenient to Central Park and several subways, and the lounge is always pleasant with buffet breakfast and happy hour... and always a welcoming staff.

title: Ideal Location and Wonderful Service
text: Hotel Elysee has a great location for connecting to different parts of Manhattan. Rooms are old school, but in a good way. Everything was super clean and fresh when we arrived. The second floor club lounge is perfect for relaxing with a cup of tea or visiting with family or friends. Like others, our favorite part of the Elysee is its staff -- consistently professional and helpful. No problem is too small. Special shout out to Greg who went above and beyond to help me with a problem! Everyone else -- Juan, Carlos, Jazmyn, the housekeeping folks -- could not have been any nicer. Thanks everyone!

title: Outstanding Service, Comfy Hotel
text: Our flight to NYC was delayed several hours, so we arrived at JFK at 4 p.m.  During the 90-minute cab ride through stop/go traffic, we called the hotel to expedite our check-in, as we had 6:15 dinner reservation in Soho.  Jazzmyn, at the front desk, was unfazed.  She had our keys waiting for us as we flew to our 5th-floor room, dressed, and made a mad dash for a cab (NB: Subway would have been faster). Were almost on time; see my rave review of Vestry for more. Throughout our stay Jazzmyn and her front-desk team made us welcome and happy.  Our small room had a kind of bumpy bed and the window opened on the air shaft -- but it was very quiet, and it was an easy walk down the stairs to the extremely comfortable library on the 2nd floor, where bottled water, fruit, espresso, and chips are abundantly available. Also many copies of the NY Times, not to mention actual books. And although we did not use it, there is a DVD library and players in each room.  Also, a small refrigerator is provided at no charge.  I generally prefer a higher floor, but loved the convenience of using the stairs.  Oh, and another thing: We'd originally booked our room prior to the pandemic on a nonrefundable basis.  Had to cancel, and the hotel gave us a credit that was accepted graciously for this stay.  Thanks to all this, but especially to the unfazable Jazzmyn, we definitely will book the Elysee for our next NYC trip.

title: consistently professional
text: For about the last 8 years we stay at Hotel Elysee  when we visit NYC to see Broadway shows.  Location allows us to walk everywhere. Staff is low key super professional and friendly.  Service is what you could expect at a much more expensive hotel.   We alway enjoy our stay.  We hope that the full continental breakfast returns when the pandemic passes.

title: Guests come first
text: This is my favorite hotel. Staff makes me feel like home. My last trip required a trip to Greenport L.I. which Greg arranged seamlessly. There is always a solution with a smile to any request. I have never been disappointed with the services offered at this hotel

title: Ok not great
text:
The GOOD: A great location on a quiet street.  Ask for a room away from the street.  We had a  very quiet room.  As a covid-19 hotel it is great.  A small hotel, small lobby we felt very comfortable in this small hotel.  Staff friendly.  Nice sized room.
The BAD: The room while very clean it could use a renovation and freshing up.  The 18" tv was underwhelming.  Four LED room bulbs could not light up the room at night. No vanity in the bathroom.   Included in room rate  soft drinks/coffee  and snacks in the lounge.  Unfortunately the only snacks were very green banana's potato chips and 370 calorie energy bars. In the morning the least the hotel could do was put out a packaged muffin or bagel for breakfast.  We found this amenity useless.  
SUMMARY: Underwhelming hotel in need of some bagels for breakfast and a room makeover.  It is a smaller hotel if you are looking for a Covid friendly hotel this is a good choice.

title: Good Stay
text:
I think the 4.5 Trip Advisor rating is about right.
We had a nice stay in a Grand Suite for 4 days.  Furnishings a little dated and TV service was not great, but the suite was very large and we had great sleep (quiet and comfortable bed).
Location is great!  And the second floor common area is a big plus!

If we had access to room service and the Monkey Bar (closed due to Covid), my rating would definitely be higher.

title: Other great stay at Hotel Elysee, NewYork
text: Always love staying in this beautiful hotel, located conveniently mid-town.  Employees pleasant and helpful.  Our room was spacious, absolutely loved having a "patio room" on this recent visit!  Always select this hotel when visiting New York.  Missed the "Monkey Bar" and extensive hospitality in the second floor lounge, due to Covid.

title: I love this hotel
text: I always enjoy staying at The Hotel Elysee.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  The property is quite comfortable and very well-maintainedI look forward to the return of breakfast service and the evening wine reception.

title: very pleasant stay
text: Just one night.  Excellent accommodating service, cozy well appointed room: sort of slightly faded lux but perfectly fine for us. Excellent mid town location. Valet parking only $35 (at least at that time): relatively inexpensive for NYC.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Our family stayed 2 nights in a suite.  The location was close to shopping, restaurants and perfect for a day in Central Park yet still in a quiet section of the city.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The room was very clean.  The 2nd floor lounge was a great amenity with coffee and water always available. The hotel has so much character!  We can’t wait for the Monkey Bar to open again.

title: Quaint French boutique
text: Wonderful classy petit hotel with a staff staff that makes you feel comfortable. A European feel with French style bedding and bright rooms especially for NYC. Perfectly situated near the luxury shops of mid town and safe location.

title: Dated but very clean.
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful. I am not sure why all of their staff doesn’t wear masks. There’s still a pandemic and NYC now mandates vaccines for indoor dining and a hotel is indoors. Towels are very thin and pillows need to be replaced.

title: Overnight Stay at Hotel Elysee NYC
text: Excellent. Clean, comfortable. Enjoyed the 2nd floor concierge floor for coffee/water/snacks and ample seating areas to read the paper and relax outside of the guest room. Staff very friendly. Love the old world charm of the decor and the location is ideal in midtown.

title: NY visit in August 2021
text: Greatest staff you could ever ask for! Very helpful! Location was perfect and parking availability was an asset.  Rooms were super clean and had a charm of their own. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice people, nice environment
text: We liked the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful.  I particularly liked the lounge on the second floor and for a lot of use out of that.  Room was spacious and comfortable. Did not have bedside outlets or USB so that is a potential improvement.

title: Hotel Elysee Trip to NY
text: I should have gotten names but everyone who works at the hotel was great. The front desk made several calls to checks eateries for us. The doorman went around the corner to get us a cab. The barista who made coffee had been there 10 years and was so sweet. We met families that stay there regularly. There is coffee, soda , water and snacks all day till five . I was down at six am to get coffee. It is a hidden gem , the only problem is now more people will know.

title: Lovely stay at charming hotel
text: We spent five days in New York recently.  If you are looking for a hotel that is super quiet during the day and night, the Elysee is for you.  I requested a room away from the street and the hotel obliged me, and for that I am really grateful.  The staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful.  Our room with two double beds was very spacious.  Two small quibbles:  The step up to the bathroom is quite a hazard and it is easy to trip on it.  The plugs in the wall were quite loose and sometimes made recharging our phones, etc. an iffy proposition.  I can't vouch for the quality of the breakfast or the quality of the hospitality lounge as owing to COVID the former wasn't available and the latter offered minimal food and dfrink.  We are thrilled to have discovered this hotel and will return there without any qualms on future visits to New York.

title: A gem of a boutique hotel in NYC
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  It is an older hotel which could may use some updating (as far as the heavy drapery etc.) but it was very comfortable, very clean and the room was pretty.  The hotel employees were great - front desk, bellman, etc. - Joe, Jesse and all the guys were super nice, accommodating and professional (and cute!)  The room was large - got upgraded to a suite.  The location was very good.  We loved the "club floor" with water, sodas, chips etc. for the guests.   I hope the "Monkey Bar" opens again (had eaten there years ago and it was great).  I will stay here again.

title: Always the best place to stay
text:
This is an excellent hotel. Clean, comfortable, and convenient. The location is super, particularly if your focus is around the park, theater and the primary museums. Typically I come with family for fun, but I can also vouch for this hotel for business travel. Plenty of space in the room, great desk, everything I need and I can sleep at night: 54th isn't a big thoroughfare, and particularly the rooms at the back of the hotel are really quiet because they are off the street (work likes to put me on Lex. and it's like trying to sleep on an airport runway). The staff are super.

If you are concerned about COVID, this is a small hotel with only about 10 rooms per floor - fewer people milling around than a chain behemoth. One elevator, but it isn't crowded. Staff were properly masked. You can choose daily housekeeping or not.

title: Lovely NYC boutique hotel!
text: I have stayed here on a few occasions. The staff is top notch, hotel is quaint and quiet, and the location In Midtown East can’t be beat! I also love the lounge area, which offers complimentary around the clock snacks and beverages.

title: Another excellent stay, perfect but for Covid
text:
This was our third stay at Hotel Elysee, and it was again lovely.  For the first time, we had a room with a balcony overlooking 54th Street that was very nice.  Everything about the hotel is lovely.
I have two items, however, that visitors should know:  (1)  the hotel's typical lovely breakfast buffet is currently not offered, due to Covid; and (2) the Monkey Bar is closed, for the same reason.. .  Both were surprising and disappointing.   In my view, the hotel should have informed guests of these facts prior to check-in.  The website says nothing about either.

title: What a little gem!
text:
This boutique hotel is a wonderful place in a perfect location for your New York visit. Located on 54th St. between Madison and Park it is furnished with, I would imagine, the original antiques which take you back to the early 1900 New York. It is well maintained with beautiful furnishings. The second floor sitting room and library is stocked with soft drinks, water and snacks and is the perfect place to catch your breath and relax after a day exploring the city. This is not a modern hotel filled with cheap furniture that is exactly the same in every room. It is filled with beautiful unique antiques. The empty power outlets or USB ports on both sides of our bed for phones was a plus that not all classic properties offer.

Every single employee was professional, knowledgeable and eager to help in anyway possible with any requests or reservations we inquired about.

Thanks to Greg, Juan, Joe and all the others at Hotel Elysee for making our stay perfect! We could not have enjoyed it more.

title: Our favorite NYC gotel
text: We love hotel Elysee. Some of their amenities are not available right no but they are still doing a great (and safe) job. Looking forward to all of what they offer as soon as COVID is over. Just grateful they are back open!

title: Weekend family visit
text: I have been staying at the Hotel Elysee for over fifty years and it remains my favorite hotel in NYC. I would happily recommend Hotel Elysee to anyone. The staff is friendly and the accommodations are comfortable and charming. The location is excellent with many nearby shops, restaurants and museums.

title: Lovely Oasis in the midst of the city
text: Fantastic overall.  Beautiful and charming building and amenities combined with kind, friendly staff which seems to be a rarity these days.  My only 'complaint' would be that the maid service continuously ignored my room's coffee station and never restocked or cleaned that area but that's a minor thing.  I will be back.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
We stayed for a week and had a great experience. Things we liked:
- Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff.
- Lounge with free coffee, tea, sparkling water, fruit, and newspapers.
- Spacious room. We also had a balcony with a cafe table.
- Terrific location. Easy walking distance to many places (Central Park, Met and other museums). Longer walks to everywhere else we wanted to go. Easy access to subway stations in all directions when we didn't want to walk home.

title: Loved this hotel!
text: What a perfect little gem. We loved everything about The Elysee - great location, clean, comfortable and perfect service. The staff were the best we’ve experienced in years. Special shout out to front desk Joseph and lounge area Erica. Thanks for a great stay.

title: Another great stay.
text: This is my fourth visit to this hotel.  I wouldn't come back if I didn't like it. Of course, it will be better when the breakfast and happy hour resume. A special shout out to the front desk staff for finding my glasses and returning them to me.

title: Welcoming and Cozy
text:
The hotel staff is consistently professional, helpful and polite. 
The room was comfortable and the bathroom above average. The hotel is opening post Covid in stages so not all the amenities are back in place as yet.

title: Top notch
text:
A +++++ on COVID protocol’s.
Outstanding staff providing excellent customer service.
Every single employee makes your stay perfect.
This hotel is my favorite hotel for a reason
Excellent in every possible way.

title: Looking forward to coming back!
text:
I loved my stay at the Hotel Elysee. My room was spacious and spotless, with classic furnishings and a super comfortable bed. It’s gracious! The hotel has old school glamour and charm and the staff was great too, especially Greg at the front desk and Erica in the Club Room. The location was perfect and being able to sit in the Club Room reading, with a cup of coffee, was just a really great addition to my stay. I have stayed at a lot of very nice, high end, and well known properties throughout the US and Europe and the Hotel Elysee ranks among my favorites.

My only suggestion is that as a solo female traveler I would have loved to have had a chain lock on the door—just a small thing! 

Thanks everyone at the Elysee, I look forward to returning.

title: Terrific Staff
text:
We love the Library Group and especially the Elysee! The staff couldn’t be nicer. I have to say we really missed the breakfast and wine and snacks in the afternoon it added a lot. We had the Grand King Suite 
As we were traveling with our 13 year old Granddaughter having two rooms made it more comfortable

title: Excellent stay.
text:
I was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is great. Right in midtown with easy access to nearby attractions and dining. Very safe area, even without the normal throngs of workers due to the pandemic.

This hotel feels just like you’re staying in an European boutique hotel. My room looked over 54th street but I had no issues with noise, even on weekdays. I had a lovely sitting area with a couch, armchair and desk/chair in addition to the bed. The A/C worked great (much appreciated since it was extremely hot during my visit!). The bathroom was large and spotlessly clean.

What really makes this hotel special is the staff. The front desk staff and bellmen are the friendliest I’ve encountered in my many years of travel to NYC. They get to know you and are happy to chat with you or share recommendations. I also loved the lounge area on the second floor. It was great coming back and being able to grab a cold bottle of water or a soda and snack. It was also a nice area to sit in and chat with friends.

I can’t recommend this hotel enough. I’ve stayed in many, many hotels in the city and while most have been fine, you really can’t beat this combination of pricing, safety, comfort, location, cleanliness and customer service. I will most definitely be returning.

title: One of our favorites in NYC
text: This is one of our favorite places to stay in NYC. Great location, beautiful rooms that are a good size for the city, and super friendly staff. The Monkey Bar downstairs is a convenient spot for food or a drink. Highly recommend considering this as a stop for your trip to the city.

title: Excellent Hospitality
text: We visited the Hotel Elysee recently for a quick.  The entire staff we encountered beginning with a phone call a few days prior to our arrival welcoming us and offering assistance on restaurants and transportation, to the greeting at the door, was excellent!  Everyone was cheerful, helpful, and exhibited a high level of customer service.  The suite we stayed in was first and foremost very clean and well appointed.  The beds were comfortable, which is important to us.  We enjoyed the club room for morning tea and coffee, afternoon drinks and snacks, and a comfortable place to stay between check out time and when we were picked up to go to the airport.  Hotel Elysee, situated between Park Ave. and Madison Ave. is in good proximity to restaurants, shopping, museums, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Central Park.  We highly recommend Hotel Elysee!

title: Great Stay
text: The review was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The hotel was in a great location to explore the city. I loved the small feel to it, the character that you don't see in modern styled hotels. Would happily stay there again.

title: Almost perfect!
text: Very comfortable, classy furnishings in super nice rooms, super clean, large lovely lounge overlooking the street with coffee and fruit and energy bars and chips for free. Only weakness is the TVs in all rooms are small and have limited channels with no way to even see what shows are playing on each channel other than to surf thru. DVD players but really, in 2021. We like the "old fashioned" feel of the place, just would like modern media.

title: Family gathering at my favorite Elysee hotel,
text:
No other hotel offers the gathering room on the second floor that allows family member fellowship with provided snacks and coffee 
Also very comfortable chairs and sofas add to a relaxing 2nd floor gathering room  visit 
Also good views of the interesting st below that easily allows people watching -big plus the hotel,offers

title: Sinatraesque, Beau Monde, Cheerful / Happy, family friendly, unbeatable even in NYC.
text: The only  thing that's missing...well I will not say that because I'm going to suggest it privately to them.  I would stay here over the overrenovated Plaza& Knickerbocker, over the Penninsula & Four Seasons, over the depressing Baccarat, over anything else in new york including private residence.  Is it that good? Yep.  I live in the city  grew up in it  and I still stay here for weekends and any other reason or pseudo holiday I can excuse myself from daily responsibility.  The only downside it feels so festive I drink to celebrate and have relapses frequently.

title: Truly a jewel of a hotel
text: I just returned from another great stay at the Hotel Elysee. The staff as always was extremely helpful and responsive. The decor is classic, clean, and comfortable with more amenities than you would expect from a boutique hotel. Emerging from COVID is a difficult time for hospitality and service industries, but the Hotel Elysee seems to be rising to the challenge without issue. Looking forward to my next stay!

title: So Glad to be Back
text: The Hotel Elysee has recently reopened and I was so excited to be able to stay here again.  The front desk staff was as welcoming as ever and even with reduced services (the lovely breakfasts and wine and cheese were temporarily unavailable, it was still a memorable visit.  The location is close to shopping and restaurants, and it felt very safe to be there.  My room was spotless and although small, still absolutely fine for me.  I felt as if I were going home again.

title: Excellent
text: The service, the friendly and home ambience made me feel at home again in NY. I will go back. The hotel was clean, rooms as well. The staff very professional at all levels. I will recommend this stay if someone is looking for a home like experience in NY. Warm regards

title: Hot Room
text: Great hotel with attentive staff. The air conditioner's coils seemed to freeze up at night making our room quite warm overnight. The WiFi was terrible; intermittent and a weak connection on the 14th floor.  Monkey Bar was closed and there was no room service. Great location.

title: vacation stay in May 2021
text:
fabulous stay as always at Hotel Elysee. It was the first weekend that the hotel had opened since the pandemic and between the staff and the comfortable rooms The Elysee is by far our favorite hotel to stay in while visiting family in NYC.
Thank you to all the staff for making it so very enjoyable!

title: Romantic get away
text: I followed my husband on a business trip and staying at Elysse turned this trip to a marvelous romantic get away. Excellent location.  Our room had no view, but was very clean and we loved the classic furniture,  the comfortable mattress and the fluffy pillows.  Pleasantly surprised by the complementary wine and cheese served late afternoon in the cozy atmosphere of the Club Room by the most kind ladies.  Definitely recommending it to friends and look forward to going back!

title: ALWAYS WONDERFUL
text:
Hotel Elysee is my home away from home in Manhattan. Convenient location. Quiet (for midtown Manhattan) street. Lovely rooms. Friendly and attentive staff. I love staying at the Elysee.

And in the midst of the coronavirus panic, my colleague and I enjoyed a delightful stroll through Central Park.

title: Very nice  "Cost-Benefit" and more....
text: Excellent location, offered food are not the best you can find but very honest and attend the needs and I would say even more, end of the day happy hour is very convenient and pleasant. Rooms are clean and comfortable but services are for sure the key factor of success of this Hotel.  My wife and I will be back for sure.

title: A high-value classic
text: A product of an earlier age of graciousness, the Elysee wears its age lightly and honorably. Very clean, well-maintained, with excellent service, and a great location,  the Elysee offers  many lovely touches. The rooms are fair-sized, comfortable, and well furnished, with modern mattresses. The large windows of the second-floor breakfast room overlook East 54th Street, offering a pretty view. The historic Monkey Bar offers fine dining, and there are many very good restaurants within a short walk.

title: Excellent
text:
Wonderful experience. Feels like coming home each time I come back.
Staff terrific. Breakfast and afternoon tea/wine is a perfect start and end 
to a busy NYC day served in the library makes it comfortable and, again, like coming home.

title: Always accommodating
text: Beautiful corner King rooms with two views give a nice sense of space and comfort. The service is excellent throughout the hotel including the famous Monkey Bar and Restaurant. Wine and cheese  is served in the late afternoon in the hotel's quiet  Club Room which gives you time to relax after a day of activity and leaves down time to bath dress and prepare for an evening event. Broadway, concert Halls, Movie Thethes are all within reasonable and safe walking distance.

title: Hotel Elysée, 60E 54th street, NYC
text:
Last February, while in New York City, my wife and I stayed as usual at the Elysée. 
           We couldn’t think of any other place where to stay when in New York because that boutique hotel really took our hearts. 
            It is far from the crowd even if it is close to most places of interest. It is like home far from your home. 
            Class, warm welcome, kindness and cleanliness are the key words there. 
             The rooms where guests have breakfast and gather for the evening wine and hors d’oeuvre transmit peace and serenity which is a great way to start and end your day. 
               Under the expert management of Mr. Avina everything is taken care of in every single detail and your wishes are fulfilled. 
               My wife and I would recommend the Elysée to all those who wish a home when far from their home and a sheltered and classy place when in the town that never sleeps. 
     Dr Campione

title: my review
text: The Elysee always manages to feel welcoming from the front door to the front desk and beyond. Location is ideal with most of what one could need within a few blocks.  aA right size version of the best of a non chain experience

title: Anderson/Sharp Engagement Gathering
text: Your hotel and staff were wonderful.  You accommodations  were extremely nice, and your staff was eager to make our visit very pleasurable.  I was able to see the full extend of your service when my mother in law left her wallet on a front table the morning we left.  Ben, at the front desk went out of his way to call, email our group to let us know he had it.  Needless to say, we were very pleased to get it back, and appreciate all your staff did to make that happen - A very nice New York experience.  We will (and have) recommended your hotel to anyone looking to stay in New York.  Thank you!

title: Uptown treat
text:
Boutique property with classic charm. Warm furnishings , great front desk and love 
all day "tea".
Rooms are spacious and clean... Bathrooms are large, bright and lots of counter space. Most importantly a magnifying mirror.

title: Great home base for NYC
text:
We are a family of four (kids are two teenagers) who visited in June, 2019.  We went to NYC to explore the city, see some shows, visit museums, and just experience life in this vibrant city.  The Hotel Elysee was a perfect home base.  The midtown location is convenient to so much.  We were able to walk to most places, and those that we couldn't were just a quick (and easy) subway ride away.  Breakfast at the hotel was a great way to start each day.  We weren't always back in the evenings on time for the wine reception, but when we were, it was a welcome treat.
     We booked the King Grand Suite so that we could spread out a little.  It was really an astonishing amount of room for a hotel in NYC.  With two teenagers, we have passed the point of being able to squish everyone into a room with two beds.  This suite allowed everyone to have room (one child slept on the pullout sofa, the other made a nest on the floor with sofa cushions, sheets, and a blanket - it actually worked great).  We had considered just getting two rooms for our family, but after a lot of looking, this was, by far, the most economical way to stay in the heart of it all - without sacrificing quality.  The hotel is great and the service is top notch.  
     There is a little wear and tear starting to show, which is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars.  It was nothing major, and it honestly didn't bother us in the slightest.  The positives far outweigh the negatives here.  I know we would all stay here again!

title: This Hotel is a Gem!
text: I knew this was going to be a wonderful New York hotel from the moment I called and spoke with Anthony.  I made many calls to different boutique hotels but Hotel Elysee stood out!!  All of the hotel staff were so pleasant, professional, and friendly.  From the moment we arrived, we couldn't have been more delighted. The room was charming and we had a bottle of wine and chocolates waiting for us. There are  many amenities such as coffee all day, continental delicious breakfast, wine & cheese and snacks in the Club Room with wonderful music of all kinds.  The ladies serving in the Club Room couldn't have been kinder.   My opinion is Stay at the Hotel Elysee. You won't be disappointed.  The owner and manager were around to make sure all was going well and chatted with many guests. WOW, I felt so lucky finding this fabulous Hotel with fabulous folks.  Thanks Everyone!!!

title: Amazing
text: Hotel maravilhoso, bem localizado, staf muito atenciosos e gentis. Tem café da manhã bom e, todos os dias tem um happy hour totalmente free com várias bebidas e gostosuras. Recomendo. Segunda vez que ficamos nesse hotel.

title: A very good American hotel with a French accent
text: A very good place for a decent price. I had a suite facing the courtyard. Big rooms. Quiet. Dated furniture (especially the TV stands, designed for a big old TV set) which takes a lot of space. Bathroom connected to the bedroom with no separate access from the living room. Bathroom amenities for one person instead of two. Setting the proper water temperature was not easy. The suit had a glass-covered terrace, with untransparent glass. An extra room, though. The breakfast was typical French, continental, but with lots of food. Fantastic location (shops, restaurants, museums, transport). Polite and well-trained staff. Two times less expensive than any other place of that quality. Overall: a very good place if you have a limited budget but want something special.

title: highly recommended
text: After being given a gift certificate for this hotel, we tried it last year and it was so delightful we have returned and plan to do it annually. We have also brought in friends to see the facility and we think they will be booking a future stay!

title: hotel Elysee
text:
great and helpful staff
old new york style
clean and comfortable
good location
breakfast buffet very good
will gladly return
availability of refreshments and newspapers all day
wine and cheese available in the evenings

title: Home Away From Home
text:
Excellent small boutique hotel centrally located to Theatre’s, museums, 
restaurants and shopping
We’ve  staying here for many years and it’s always been outstanding
They offer continental breakfast buffet and all day refreshments in their club room
Also 3 hour wine and Hors d’oeuvres daily
The staff has always been professional and extremely helpful
A special thank you to Cheryl Golds Director of Sales and Marketing
She has certainly made each and every one of our stays a “Home  Away From Home”

title: Again...a pleasure!
text: very quiet and small place with an excellent location that we return to several times a year.  not the most modern by any means, no view, no onsite restaurant, and small bathrooms, but very clean, outstanding customer service and just what we needed this time.  we were not able to indulge in the evening wine and cheese, but managed to grab some snacks and a cup of tea.  the continental breakfast included gluten free toast upon request (thank you!).  thank you for including berries in the fruit offering.

title: Always our favorite
text: The Elysee is by far the best value in NYC and the location is perfect for us.  Service is very friendly and each time we stay we feel we’ve “come home”. The breakfast & happy hour make the whole experience perfect.

title: Enjoyable weekend in New York City
text:
I have a wonderful weekend in the hotel,, the personnel is very kind, helpful and professional. Everything added to make it simple and easy.
Wonderful breakfast, afternoon food in wonderful lounge, kind attention to all my needs.
they have a parking place where they place my car as soon as I arrived.
The location is perfect, perfect distance to Time square and located in a wonderful area of NYC, close to the MOMA, and exelent restaurants.
This is my second time in the hotel and I am looking forward to go back for another wonderful weekend
The room has everything for my needs, and the size was adecuate

title: Stay at Hotel Elysee
text: A remarkable property, conveniently located, that I greatly look forward to visitng and always having the leaving part.  Rooms are large and elegantly furnished with many wonderful amenies...and comfortable bed is to die for, always providing a resul sleep .  Lastly, the 2nd !oor breakfast area provides a "lling breakfast and comfortable work space.  The space also doubles as an early evening wine and cheese tasng spot which is always a fun pick me up before heading out to dinner.  In summation, Hotel Elysee is wonderful & beautiful peaceful oasis from all the hustle and bustle of NYC. Lastly, there are a number of good restaurants within a really short waking distance including the Monkey Bar next door.  And that becomes very convenient on very cold evenings......................................................................................................................................

title: Wonderful weekend at wonderful hotel
text: I recommend the Hotel Elysee to everyone.  It's in a perfect location, it's staffed by friendly, helpful and knowledgeable people, its rooms are attractive and comfortable, and the pleasures of the Library are the ultimate in civilized hospitality.  A+

title: Another lovely stay
text: I am at the point when someone asks, Im not sure how many times that I have stayed at the lovely Midtown Hotel Elysee! It is my home base when visiting NYC despite my daughter living in Brooklyn and working on the west side of Manhattan! It is dependable and the ppl are Lovely! If you think it feels dated and a wee bit worn, please go stay somewhere else so there's room for me! I Love It!

title: Absolutely lovely
text: We are NJ locals and have gone to many small and larger higher end hotels in the city for short in town stays. Hotel Elysée was an excellent choice. Location superb, deluxe king room very spacious. Bed, when optional topper was added was very comfortable.  Being off season, the rate which included WiFi, club floor continental breakfast, all day coffee, fruit, cookies, evening happy hour and very reasonable parking fee was an excellent deal. Service wonderful.  Bathroom was small but newly renovated. Room decor of this 1926 era hotel is traditional and charming though furniture shows some wear.  Immaculately clean.  You can hear street noise but hey, it’s NYC and they do offer many amenities to mask sound if it’s a bother.  A perfect choice if you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in great NYC neighborhood.

title: Great location for Art break and great service for reasonable price
text:
Only 5 minutes walk to MoMA and 10 to Central Park. Our 9th floor deluxe king room on the street side was large annd bright with two windows and a very comfortable bed and feather pillows. Warning - it's not for light sleepers though; this is NYC - the garbage trucks come at 5:30 am everyday, sirens at all hours of the night. The windows are not sealed so it's very noisy. Bring earplugs or ask for a room on the inside.

The club room is an excellent service. Snacks, coffee and tea available 24 hrs a day; decent wine and cheese reception every evening 4 to 8 and a nice continental breakfast with good bagels and newspapers. We saved $100s on eating out plus the time savings.

We want to recognize Ben from the night crew for his outstanding service. We like to have great coffee in the morning (can't abide the lousy US drip coffee at places like this) and bring our own brew but forgot to pack our travel French press. Ben actually brought his own press from home and lent it to us for the stay. Extraordinary and generous!

We'd stay here again.

title: we return every year
text: when we make our annual trip to New York in early January, we always stay at the Elysee.  It's a perfect location for the museums we like to visit, close to 5th avenue, convenient for subway and bus, and is cozy and comfortable with excellent service.  The decor is traditional and welcoming. Nice wine and cheese are served for hours every evening and continental breakfast is also very nice. All the staff is helpful.

title: Manhattan Treasure
text: Perfect small hotel, great location, outstanding staff.  Complimentary continental breakfast and late afternoon wine and cheese in a living room like setting are just special--met many interesting hotel guests. Lobby flowers, each time we have stayed here, are consistently spectacular. All-day coffee service is welcomed, as is the small library with comfortable couches and chairs. A rare, very civilized experience .

title: Dated
