text: Nice hotel in a good part of town but better places to go on my opinion. Dated decor and average breakfast. Rooms are a good size and service was great. I think there are nicer hotels but it does have a certain charm to it.

title: Hotel elysee
text: Staff was great. Always pleasant and helpful. Even when they served us.  They were happy tooo great service.   Desk staff was outstanding  and manager was the most professional and helpful. Thank you. Enjoyed our stay very much!!!!

title: Terrific little hotel with tired furnishings
text: We stayed here on a recent visit to NYC, having stayed at the Library and Casablanca on previous visits. Like the others, the hotel is beautifully run, very clean, and offers good value. The location is superb. (Trust me - - it really is.) The only down side is that both rooms and lobby desperately need a refresher. The lobby is dreary and off putting. (There is a nice flower arrangement, but it doesn't compensate for the faded brocade walls,  etc.) The room was airy and well designed, but the furniture was very dated, a bit scuffed, and covered in dull, faded fabrics. A shame, because you really want to love this hotel. In everything but decor, it's a  real winner.

title: Great hotel
text: Just enjoy yourself! The morning breakfast is delicious and the Happy hour is very relaxing.  Such a wonderful idea for a hotel to offer a wonderful home like atmosphere.  Even the most expensive hotels do not offer such a warm place to sit down and rest with your fellow travelers.

title: Always Excellent!
text: We've stayed here many times and every time is excellent. Rooms are always very clean, door service is prompt, cab service is available, and every morning and evening we have available to us European breakfast and wine and snacks in the evening.

title: Never disappointing, a gem in NYC
text: Arrived at the Hotel to a warm welcome. Beautifully appointed room, large comfortable bed and very helpful staff. The hotel is very quiet, and the heavy drapes ensured a restful sleep even as morning approached. A premium is not required for any of the amenities, true it is a luxury, boutique hotel but access is not restricted to any person or party to any part of the hotel. Breakfast never disappoints with a wide selection of fruit, yogurt, coffee and teas, bagels and cereals. Afternoon wine, nuts, crackers and cheese is always a treat in the 2nd floor lounge and library space.  Location is so important in NYC and this well-positioned hotel provides access in all four directions by foot or subway or taxi.

title: Old world charm in NYC
text: My son and a friend stayed at the Elysee for two nights over Christmas. The reception was going on when we arrived, a very nice wine and cheese offering in the lounge. It was very busy and festive. Breakfast is served in the morning, also lovely and all included in our room charge. The rooms are larger than most in NYC, bathrooms were redone and very nicely laid out. The room decor is charming, albiet a bit weathered but for the price, we loved our stay and I will be back for business. Parking was also very reasonable. A jewel in NYC's upper east side.

title: Delightful
text:
My wife and I stayed there for an evening on the town during the holiday season.  We had stayed there twice before. It was pleasant then, but they must have changed their mission statement this time.

The interaction with the reservation staff could not have been more pleasant. They were accommodating in every way.

When we arrived early at noon, they tried to get us our room, which was not yet available, understandably so (check out is 1:00PM), but they helped with the luggage and said they would call my cell phone as soon as the room was ready. A nice touch.

The room had been recently redone, Bathroom as well. Very comfortable room.

The staff was very friendly and professional - from the doorman to the front hall reception to the maid offering turn down service.

I highly recommend it. It is a boutique hotel, so not a mega Hiltonesque place. Great location. I'll stay there again!

title: Excellent experience
text: Our room was perfect, very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the club room for breakfast and happy hour. This room for gathering allowed us to meet other guests and enjoy the hotel and relax. The location was perfect for walking to museums, restaurants and shops.We look forward to our next visit.

title: Best keep this secret to myself
text: What a wonderful home away from home.  Truly quenched my thirst for a European environment -- and yet the mattresses were new!!! Lovely breakfast and wow -- wonderful wine and cheese at 5:00.  Vert happy

title: Lovely stay
text: This is a really nice and well run hotel.  Its very pretty.  The staff are just lovely.  I must say the hotel is amazingly clean.  Romantic.  Old school.  Room was big.  Bed super comfy.  The breakfast room was great.   For me, terrific.

title: Premiere Service
text: This hotel is a cozy retreat. The staff is great. Everyone is service oriented. Great location in midtown. It's the only place we stay while in NYC. Highly recommended. Where else in the City can you enjoy free wine and cheese in the evening.

title: Lovely
text:
A great experience in this lovely and small hotel. The staff was very friendly. The dinning room is different, but charm, to any other I´ve been in the past. The "Wine and Cheese" hour (from 17 to 20 hs) is a great idea to have a break & bite and know people. Of course this has a price, but i will probably come back.
The only "but" is the room air condition system, a bit noisy IMHO.

title: December Stay
text: What draws us to this hotel is the location and service. The front desk and library room staff, as well as housekeeping, do a great job. We have a guest of this hotel for at least five years. The one suggestion we would make is that the carpet and furniture upholstery needs to be updated.

title: Always consistently excellent
text:
First and foremost the hotel is staffed with  friendly, attentive and professional staff prefer the street side and room with  at the front desk, dining room and room service.

The location is  within walking distance to the theatre district as well as Central Park and major museums.

Been returning for ~ 15 years with a feeling of coming ‘home’.

Thank you

Thanks

title: My home and family in New York City
text: I am a seasoned traveler for both business and recreation.  I've seen my share of skyscraper hotels with polish and glitz which belies a soulless and servile core.  Wouldn't you like to stay somewhere which emphasizes community and camaraderie in its staff, where the managers and owners treat their employees as family ... and where this warmth and welcoming atmosphere is passed freely to all guests who come to stay ... friendships that will form with your fellow travelers during the open hors d'oeuvres/breakfast receptions every day where mingling is encouraged ... a respite and oasis which, after your first stay, you will stay nowhere else when you return?  This is what you will find at Hotel Elysee.  I have been their guest for ten years and countless visits.  My fondest memories of New York City will always include the people I have met there and the feeling of being 'back home' as soon as I walk through the portico.  Cheers!

title: Hotel Elysee never disappoints!
text: Second time here and everything was perfect.  Lovely continental breakfast and daily wine/snacks.  Upgraded to stay in Jr. King Suite which is HUGE for NYC standards.  No street noise whatsoever yet hotel is in the perfect Midtown East location...steps from Central Park, 5th and Madison.  Short walk to Rock Center and Broadway.  Very pleasant staff and love the connected Monkey Bar!  This is quickly becoming our NYC go-to hotel.

title: Wonderful jewel and great staff
text:
We’ve stayed at the Hotel Elyseé on a few occasions and have always found it a quiet and charming place to hide away from the hustle and bustle of the city. 
We would also like to commend Anthony on this particular trip taken during the Christmas season. 
Due to unusual  circumstances, we found that our reservations did not include two days. Before we got to the hotel, we asked Anthony to see what he could do during this very busy holiday season. It was all straightened out by the time we got there. 
Also we had a particularly unusual request that he took care of for us. 
Thank you, Anthony, for going above and beyond for us.  We look forward to seeing you and the Hotel Elyseé soon.

title: Midtown gem
text: We have been coming to stay at the Elysee for over 20 years. It is a great boutique hotel in midtown near MOMA. There are echoes of the classic 1920s with modern amenities and a great restaurant connected - the Monkey Bar.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
text: We have stayed at the hotel for many years, and have always found the staff of accommodations to be excellent. One of the best things about it is the location in the middle of mid-town Manhattan, an easy walk to a variety of locations. Also, the availability of a space on the mezzanine level throughout the day, and for breakfast and wine and cheese in the evening, is it tremendous asset if you need to make a phone call or meet people.

title: Foland Stay 12/05 - 12/08
text:
Club room is always nice.  It could be better if beer was made available.
The junior suite we stayed in was nice but needed updating with regard to carpet, furniture, painting, and artwork.  Room and bathroom were clean and serviced properly everyday.  We will definitely be returning.

title: Great staff, location, hotel!
text:
The staff was very professional - calling us the day before to confirm, upgrading the room and storing our bags on checkout day. 
We walked everywhere and enjoyed the Monkey Bar, Bills across the street and Palladian next block up.

title: Nice Stay!
text: We picked Hotel Elysee because it was quaint and offered a continental breakfast and wine and cheese in the early evening.  Service at the front desk was excellent.   My only complaint is that the rooms needed some renovating.  Still, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean.  My room was on the fourth floor and facing the street which can be very noisy at night, so you may want to pick a room not facing the street.   Saying all this, I would still consider staying here again.

title: The Tie that Binds
text:
We are four Sorority Sisters who have remained close friends for forty-eight years. 
The Hotel Elysee was perfect for us because it
Provided an intimate setting for visiting, included breakfast and then drinks in the afternoon as well as a friendly, helpful staff!

title: great place in best location
text:
perfect Location , nice breakfast and lounge , available 24 Hours ;very supportive staff and reception,
clean Rooms ,
upper Floors recommendable, try to get a room to 54thSt , otherwise …..
Overall really worth to book there, however watch the Prices weekdays !!

title: recent stay.
text: staff was very helpful and friendly. service in all areas were excellent. enjoyed breakfast and the wine and cheese in the evening I would.suggest having some hot appetizer to go with the wine and cheese in the evening.

title: Return often
text: My daughter and I love this hotel and take an annual trip to NYC over the holidays. Perfect location midtown and the included breakfast is excellent as well as the included cocktails and appetizers. Her teenagers love the elegant rooms, the food and the cozy living rooms where we enjoy reading the Times while eating and chatting. So inviting. And the staff is just terrific - feels like a big family mansion.

title: Fabulous surprise
text: Charming European feel in an excellent location, Hotel Elysee will be my new hotel for NYC.  Everyone take notice and try this jewel.  My room and amenities were superb.  Staff went out of their way to accommodate my needs.

title: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN NYC
text: Friendly, helpful staff starts things on a high note.  Then a comfortable satisfying breakfast in a very cordial breakfast room starts the day in a good mood.  Then end the day with wine, cheese & cookies reception in a living room setting and you’ve described your stay at this fabulous hotel.

title: Another wonderful stay
text: Room immaculate, made up nicely every day; afternoon hors d’oeuvres and wine very good, the continental breakfast excellent. Only problem on one morning was no seating, as many people were in the room at once. All staff very helpful and pleasant.

title: Always here!
text: We always stay here when we come to the city. The staff are super friendly, nice and helpful. We love the location. I will always stay here at Hotel Elysee, as always have a great experience.the rooms are nice but the staff makes this hotel.

title: This is my third time staying here and each time is GREAT!
text:
I will keep coming back to this great property that is perfectly located in NYC.  We come with our girlfriends every year and we can walk to so many places, it's near the subway....but the best is the complementary breakfast and happy hour every day.  
Carlos the doorman is so nice and all of the staff at the check in are so helpful and kind.

title: consistently excellent
text: We have stayed at this hotel frequently - the service is attentive, professional and welcoming through out.  Breakfast in the lounge is delicious and incredibly convenient.  The rooms are comfortable and each one is different in some way.   The location can not be beat.

title: Wonderful
text: We have stayed there three times in the past three years and love to location, the staff, the comfort of the hotel.  In addition, it's great to have a continental breakfast an wine and cheese.  We'll be back!

title: Wonderful stay, will be back!
text: We stayed here for four nights and enjoyed every moment. Staff was very friendly and helpful. It seemed that majority of guests are returning visitors, which also speaks for itself. Room was very good size, with a lot of space for clothes. Bed very comfortable. Hotel location cannot be any better, it is simply perfect!

title: Great once again
text: This was our sixth year of staying at the hotel and thank goodness things don’t change. Although we had a different room to our normal room (King Suite)it once again was excellent both in terms of size and facilities. To see the same faces year after year is somewhat comforting and gives an indication that the staff are cared for as much as the guests. To walk into the lounge for breakfast and not only to be remembered but also the type of milk that you have on your cereal is a good indication of the service that prevails throughout the hotel.I know it’s a separate entity but having the Monkey Bar and Monkey Bar Restaurant next door just adds to the whole enjoyment of this Hotel and I look forward to returning in the not too distant future

title: Our Stay in New York
text: We used to live in New York and were familiar with the hotel. It is in a great location-you cannot do better! Everything was excellent-the room was in good condition and updated considering the age of the hotel.The room was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine and appetizers were a real plus! The only negative was the noise from the street-we were on the 7th floor and every morning between 4:30 and 5:00 AM were woken up by trash pick-up and many large trucks making deliveries to the various buildings. We could have stayed in the back side of the hotel but the rooms face another building and they  are very dark. I believe that the problem could be solved by replacing the windows on the street side with double pane glass. I noticed that when were were downstairs in the breakfast library, it was very quiet even though it was facing the street. It did have double pane windows. Aside from this problem, we very much enjoyed our stay and would absolutely recommend the hotel.

title: Began rough but ended great!
text: We have used this hotel before and had a wonderful, comfortable time so we didn't hesitate to use the hotel again. Upon arriving an hour passed check-in time, we found our room not ready. They had forgotten to make it "feather-free" even though I reminded them numerous times. When we went up to the room the housekeeping person was finishing up the room and had not only left the feather pillows in the room but sprayed the room with a room refresher that caused me to have a horrible reaction. I needed to move to the hallway and my daughter called the front desk to ask for another room. They moved us quickly to the next room on a lower floor and we found the room filled with feather pillows and a feather pillow top on the mattress. We decided to give the housekeeping time to fix the room and went to dinner, pleading with them NOT to spray the room. Once we returned, the room was okay and I was able to exist in the space. So rough beginning but we were okay after that. Without the mattress cover, the mattress was hard but manageable. Hotel Elysee could stand to upgrade their mattresses without covers so people with allergies could sleep comfortably though.

title: attention to detail
text: Our stay at the Elysee made our first trip to NYC even more special.  I agree with all the "excellent" reviews you can read on this site.  What I will add is that the attention to detail they put into the breakfast and evening receptions is amazing!  Fresh-squeezed OJ and top-quality fruit salad and baked goods and cappuccino served by friendly young ladies in black dresses.  In the evening, fine cheeses, breads, olives and crudites.

title: Another GREAT visit!
text: We love this hotel.  GREAT location.  GREAT staff.  We usually stay in a Junior Suite but this time we were in one of the Presidential Suites!  They have a free continental breakfast and all of the other guests are very friendly.  Like a home away from home (the staff here never changes and always acknowledges our return).

title: Very good hotel and position in Manhatten
text: From the onset emails with the Elysee staff were very friendly and very helpful.  They arranged airport pick up for us as this was our first visit to New York.  Hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The hotel is very close to Central Park, Times Square and 5th Avenue.  We walked to all these areas with ease.  The buffet breakfast was good as was the cheese and wine every evening, and coffee and tea throughout the day in their relaxing lounge area.  All this was complimentary!  I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and we will certainly stay with them again on our next visit to New York.  Thank you to everyone at the Hotel Elysee!

title: Best boutique hotel in New York!
text:
This was our 15th time staying at this hotel.
We love the hotel's European ambiance, most friendly and efficient service, quiet rooms and a great location.
While in NY we would not stay anywhere else. Period.

title: Hotel Elysee is warm and friendly
text: A great place to stay. Excellent location, friendly staff and very comfortable rooms. It feels like family. The morning brunch is quite varied and filling as is the afternoon wine and cheese selection.

title: Improve rooms
text:
Room 143 had 2 refrigerators, that were not working in the room.  It felt like a storage room.  The carpet was old and needed cleaning. Very poor water pressure.
The bathroom update and size of room were good. The breakfast, staff and  and location were excellent.  Left with mixed feelings

title: Good hotel, outstanding service !
text: I spent five days with my daughters and grand daughter. From check in to check out, we felt welcome. At the front desk, they did their best to make our stay pleasant. The breakfast and the wine and cheese in the evening were catered by a group of very efficient and gentle women. I will surely come back to this hotel

title: A delightful stay in a wonderful midtown location!
text: The accommodations, service, positive attitudes of staff, morning and late afternoon food & beverage offerings and 'European feel' of this boutique hotel resulted in a great four night stay in the city.  An exceptional doorman, Gary, went above and beyond locating transportation a block away when congestion was at its peak!

title: Fantastic stay at the Elysee!
text: We had a wonderful week at the Ellylsee. Our room was lovely. We really enjoyed having the terrace; it made our anniversary extra special.  The breakfast in the morning was very good and the staff of young ladies eager to please and very hard working.  It is a lovely, relaxing atmosphere.Your front desk of professionals were excellent in restaurant suggestions and answering whatever questions we may of had. And of course, we loved the location, walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. We had a great time and look forward to returning to the Elysee.

title: NYC birhday
text: Love this place! I always stay at the Hotel Elysee when I'm in NYC. The entire staff treats me extremely well. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. I always feel welcome, plus I always make new friends during the wonderful Happy Hour and Continental breakfast.

title: Lovely Hotel in New York City
text: I just celebrated my 80th birthday with my daughters in NYC and stayed at the Elysee Hotel.  They made us feel like we were their family.  The whole staff was so attentive to our needs from the moment we arrived to our checkout.  I will be recommending this Hotel to all my friends.  Everything about the place is nice, from the comfortable room ,wine and cheese reception and breakfast.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: I can’t find a thing wrong with the Hotel Elysee.  The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very nice and the afternoon wine and cheese is lovely. This was our second stay and will not be our last. Location is excellent.

title: Nice stay in central NY
text: We stayed @Elysee for a weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday. Very centrally located, everything in central NY is in walkable distance. Looks like much older people likes this hotel very much - I felt like a kid between them being in a mid 50s... Rooms and the whole hotel in a need of refreshing but maybe that's the charm of old glory?

title: NY Holiday
text: We have been staying at The Elysee for 30 years.  Love it.  The amenities are unparalleled in Manhattan.  The Elysee is a smaller hotel, a bit shabby chic at this point but a wonderful place to rest when visiting NYC.

title: A great location!
text: Although the lobby and stairwell are a bit shabby and in need of refreshing the hotel was delightful and the staff friendly and very helpful.  The location is perfect and the hotel is on a quiet street.  Our room was clean and fresh and quiet.  The second floor breakfast room is delightfully casual and european in feeling..

title: Excellent Elysee
text: We found the Hotel Elysee to be conveniently located with plenty of room and excellent amenities. The staff were all friendly and knowledgeable about surrounding points of interest. One of the best places we have stayed while visiting the city.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: Charming hotel with unique rooms and friendly staff.  The rooms are clean and well-maintained.  The breakfast is generous and the wine and cheese reception each evening is truly lovely.  Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Outdated and poor shower.
text: The hotel is loaded with charm and has a great location, but is in serious need of an update.  Service was friendly and afternoon wine tasting was a nice feature.  Cold breakfast items were sufficient, but a steam table with some hot options would have been nice.

title: ALWAYS INTIMATE, ALWAYS WELCOMING
text: Elysee Hotel is my Manhattan home away from home. The location - 54th Street between Park and Madison Avenues - is perfect for me. It's a quiet as can be expected in midtown. I very much appreciate the 2nd floor living room / library area, stocked with teas, cookies and fruit. I'm always comfortable at the Elysee.

title: It's like staying with your sophisticated New York aunt
text:
We really love staying here.  Now that I've turned eighty, it's better than ever.  First of all, you are greeted by well dressed, extremely polite young people who act just the way you wish your grandchildren would act.  Perfect ladies and gentlemen.

There's a slightly mid-20th century feel to the decor, muted greens and pinks in the bedroom.  There's plenty of space in our room.  The beds were very comfortable.

My favorite part is the second floor where guests have wine and cheese in the late afternoon and breakfast in the morning.  The staff are very efficient and I can't believe they can service so many people...remember everyone's coffee order, getting the toasted bagel to the right person.  It's a lovely space.  Aunt Grace knows just where to put the orchids and where to tuck away the tables for privacy when possible.  You'll love it.

title: Another fantastic stay at The Elysee Hotel
text: I feel when I arrive at The Elysee Hôtel that I am coming home! What a fabulous boutique hotel in the heart of midtown.  The location is superb!  The continental breakfast in the lounge is such a win rather than finding a coffee shop for breakfast and the cheese and wine each evening is another added extra which just makes this hotel so different from your average New York Hôtel!  Aside from this the rooms are delightful and the beds some of the most comfortable I have slept in! Elysee I will be back! Thank you!

title: Outstanding service, room, hospitality
text: We recently stayed at the Elysee for the first time and, simply, it exceeded all of my expectations.  The room was gorgeous and large -- we were upgraded to a junior suite, never expecting that nice surprise.  Excellent pillows . . . which make a difference!  The bathroom was spotless, with both a shower and tub as well as high-end toiletries.  The front desk staff went above and beyond to be helpful.  Breakfast is ample - fruit, cereals, pastries, tea, coffee - and served in the 2nd floor club room.  A special recognition goes to Erica, who was the epitome of friendly hospitality and helpfulness. The same room is the site of the cocktail hour, which offers wine, cheese, crackers, crudites.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat and, given that we visit NY regularly, surely will.

title: A friendly and beautiful hotel
text: We just spent a wonderful weekend at the beautiful Elysee Hotel.  The staff could not have been more helpful, the room was large, comfortable, beautifully appointed, and quiet.  We are looking forward to our next stay at the Elysee Hotel.

title: A guest for many years
text: I have been staying at the Elysee since the 1960s. It is our favorite hotel in NYC! Staying at the Elysee is a very European experience. The staff is knowledgeable and very helpful. Continental breakfast is a real treat.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: Efficient, professional service from all employees, especially the front desk. When  Millie, the room attendant, finished the room it was sparkling clean and the beds were picture perfect. Isaiah got us a cab on a rainy evening during rush hour. The breakfast and cocktail staff were always smiling and personable.

title: What Makes Elysee Distinctive
text:
Having stayed at Elysee numbers of times, this hotel remains distinctive !

Distinctive is the experience of staying in a place in the city that feels residential and a place where one feels as a guest (rather than a customer).

And the nicest people one meets and greets at Elysee - both the management and the guests !  Everyone is friendly and polite - and this includes the children staying as well !  

People gather in the lounge for breakfast and wine/snacks in the evening.  Guests are singles, couples, groups, families - and from around the world.  The atmosphere and experience are the best !

title: Home in NYC
text: The Hotel Elysee is a hidden gem in NYC.  Having stayed there over 15 years for the US Open and on other weekend trips to the city I consider it my home away from home.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, helpful with recommendations and even the doormen remember you from visit to visit.  The size of the hotel makes it a very intimate setting and the breakfast each morning and wine and cheese each afternoon are in a warm and inviting room where people can interact in a casual manner.  The rooms do not have the new stylish ambiance, but rather a step back into tradition and style.  I will sacrifice modern design schemes for the old school any day to stay at this hotel.  Located between Madison and Park on East 54th there are many great restaurants close by, the subway is a couple of blocks away and you can easily walk to shopping and other attractions.

title: Elegance with the comforts of home
text: My stays at the Hotel Elysee make me feel as if I'm visiting old friends.  All of the staff are knowledgeable, helpful, and gracious.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and extremely well-appointed.  I can't imagine a better place to stay.

title: Excellent as always
text: My wife and I have stayed here several times previously. The location is excellent if you wish to be away from the hustle of Times Square. It is just a few blocks from Central  Park and all of the better stores. The hotel is small but with excellent staff and breakfast is included in the rate and served in the club room where from 5 pm to 8 ok wine and nibbles are also provided. Perhaps it is time for the bedrooms to be upgraded now as the rooms are beginning to suffer from usage.

title: Old style accommodations and service
text:
Old style hotel with grace and genuine attention to details. Wonderful breakfast that did not change but was very good and a large selection. Evening wine and cheese also available. 
Very convenient to the subway, museums and walkable to Time Square.
Will return. If a light sleeper,only drawback was choice of noise from street or noise from A/C.

title: Excellent
text: The staff, all of them without exception, are what make this such a gem. Add a great buffet breakfast and free wine and snacks each night, and you have a hotel in a prime location which is hard to beat. Ok so it has some "lived in" and tired parts, but it is my favourite small boutique hotel in Manhattan

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text: The location is great and more importantly the staff (front desk, housekeeping and gathering room) demonstrates exceptional customer service.  Regarding our room ... the bed and pillows were comfortable, the room furnishings were a little tired/worn. Hotel is quiet.  Will definitely stay on next NYC visit.

title: Outstanding
text: Hotel Elysee was recommended by friends whom had lived in the city for years.  It exceeded our expectations.  We were assigned the Presidential suite, which we truly appreciated. The hotel is beautiful, old school New York.  Staff is outstanding. Monkey bar was a great place for a nightcap after full days with family.  Perfect. Could not have had nicer accommodations. We will return.

title: Charming!
text:
I recently came into the city for an event at the DoubleTree Metropolitan.  After reading a host of negative reviews about that hotel (which were later echoed by my colleagues who didn't heed the internet's advice and stayed there anyway), I made the wise choice to stay at Hotel Elysee instead.  This was the hotel that an ex-boss of mine always chose to stay at when he came to NYC, and I now understand why.

What a charming property!  The rooms and public areas are all dripping with old-school NYC elegance, and the service matches.  The breakfast was more than ample and I still can't believe it was complimentary.  The rates were VERY reasonable for NYC, especially for the large sized rooms.  I have never stayed in a NYC hotel room this large (and I just had a regular king bed room), and it's also one of the lowest prices I've encountered for this area of the city.

I also had a the pleasure of dining at the Monkey Bar while I was in town and would highly recommend its food and atmosphere!

title: Return to NYC
text:
My husband surprised me with a four day spoiling in NYC. I was celebrating a BIG birthday  (60) !

I usually am the planner in the family this was all on him .

  This was my 8th visit  to the city and I can say it is probably my favourite big city to spend time in ! So much to do and see. I am also a huge theater  lover. 

Side note - 10 years ago the plan was NYC for my fiftieth . I had never been before  and was so excited to go...unfortunately breast cancer had other plans for me . My surgery was booked for August so no 50 celebrations for me ....my husband took me a week before surgery to get my mind off of what was to come. Needless to say that trip was a blur of fear and tears. Every year after that for about 5 years I took my daughter with me and we celebrated with shopping and Broadway. My husband not a fan of the Theater or shopping . 

My dream was to see Hamilton but back when it opened you needed a second mortgage to see it . My husband also arranged this as a part of my birthday surprise, but I digress onto Hotel Elysee !
 
We arrived mid afternoon. Upon arrival first impression a step back in time . Room is ready - I ask if it is a room not facing the street -it is so asked to be changed to a room with less street noise (not my first time here) . 

We open the door and uggh nope. OK typical big city room small but I've been here before and the smallest room I have ever seen in NYC. A quick call down stairs and we are moved to a suite $50 more a night. We do enjoy a smaller hotel boutique style . I found hotel Elysee very dated tired  probably last refurbished in the 80s would be my guess.

Room /Suite

VERY spacious living area- furniture has seen better days   ,large bedroom,-hard bed ,  hallway to large bathroom - so biggest  room I have stayed at in NYC ! 

My daughter and I have stayed at The Kimpton properties in years past The MUSE and 70 Park Ave ( which is now the Iberostar) the reason I mention this is the Wine hour they provide  to compared to hotel Elysee.  Elysee wins big here it is more than 1 hour and the wines much nicer than at the Kimpton. The cheese plates and other items  beat out the Kimpton properties as well. It has the same premise meet other guests if you so wish. It is held in a large private room on the second floor,  not the hotel lobby where The Kimptons host their wine hour and  seating is limited...Elysee offers red ,white, and prosecco .  Breakfast is served here as well enjoyed this before setting off for the day. Nothing beats a NYC bagel IMO.

We had some cocktails at the famous Monkey bar and the late night pianist was wonderful again felt like I stepped back in time .

The staff wonderful -  but no one asked if it was a special occasion ...it was

Would I stay here again probably not too many choices in NYC.

title: Our second visit and not our last!
text:
Wonderful.

Location is excellent.  The staff are friendly (front desk, bell and room service), all chatty but not interfering.  Doors opened without fuss or awkwardness, turn-down & room service team are like ghosts!

The lift wasn't working but that's ok.  We were only on the 4th floor and the service lift guy was friendly when we needed the lift.  No waiting, not cramped.  All good.

The AC in our room (43) was spot on.  Did a good job.

We were originally in room 41 but asked to be moved as we had a walk in shower not a bath.  They moved us to 43 in moments, no fuss, no messing, just one call downstairs and someone appeared in 45 seconds to move our stuff.

The evening reception is wonderful, very quiet and sophisticated. The breakfast is excellent too.  We always had a seat... again, quiet and well run.

Wake up service was to the second.  We also purchased a bunch of bits in the city that needed to be kept cold; we used the complementary fridge in reception. All good there too.  

Ah, there was one thing...  I went to pour my own wine during the reception evening and the waitress was very quick to "help" me, taking the bottle and explaining "it's not self service", maybe some local law or something.

Yes, it's an old building, it's boutique but that's what we want and we love it! 

Will 100% be back!

title: Too 'boutiquey' for us
text: It is very 'charming' and all the staff are very friendly. That being said... I prefer a more updated property. The air con in our room could barely cool the space and made a noise like a revving car engine every 8 seconds (I did actually time it)- the entire night. Needless to say it was difficult to sleep. The guest elevator was out of service- which I didn't initially mind- things break.... but the service elevator was very slow, and in the morning it was being used for laundry, and- well, service- so it by-passed guests waiting. Guests waiting in a dingy, hot service staircase- next to bags of laundry & trash. Not pleasant at all & no accommodations were offered... no apologies... a complimentary drink at the bar perhaps? - no. The location is good- short walk to E, 6, 4 & 5. The shower was hot- no unexpected fluctuating water temperatures & good water pressure. WiFi was spotty. Monkey Bar was crowded, but good atmosphere & good drinks. Not sure I would choose to stay there again.

title: Ótimo hotel!
text:
Ficamos 11 noites no hotel. Quarto amplo, localização excelente, café da manhã delicioso, com funcionários super prestativos.
Nossa estadia foi maravilhosa.
O elevador social estava com defeito e assim permaneceu durante todo o tempo que estávamos lá, mas, pudemos usar o elevador de serviço, oque acabou sendo até um charme a mais.
Recomendo o hotel.

title: Authentic old world charm
text: Before the Waldorf closed it was our go to hotel in Manhattan....it was old world, charming and it brought you back to another time....Hotel Elysee does the same thing on a smaller scale and a MUCH smaller price tag. Do not come here if you’re looking for a Hyatt/Marriott  cookie cutter type hotel...it’s not flashy or new..what it is is charming and authentically old world...I love the feel of it...I love the price point...if you want perfection go to the Pierre for $1000 a night.....this hotel is clean , perfectly located , has a happy hour and breakfast buffet all with a great staff...

title: Theater weekend
text:
Yes-as everyone said, the  guest elevator was not working . However they had some very nice guys (hello Tyrell!) running the freight elevator for the guests. I have stayed at other larger hotels in Times Square area for conventions-and found the waits be even worse!

The decor could be refreshed... but please not at the expense of the murals in the Monkey Bar and restaurant. There is a quaint  charm to them.

We found the beds comfortable, the linens clean and crisp. Great water pressure in bath and very clean. We have had much smaller baths in other NYC hotels so this was a pleasant surprise. As was the efficiency of the cleaning crews. The noise level was much better than other NYC hotels we have stayed in. A minor glitch with a/c the first night but a fan was promptly provided and a quick repair was done. When we needed more pillows, and a coffee pot (to avoid the trek down the elevator) they were quickly and cheerfully provided. 

The bell staff and front desk helped us with taxis and car service. Great dining nearby, and close to everything we wanted. This is not a resort hotel by any means but a good place to lay your head while in the city for fun.

title: Unhappy with the experience.
text:
We are a family of four and stayed at the Elysee Hotel for six nights between 3-9 July and were really unhappy with the experience.

There has been lots said on other reviews about the guest lift being out of order.  These things happen and normally we would understand, however we feel we were misled about the situation.  On checking in we were informed the “The main lift not available today due to maintenance”.  Clearly the lift had been out of order days before we arrived and from responses to other reviews from the management, it was known the lift was going to be out of order for some time.  Each day when we asked when the lift was going to be working, we were given vague responses.  The reason for our daily inquires was because a large part of going to/from our rooms was either long waits for the service lift or walking up/down seven floors. If we had an honest response that a part was being manufactured, we would have been more tolerant with the situation.  At times we had to squeeze into the service lift along domestic staff and clear plastic bags of rubbish and bedding from rooms, it was either that or an extended wait for the lift to return.  The lift and domestic staff were excellent and steadfast in adversity and a credit to the hotel. 

The rooms were a good size and very clean, however décor was drab and needs to be brought up to date.  The Air conditioning in the room was efficient but extremely noisy, for that reason we turned it off before sleeping and therefore we had less than comfortable nights due to the heat.  On three of the nights the guests in the room next door had showers after midnight which of course they are entitled to do, however the noise from the water flowing through the pipes woke us up as it was really noisy and we didn’t sleep until the shower was turned off.  

The lounge on floor two was disappointing, it was too small for the number of guests, we only sat together at half of our six breakfasts as there were no tables for four available.  The continental breakfast was ok but not great.  If you drink wine or fizz the evening drinks included in the resort fee of $25 was great and enjoyed by my wife, I do not drink wine/fizz and therefore asked for a beer knowing that I would have to pay as this wasn’t included, however I was informed I would have to go to the Monkey Bar to collect myself.  Due to the lift issue this was not a relaxing experience and considering I had to go myself is not great customer service. 

On three of our six days the Monkey bar and restaurant was closed due to the holiday.  We were not informed of this at check-in and it was not displayed on the hotel website.  I discovered this on night two after we went to the lounge, my wife had a glass of fizz and I went to the Monkey bar to get a beer to join her.  Obviously disappointed I went to reception who directed me to the local shop!  In my opinion this is unacceptable for a hotel that boasts a bar and restaurant onsite, especially as it provides room service which was also unavailable for the three days.

Wi-fi in our room was excellent, however in our teenagers’ room it kept failing resulting in lots of complaining as anyone with teenagers would understand.  In the lounge it was good in some areas and poor in others.

On a positive note the location of the hotel is great and within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, theatre district and lots of shops and restaurants.  

Finally, when we checked out, we were not asked how our stay was! I cannot think of another hotel we have visited that has failed to ask that question.

I am sorry we do not recommend this hotel and won’t stay there again.  I would like to make it clear that the adverse comments about the lift and bar/restaurant would not have been made if the management had ensured the staff had informed us of the situation at check-in.

title: Odd and old / fire code
text: Slightly bizarre hotel, like a 70s Miami Italian restaurant meets unrenovated New York mid century building. My room was at the back, and as others have said, was noisy (very dated aircon), slightly damp smelling and cramped. Most concerning thing was that due to the lifts being slow, the guest use the fire escape staircase, and the hotel has tied the fire doors open. I am pretty sure this is a fire code violation, and is definitely bad practice. I noticed the doors in the evening and it was the same at check out. Manager, please correct this.

title: Very nice
text: Rooms are very nicely decorated, very clean. Comfortable bed. We had a deluxe king room on the 7th floor. The first room we had was in the back of the hotel, which looks out on the backs of tall buildings with large air conditioning units making a lot of noise. It was dark and depressing, so we were able to be moved to the front on the same floor. It was somewhat larger, much brighter, and not any  noisier despite street noise. The bathrooms were cramped in both rooms, but somewhat larger in the second. The second floor lounge is very nice, with a nice continental breakfast and an  evening reception. Excellent service from everyone in the hotel.

title: muy recomendable
text: en un barrio tranquilo y muy seguro cerca de varios bares y restaurantes para todo tipos de presupuesto a una cuadra y media de la quinta avenida y a cuatro cuadras del central park  buena habitacion y limpieza buen desayuno  y para destacar bebidas y picada de la 17 a las 20 especial saludo a todo el personal que se destaca por su calidez y amabilidad   seguramente volveremos

title: Great neighbourhood but not comparable to the Library Hotel in the same collection
text:
I feel rather badly writing this but felt compelled to make sure travellers if booking here know exactly what they are going to get vis a vis rooms, etc. Much has been said about the elevator- yes its slow and small. I guess the biggest disappointment was our room- a Junior suite that was so run down and old looking i thought I might have been back in my dearly departed great Aunt's house. There is only so much you can do without a major reno- sheets, bedding, mattresses, bathroom, analog tvs,light fixtures all need to be thrown out and start anew. The room price wasn't inexpensive and due to my pre payment I was not able to check out immediately without losing  money. if I could have I would have checked out as soon as I saw the room. I went to the second floor lounge(great feature but too small) where they serve complementary breakfast and happy hour drinks and snacks. Neither time proved to be enough to entice me to stay although a lot of their clientele love the "free breakfast" I must say that I have never seen staff work as hard as the servers did at breakfast time-lots of demands for toasted bagels a certain way and special coffees. I did not see anyone except one other customer leave any type of gratuity.
The rooms had a step to the bathroom which is so dangerous and the shower stall is definitely not a size that everyone would fit in. The AC in the room worked but not the quietest.
I would hope they would announce a closure to upgrade the hotel.

title: Call and ask if elevator is working
text: This week, I've spent four nights at this hotel. Overall, it has been a good stay, but I think it is dishonest of them to wait until after you've checked in to disclose that the elevator is not working. The elevator has been broken for about 3 weeks now and isn't expected to be fixed for another couple of weeks, so obviously they are well aware of the problem. But when you check in they tell you all about breakfast and other relevant issues, but wait until you are walking away from the front desk to go to your room before they say, "oh by the way the elevator isn't working so you'll have to use the service elevator." The service  elevator is very small and hot and there is often quite a wait to use it because the staff needs it as well as the guests. And it is accessed through the back stairwell, so on the 13th floor we need to wait in a small area with the laundry and garbage. Plus, in violation of the city code, they keep the fire doors open which could present a real problem if there is a fire in the building. A second issue  is that I read on TripAdvisor that guests can use a gym nearby, but that is not something they tell guests about. And third, the internet is unreliable. The decor is traditional, but I have no problem with that. Do look at the visitor's photos of the rooms, however, and not those posted by the hotel. My room looks nothing like the photos shown by the hotel on TripAdvisor. Our housekeeper has been great and the young man who operates the service elevator is very kind.

title: Great find
text: Really enjoyed my stay at hotel elysee!  Convenient midtown location. Very safe. Nice breakfast each morning complimentary and the room is open all day long for coffee and tea. Very reasonably priced for midtown. Main elevator was out of service so had to use the service elevator but worked out better than expected.  Would recommend having a drink in the monkey bar.

title: Sei giorni a midtown
text: A distanza di due anni siamo tornati nella stessa struttura. Riconfermo le note precedenti. Hotel raffinato. Disponibile il personale. Arredamento nelle parti comuni e in camera, d impatto. Aspetti caratterizzanti: colazione che seppur con varietà limitata è di assoluta qualità e la possibilità di fruire di bevande durante tutta la giornata e di un aperitivo con formaggi, verdure e vini dalle 17 alle 20. Consigliato.

title: Good, small hotel
text: Great price for the location. About a mile east of Times Square. It is dated or retro - depending on how you look at it. The elevator was broken but connected to a restaurant if you wanted to use that one. Good size rooms for NYC. The housekeeper did come in my room at 8:30am which is not how I wanted to wake up my first jet lagged morning. But I survived. It’s good - not spectacular. But the price point for where it is is the best thing.

title: Slip into a 1940s reality show --
text:
I mean, I’m sure there are other hotels in New York City other than Hotel Elysee. Maybe one or two or a hundred thousand. Give or take. 

But for me, there has only been one. I’ve come to the city a dozen times over the last two years and Hotel Elysee — because of their economical luxury, their perfect location, and their heartwarming staff — has been the sole option for me and my company. The cast and crew of Hotel Elysee have been at the heart of each conference, investor pitch and high-stress meeting, and they’ve always made a Victorian home for us.

Don’t get me wrong. I love contemporary design, stark white, minimalistic spaces. But you can (and do) get that everywhere. This European-style carriage hotel is the royal escape from the city while perfectly situated inside the city. Walking down to the Monkey Bar during happy hour makes you feel like you’re on a 1940s reality show, where off-color jokes and double-entendre slip off the tongue a little easier after a few martinis. This pleases the writerly spirits who still frequent the restaurant. Run, don’t walk, to Hotel Elysee — and while you have your jazz shoes on — do a little dance while you’re there.

title: Location, location, location but.....
text: Location is great , rooms are a nice size by NY standards and staff are friendly but no working passenger elevator, and terrible wifi are simply inexcusable. " Members" lounge is a nice touch, with a decent continental breakfast and snacks all day long. Some reviewers commented that the hotel is "dated" but this is more a matter pf personal taste. This is NOT a chic, boutique hotel, this is old school country inn type "charm". If that is your taste you will like it, as long as the elevator has been fixed and the wifi doesn't drive you crazy.

title: Deeply disappointed!
text:
I booked two rooms at this hotel for five days for a much-anticipated family trip.  The price was high, but I was confident and excited because the hotel has good reviews and was part of the Library Hotel Collection.  What we received was shockingly disappointing.  

First, the hotel’s elevator was out for the entire stay - a fact that should have been disclosed to us before we checked in. We were forced to use the hotel’s ancient freight elevator, which was slow, ugly, hot and usually unavailable because it was (predictably) full of staff or repair people.  The entire process of entering and leaving the hotel was constantly difficult and unpleasant.

Second, the hotel’s restaurant and bar, which are the basis of many of the good reviews, failed to open for three of the five days and closed early the other days, so there were no facilities of any kind available for much of the stay. A hotel without a restaurant, bar or fitness center is not a first rate hotel.

Third, the rooms themselves, along with the entire hotel, are frankly tired looking and obsolete (very few electrical outlets; slow and inconsistent WiFi).  I expected a more attractive and business-friendly facility.  

Finally, while the staff was mostly friendly, the management was indifferent to the fact that the hotel was operating at such a poor level for us.  It offered no meaningful accommodations.  

The Library Collection should be embarrassed to have this facility as one if its signature hotels.  I rarely post negative reviews, but believe it is appropriate in this case. I can not recommend this hotel.

title: Dated and Stuffy
text: Disappointing after viewing posted photos and reviews.  My room was very well worn and watch the slight step up into the bathroom or you will painfully stub your toe.  Front desk and staff are friendly, but unfortunately, do not make up for the condition of the hotel.   If however, you are primarily looking for location, it is well situated near shopping and relatively comfortable walking distance to Times Square.

title: Great location
text: Very friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble, highly recommended. Great location within walking distance to all attractions, happy hour (free cheese, biscuits & wine between 5-8 a big hit, rooms clean,

title: Great staff and atmosphere
text: I’ve stayed at most of the fancy hotels in NYC and was positively surprised after spending four days at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and genuine and the continental breakfast that was complimentary is the best one I’ve had in the city. The friendly environment and positive attitude especially in the breakfast room was unprecedented. Highly recommend this place and the location is great.

title: Room was gracious in size, but lacked personality
text: While I did not care for the hotel, the room was a nice size. The furnishing were tired.  There is only one elevator and that meant we were constantly waiting for a an old and slow elevator.   I found the hotel to be nondescript.  I thought the service was very average.  I did not think that there was much interest in the guests.  You had to step up and around the corner to get to bathroom.  It was very awkward.   I would not stay at this hotel again.

title: Surprisingly spacious for New York
text:
The room were spacious, and comfortable. The hotel was in a good central location which is always important.

Check in was quick and efficient

The decor wasn't really my style, I prefer something a bit more modern, but for a decent price and the space I'll forgive that.

Breakfast wasn't anything special, but at least you got something included.

title: Conveniently Located Midtown Hotel
text:
We visited with our adult children so had two rooms on the tenth floor. The rooms were clean and well laid out. The residents lounge was a good place to relax. The evening complimentary wine and cheese was most welcome. The standard of buffet breakfast served there each morning was good.

The staff were helpful particularly the doormen and the ladies serving breakfast. 
The lift broke down several times during our stay so we had to use the service lift along with the poor staff trying to get on with their work.

The hotel is very conveniently located between Times Sq and Central Park. 
Overall we enjoyed our stay there although it’s a bit dated for the price. 

The hotel ordered us a taxi back to JFK and the driver was really dangerous. I took his name and taxi number in case of an accident. We had been in many taxis during our stay and whilst the drivers weave in and out of the lanes on the road; none of them were foolhardy. The driver who took us back drove one handed whilst holding his phone to get directions and missed turnings and drove at high speeds through housing estates. I ended up hyperventilating in the taxi. Even my husband was shaken when we got dropped off in the middle of the access road. Just thought it best to mention in case the hotel uses this driver often.

title: Beautiful boutique hotel in NYC.
text: We were traveling for business/pleasure and had the chance to stay for the night at the Hotel Elysee.  There was a minor room kerfuffle at check in, but Juan at the front desk, quickly resolved the situation and we were extremely satisfied with the result.  An approximate $25 resort fee is added to the room rate, but it provides for an appetizer/wine happy hour in the early evening and continental breakfast in the morning, both of which were delicious!  The room was clean and comfortable and the service was amazing.  The hotel location is within easy walking distance of many tourist highlights and great restaurants. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Elysee for travelers to New York City.

title: Excellent Élysée
text:
Another fabulous stay at the Élysée. We love the central location and the Residents’ Lounge. Staff were friendly efficient and resourceful as always.
We stayed in a Grand King Suite with a small kitchenette which proved very useful.

title: Home away from Home in New York
text: When we go to New York we love to stay the Hotel Elysee. It is our 'Home away from Home' in New York City. It is very European style with breakfast and Happy Hour included. The location is superb and there are four really good restaurants conveniently located nearby, Three across the street and one in the Hotel, The historic Monkey Bar. It is just so comfortable there. Pam Hughes

title: Wow!!!  What a charming hotel in the middle of New York city!
text:
When my sister and I traveled to NYC to celebrate my 65th birthday, I wanted to stay at a nice hotel that was in walking distance to theaters, museums and subway stops.  I chose Hotel Elysee after reading numerous reviews and then discussing with a friend who had recently stayed there.

From our arrival, where we were warmly greeted by the doorman and welcomed by the front desk staff, I knew we were in for a treat!  Hotel Elysee reminds me of a European hotel that is quaint, small yet luxurious.  The rooms are large by NYC standards and with 2 beds, we still have ample room to be comfortable.  Because I was celebrating my 65th birthday, a bottle of wine and a box of chocolates were waiting for me in my room which was an unexpected surprise and such a nice touch!

The beds were extremely comfortable and quality linens and we appreciated being able to control our own temperature level which allowed for cooler temperatures at night which afforded quality and restful sleeping.  Nice toiletries in the bathroom, in room safe which we used and 2 bottles of water provided each day!

A lovely breakfast is provided each day which fueled us until early afternoon.  If you are lazy and don't want to venture down for breakfast, they will even deliver it to your room for only $5 per person.  The fruit was ripe and so delicious, excellent yogurt, pastries, cereals, etc.  Fruit, cookies, tea and coffee are also available all day long.

The afternoon Happy Hour is 3 hours in length which is perfect to stop by on the way home from a day of sightseeing or stop by before heading out to the theater or dinner.  Lovely selection of wines and prosecco were offered as well as veggies, dip, cheese, crackers, olives and nuts.  It was so inviting to sit down on the couches and relax and chat with other guests and hear where they were from and what they were doing in the city.

The staff is extremely helpful with directions, cabs, explaining subway stops as well as dinner reservations and treat you like a celebrity as well as family.  I could go on and on but I think that you get the picture that Hotel Elysee is now the only place that I will be staying when in New York.

title: A little class on 54th
text: Chose to stay at the Hotel Elysee by Library, New York based on recommendation and I wasn’t disappointed. A cheery welcome from the doorman Gary and an escorted introduction to my room was very welcome after a long day of travel. The style is old world, the corridors and rooms peppered with antiques real or otherwise. The bed was very comfortable and the corner King Room to the front was very roomy. The second floor is the hotel’s hub, a pleasant lounge area doubling as the venue for the complimentary continental breakfast, an evening complimentary happy hour, and all-night beverages and biscuits. The room is well used with some patrons lounging on couches late into the evening, doing their thing while listening to soft melodic jazz in the background. The continental breakfast was perfect… beautiful fruit salad, cereals, bakery items and coffee and tea. The friendly staff will toast items for you and make you a latte if that’s your preference. And then they’re back pouring red, white and sparkling in the evening and replenishing the cheeseboard and snacks. The only negative for me was the WIFI. Our room seemed to have some issue connecting despite the hotel recently installing new routers. After two days of my six-day stay, the hotel upgraded us to a king suite with separate lounge and kitchenette. The WIFI situation was solved and the room was a treat. The measure of a good hotel is how they deal with problems; the Hotel Elysee showed why it rates so well with its visitors.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location!
text:
Excellent location for walking and the subway. Wonderful Hotel with lots of character, comfy beds, nice staff, delicious breakfast and awesome wine and cheese!
And the Monkey Bar for a drink with the pianist - had a great time!
Love NY!! Will be back!

title: Excelente elección
text:
Esta muy buen ubicado, en una zona cerca de todo , con muchas tiendas para comprar, a una cuadra de la quinta avenida y a 3 del Central Park
La atención fue excelente, las habitaciones muy limpias .
Brindan un desayuno correcto y de muy buena calidad, y de 17 a20hs brindan un aperitivo con distintos vinos y quesos de cortesía. 
Enviamos paquetes y lo recibieron sin ningún problema
Volvería a elegir este hotel. Muy recomendable

title: A good find in a great location...
text: Just come back from our first visit in New York, and with so many places to choose from its always a bit of a lottery to find a good place to stay but the Elysee really was a great find. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the rooms were nicely decorated and clean, the view from our room was not the best but it was nice and quiet which is a real bonus in such a busy place. Breakfast was not extensive, but to be honest I did not visit the city to spend the time eating,and there was more than sufficient choice to start the day. The cheese and wine in the afternoon was a nice touch and again, the staff there were always on hand to give a top up! Happy to recommend the Elysee to friends..

title: Great find in midtown
text: This hotel was great - clean, safe, as quiet as a midtown location could be for sleeping.  Not your usual chain hotel - lots of character. I would definitely stay here again.  One thing - I wish there were more gluten free breakfast options.

title: 11 nights at The Elysée
text:
Hotel Elysée and the services it offers went far beyond what my family and I expected. 
The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and offered a great view from the terrasse.
Each and every member of the staff did everything they could to make our stay memorable: courteous, helpful, attentive, professional and eager to meet our requests. 
Breakfast buffet: excellent fresh fruit salad every day, great variety of food, and personal attention from the personnel at every moment.
Wine and cheese: such a civilized way of ending the day before going out for dinner.
My family, who came from Europe, was highly impressed.

title: Local residents visiting NYC
text: Staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The facility was well maintained and functional items such as towels, toiletries were first rate. The effort to assist us with whatever we needed was welcome and encourages us to revisit.

title: Still love this hotel
text:
We have stayed at Hotel Elysee many times and always are delighted to return.  This time we had a slight issue in checking in as I specifically had called to make the reservations requesting a room not near the elevators and one with a stall shower.  We got the room away from the elevators but not with a stall shower. This is a smaller boutique hotel and every room has its own charms and quirks.

Anyway, with a little encouragement including stating that we would be checking out the next day and would not pay for the room for the night unless they made this "right" they did.

Had I not spoken to the front desk just a few days before our arrival to confirm that all was in order I might not have been so upset but in the end, all was fine.

The daily breakfasts and evening wine and cheese in the library area on the second floor are a treat and the staff there is very helpful and attentive.

Location is great, within walking distance to the theater if it isn't raining or in the true heat of summer and near great restaurants, shopping etc.

We will still return the next time we visit NY

title: Everything looks beautiful on pictures!
text:
Sorry but this is not a good hotel . Everything looks nice on pictures so I hesitate if it is really any meaning reading opinions and looking on pictures before booking hotel. I blame myself not beeing enough observant before booking!
The hotel is:
1. Overpriced.
2. Not very clean. 
3. Furnitures old and worn. 
4. Very noisy from the street. 
5. Carparking on both sides of the hotel. 
6.  Breakfast very traditional and not many choices.
7. Good points is the location!
8. The welcoming was nice with a bottle of wine and chocolates.
9. Happy hours in the late afternoon is ok with wine, cheese and some vegetables. 
10 BUT the hotel lack style and engagement, this basic things as cleaning and updating the standard in general  are abscent. 
And the television is analogical as the staff has not even try to arrange  digital transmission!
Why have a hotel when this lack of engagement and joy?
3 mai -13 mai

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Totally exceeded our expectations! We stayed for 8 nights and can’t recommend highly enough. The doormen were very helpful, whatever time of day it was. The complimentary continental breakfast, the coffee, cookies and fruit throughout the day and the wine and cheese every night between 5 and 8 were all very welcome. The room was a great size, the bathroom was a great size with a bath tub. We were on level 10, with street views. Although NYC is noisy our room was not. The bed was king size and extremely comfortable. The best part though were the staff, they could not do enough to assist you. The girls in the lounge area were just delightful. Excellent location! If we ever get back to New York we will definitely stay again. Thank you so much, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Wonderful Place
text: Having just returned from a weekend visit to New York, I am anxious to recommend this property. Not only is the location ideal, but every other aspect exceeded my expectations. To begin with, I was upgraded to a suite, which certainly added to my pleasure.  Staff members are, without exception, professionals who aim to please. A continental breakfast and wine and cheese (5-8) are certainly welcome, as is the “old world” decor with antiques. One minor irritant is the one elevator, which can take quite a while. Nevertheless, that’s a small price to pay for the overall excellence of this wonderful property.

title: Lukewarm
text: This place was OK in general. In particular the doorman was helpful in getting a taxi, which was surprisingly difficult at that location. It was very dark in the bathroom at night; some sort of flashlight was needed there. The view we had was only of other buildings. The location was convenient for us, withing walking distance of St. Thomas Episcopal Church

title: Old world charm
text: Staff very friendly. We liked the complementary continental buffet breakfast and the snacks and coffee available all day.  We weren't able to take advantage of the wine and cheese put out at 3 each day because we had show tickets.  The room was small but well appointed, but the traditional furnishings reminded us of our time in Paris. We were on the 11th floor and facing the street and it was quiet. We enjoyed our stay and definitely would stay again.

title: Home away from home.
text:
We arrived early, so we retired to the library and made ourselves comfortable with some tea( free). Another couple had arrived before we dif, so they came doew and we chatted a while over our tea.
After resting in our rooms, we returned to the library to ,eet yet another couple and enjoy wine, cheese and hors d’oeuvres (also free) before going to dy.  When we returned we were greeted with “welcome home”.  The fourth couple was there in time for breakfast the next AM.  We would never stay anywhere else.

title: Fabulous old school glamour
text: This hotel is full of old and traditional beautiful furniture. Hotel has courteous attentive staff and many luxurious amenities. Included daily breakfast and daily happy hour wine and cheese from 5 to 8pm were high points.

title: Hotel Elysee
text:
Hotel is outstanding from the entire staff to the accommodations to the cleanliness to the location.

We have stayed here countless times and they always continue to impress!  i would highly recommend this hotel for any occasion.

title: A Place to Stay in the Center of Manhattan.
text:
Convenient to downtown Manhattan, restaurants, theatres, shopping, Central Park, museums. Good service, well staffed, very helpful front desk. Breakfast and Happy Hour. My wife and I have stayed at Elysee several times over the last 20 years. Always a pleasure.

Bob and Carol Pike  Fremont Ca

title: Historic Elegance
text:
Great location!  Easy walk to all the great shops on Park Ave.,  and Central Park.  
The hotel staff is fantastic, the room was nice and clean.  The breakfast and awesome HAPPY hour they serve daily is complimentary and oh so good!
Love The Elysee!  Will definitely stay again!

title: Charming Family Hotel in NYC
text: We have just spent a week at Hotel Elysee and highly recommend.  The staff were wonderful and went out of their way to help with requests.  It is particularly suited to families and a great position.  Most guests I spoke to were repeat and many staff have been there for years which shows how special the Hotel is.

title: Lovely
text: It's wonderful to know that just minutes from the high energy atmosphere of 'Broadway' you can step into a lovely, peaceful, and gracious hotel. Beautiful room and the 2nd floor space for guests is perfect.

title: Very neat hotel in the center of the city
text: Very clean and quiet. walking distance to many attractions.  Nice walking around it. very friendly staff. We have arrived around 5 pm and learned that wine and cheese break around this time daily. We have some relaxed time with glass of wine before diving into sleepless city.

title: Exactly what we had hoped!!
text: We had a ladies reunion and chose Elysée for the location. The bonus was the happy hour and the breakfast buffet. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. Beds extremely cozy. The front desk staff was helpful and always friendly. I think I can sum up how we all felt about the hotel by saying every time we came back after a busy day we all said we are HOME!!

title: Always my favorite
text: The Elysee is always my favorite place to stay in NYC. The hotel is cozy and the staff is always friendly and helpful from the moment you hit the front door. Thank you. I always appreciate the coffee/tea/cookies especially in the evening and love the quick breakfast setup.

title: 2 Visits a year isn't enough!
text: My wife and I go to New York twice a year for theatre, shopping and eating and for the last 5 years have stayed at the Hotel Elysee (this hotel is a secret that I'm not supposed to talk about).  The front desk staff is GREAT, the location is GREAT, the breakfast staff is GREAT, and now with new carpet the rooms are even better!

title: Good location and friendly staff
text: Our room was spacious and well furnished. The housekeeping staff were very conscientious and kept it spick and span throughout our stay. The informal breakfast arrangements worked very well as did the evening ‘happy hour’. The hotel is well placed for transport access as well as for local bars and restaurants. The attached Monkey Bar has prices that are a little eye watering.

title: PERFECT STAY IN NYC
text: My friend and I decided to stay at Hotel Elysee for a girls few days in NYC!  We read the reviews and Hotel Elysee sounded like the place for us.  Wow! ..it certainly was the right place! You can't beat the charm and the friendliness at this hotel!  Our room was great! The second floor guest lounge is fabulous! They serve free breakfast and evening wine and cheese ..as well as, snacks all day!  Super location near Central Park! The hotel's Monkey Bar is surely a plus! Lots of great restaurants in the area ..including just across the street at Bill's Townhouse.  This is definitely my "go to" place to stay in NYC! ..just love it!

title: Wonderful stay
text: I stayed at this property for the first time last weekend. It exceeded my expectations. From the ease of booking, the warmth of the staff upon arrival, the smiling faces of each and every staff member, it was incredible. The room was unique, and pristine and comfortable. The $25 resort fee was beyond worth the benefits. Having breakfast each morning, and the happy hour each evening, with tons of selection made it more than worth it. I would definitely book here again.

title: wonderful everything
text: love this hotel. everything about this place is wonderful, from the time you step in the doors until checking out and walking out. Everyone is helpful and friendly. Bufffet breakfast was great, the wine and cheese happy hour was terrific. Rooms are very very clean and pretty. absolutely wonderful!!

title: Excellent
text: This was our fourth stay- this time with friends from Ohio who also enjoyed the stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful as we enjoy the breakfast and 5-8 cocktail time. The hotel decor is tasteful and European in nature. Will definitely will be staying again.

title: Wonderful as Always and Great Staff
text: My wife and kids (and our extended family) and I have loved our four stays at the Elysee, including the most recent last week during spring break. The hotel's generous happy hour and breakfast room, wonderfully helpful and kind staff, and terrific location are unique.

title: Highly Recommend!
text: Hotel Elysee is a traditional, elegant yet unpretentious hotel conveniently located in midtown. Spotlessly clean, spacious accommodation and well staffed with courteous employees. It was our first visit to NYC, and our stay greatly enhanced our weekend trip. Hope to return.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We moved to this hotel after a very bad experience on W. 54th.  The Elysee staff is friendly, accommodating and respond immediately to requests.  We loved the second floor lounge.  Breakfast is served until 10:00a.m. and they have wine and cheese every evening from 5:00 to 8:00. The hotel is quiet and charming - very European.  The elevator is referred to as a "lift".  Our room was small but very nice.  The bathroom is updated, their are robes in the closet and they brought us a coffee maker. I would have rated the hotel 5 stars but the bed was not comfortable.  They need to upgrade their mattresses. We will stay here again.

title: European boutique hotel in the heart of New York
text: I have not stopped telling friends about this excellent hotel.  The staff are amazing and accommodating at every turn.  Our room was clean and very comfortable.  Water bottles were replenished every day in our room and this was just the beginning of being taken care of during our stay.  The complimentary breakfast was lovely as well as the wine and appetizers around supper hour.  Oh, and did I mention these perks do not cost extra.  I'm almost afraid to tell too many people, since this is a smaller boutique like property it may be booked up next time I try to stay there.  When we go back to NYC, this is surely where we will stay.

title: Highly recommended!!!
text:
We highly recommend Hotel Elysee!!!   The room was beautiful. Amazing service & great location. This was not our first time staying here and it definitely won’t be our last. 

This time around we had a beautiful suite with a king bed and pull out sofa which worked perfectly for our family!  Thank you!

We love the “Happy Hour” from 5-8-Prosecco, Wine and delicious food-fruit, cheese, etc.-Which was a perfect stop before we went out for the night.

title: Super recomendado
text: El hotel tiene una vibra antigua que lo hace muy cómodo, las habitaciones son muy bonitas, la habitación contaba con un closet súper grande lleno de espejos lo cual lo hacía ideal!! Las tardes de queso y vino son lo mejor las personas que atienden en general son muy amables. El desayuno fue muy bueno y la ubicación es perfecta para salir a caminar y conocer Manhattan.

title: Very pleasant European Feel hotel
text: Excellent. Quite, great service and very convenient. We stay in luxury properties in other cities often. We have found this hotel to be very comparable to fine hotels and resorts in comfort and service.

title: 5 Star Experience
text: The stay at the Hotel Elysee could not have been better. A classy older hotel that does not possess the cold efficency of the large chains. More like a Europen experience. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean and the one we had also had a sink and refrigerator .  We were treated like royalty. We stayed for 4 days and this hotel is in midtown , within walking distance of everything. Rockerfeller , Central park , Grand Central all within a mile. Excellent restaurants abound. They have a happy hour every day with complimentary wine and cheese that enables you to mingle with the other guests. I can't say enough abot the staff who were helpfull, accomodating and saw to our every need . We can't wait to return

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Excellent location, superb service, outstanding evening complimentary wine and apps, complimentary continental breakfast, free WiFi, water bottles, turn down service...quiet street, in the middle of all of the best shopping!

title: Good - but room for improvement
text:
We booked this property last minute after moving from another disappointing hotel. We choose based on location and tripadvisor reviews. 

We were traveling as a couple, for leisure for 5 days. Important to us are service, comfort, quality and price. 

We booked the grande king suite which had a beautiful large sitting area, separate bedroom with king bed and bathroom with shower, tub and two sinks. Also there was a small kitchenette area. 

This hotel caters to a demographic that appears to be 50+, mostly couples, repeat clientele travelling for leisure. 

Excellent touches:  breakfast is included. Although mostly carbs (bagels, pastries and cereals), there is some fruit, yogurt and eggs for protein available.
