Happy hour every evening:  wine is included as well as cheese, olives and crackers.  The best part of this is that it creates conversation and connection amongst the guests and also with the staff. I noted that the staff greeted many of the return guests with smiles and warm hugs. 

Includes:  bottled water, turn down service

Checkin:  quick and seamless and the team has excellent memories. They were quick and efficient with any request or inquiry. 

Cleanliness:  rooms are clean, but you do notice what doesn’t get cleaned regularity for example, make up mirror was full of fingerprints. 

Beds:  I found the bed extremely hard as well as the pillows ridiculously soft.  There is a room menu that includes extras like different pillows, ear plugs (and it is noisy all night long) and feather bed toppers.  Although we requested both the bed topper and new pillows (originals were floppy messes), it didn’t improve the situation much. 

Opportunities for improvement:  change up the continental breakfast and happy hour every few days. It becomes repetitive and boring very quickly. A pianist on the weekends might be a nice touch too. 

Throw away those pillows and invest in a decent pillow menu selection. Same with the. Toppers. Maybe invest in some foam ones and feather. 

Would we stay again?  Yes. None of my issues are deal breakers. What made our stay was meeting some other really interesting guests!

title: Little gem
text:
We stayed here for a birthday trip. The hotel is full of charm, unlike newer hotels. The staff us gracious and helpful. There's a sitting room where you can relax with a good book. Cookies are available in the afternoon. There's a cocktail hour every evening with wine and  snacks and a lovely continental breakfast in the morning. All free! The room was big by Manhattan standards and very clean. It was a short walk to the Museum of Modern Art. 
I would definitely stay here again!

title: Wonderfull Stay
text:
Service is excellent  .The girls in seconf floor are so friendly and nice.
Location is perfect for us,  near office and  shopping 
Rooms are clean and confortable.
Reception personal is so polite and kind

title: We always come back but it's starting to look run down.
text: Great location. Great staff. Great place. But the Library organization needs to reach into its pockets and spend some money to update the Elysee. Don't change the classic style but update the carpets and furniture. The rooms need new window treatments so you can darken the room. The marble bathrooms have no heat and get unpleasantly cold in the winter. The desk in the room needs table top fixtures with electrical and USB outlets for convenient charging. The phones are antique technology. In short, the Library group needs to bring the Elysee into the 21st century.

title: Looking forward to our return visit.
text: Just returned from our second visit in the last five months. The Hotel Elysee’s location, atmosphere and friendly staff make this accommodation an excellent choice when visiting New York City. The surrounding resturants and services are all that one needs for a satisfying visit.

title: Awesome hotel!
text: ive Always loved coming to this hotel when I’m in NY. It feels like home. The rooms and common areas are so warm and cozy. The staff treats you like family. This hotel is also conveniently located within walking distance of lots of shopping along 5th ave.

title: Euro style hotel in mid Manhattan
text: Charming comfortable friendly. Great breakfast, wine & cheese. Great price on special plus cheap valet parking. Larger rooms with comfy decor, chandeliers and good bath products. Perfect location for shopping, restaurants and 15 min walk to Broadway Theater

title: Couples getaway
text: The Elysee is a wonderful boutique hotel.  Rooms are good quality, very comfortable and good size for NYC. Breakfast and wine hour are very nice.  Hotel is in a good location in upper midtown. It is quiet but close to Rockefeller Center area with a number of great restaurants very close by.

title: Definitely on the "Repeat" list
text: Oh, my goodness! Where to start? I just returned home after a wonderful 4-night stay! The room was amazing! I so loved the convenience and amenities of the Club Room! The staff goes out of their way to be helpful! The take pride in calling guests by name - nice touch! This was my second time to stay in one of the Library Hotel collection hotels; but, it will NOT be my last! This is hospitality done well! Kudos to all the staff!

title: Easy to like this hotel...
text: Convenient location with Valet Parking and nice rooms.    I had no view from the room but the room was clean and bathroom was nice.   Check in and check out was quick and simple.   There was a club room where all quests could have refreshments.

title: Our eighth annual visit at Hotel Elysee
text: My daughter and I celebrated her birthday at Hotel Elysee This year as we have done each year since 2012. This is our eighth trip. The rates for January and February are reduced for their Sleigh-ride specials.  It is the perfect small European boutique hotel. The decor seems very French. The midtown location is near museums and restaurants which we go to. We are so pleased with all facets of the hotel. Our room had two queen beds and was quite spacious. Manager John Avina has a wonderful staff. We enjoy the intimate library where we have complimentary breakfast and wine with appetizers in the evening. We always meet interesting people as well. We look forward to next year.

title: Unique place to stay in the city
text: We had an amazing stay at Hotel Elysee! As soon as we arrived, it was like taking a step back in time. Everything, from the decor to the complimentary services, was very nice and welcoming. Definitely check out the Monkey Bar.... an awesome atmosphere and great cocktails! We will definitely be back next time we stay in Midtown.

title: Great stay
text: Always a great stay. The location is perfect, easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. The staff are always warmly courteous and very helpful. If you are driving in for a weekend the valet charges are very reasonable for NYC.

title: Second Trip
text:
Just had my second visit to Hotel Elysee 2/17
This will be the only place I stay when visiting New York.
All the staff at the hotel are super accommodating  They are just amazing ****
Love the Monkey Bar as well...great food and drinks.
The location is fantastic and I cannot wait to return.
Thank you to all of you who made my trip a delight*****
Elizabeth F. room # 67

title: A great weekend in NYC
text: Great service in this wonderful hotel.  The location was very convenient, the staff attentive and the room spectacular.  Was able to enjoy a leisurely breakfast without leaving....  Thanks for making our weekend in NYC a grand success.

title: Second visit just as excellent at the first!  Truly Excellent Hotel
text: I've stayed here previously with my husband - when my daughter had a grad school interview - I knew this was the perfect place.  We spent a long weekend here and just loved it.  The rooms are perfect - Tennessee Williams used to live here!  We thoroughly enjoyed the room, the breakfast, the wine hour, The everything.  The staff truly goes above and beyond all the time.  Clean spacious rooms, Excellent location - great bar/restaurant - really a perfect New York weekend.  Join their loyalty club (book direct with hotel) and you get the best rates AND a bottle of wine in your room at check in.

title: My third—or fourth—stay. . .
text: This is my #1 hotel choice for occasional visits to New York. The location is great for theater and museum activities, the rooms are spacious (for New York standards) and the staff are friendly and helpful. There is coffee starting at 6 AM and a breakfast of pastries, yogurt and fruit at 7 AM. Feels like home!

title: hotel Elysee
text: My hotel room was pleasant. I had all I needed. Staff very kind and helpful. The weather was very cold and the doorman called a taxi for me and insisted I wait inside until he got one. He was freezing and was so nice.

title: Hotel Elysee was delightful!
text: Our first trip to this hotel was in mid January.  We chose it because several friends had recommended it  highly. It exceeded all of our expectations. We found the second floor hospitality area a luxury.  Hotel Elysee is a hidden gem in the heart  in midtown.

title: Pampered guest
text: Welcoming is the operative feeling the moment you step ithrough their doors. The Elise is clean and  well decorated.The buffet breakfast(included in room rate) is extensive . It is well staffed and special requests are graciously fulfilled.The Elysee will be my hotl of choice every time I visit NewYoukCity.

title: Eberhard Maier.
text: Élysée ist mein bevorzugtes Hotel in NEW York.Sehr freundliches und zuvorkommendes Personal. Unschlagbare Lage in Midtown.Für USA unüblich freies Frühstück, das sehr nett und gut gemacht ist. Zimmer sind sehr sauber und komfortabel.Sehr zu empfehlen

title: Hidden Gem
text: Tucked away between Park & Maddison Avenues is a small boutique hotel.  The hotel interior is charming, elegant, and simple with service excellent.  Rooms are spacious by NYC standards. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour are always popular.  Best price to value in the heart of Manhattan!

title: Memorable as always
text: I have spent two special birthdays at the Elysee (50 & 60) and do so for a reason.  This hotel is a gem in the middle of Manhattan, a friendly haven in the midst of the bustle.  The staff to a person are congenial and unflappable.  Lovely rooms, great lounge with complementary breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese.  I return as frequently as I can.  They treat you like a returning friend.

title: Another wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee
text: What can I say, the Elysee never disappoints with their service, attention to detail, comfort or friendliness. Thank you for another great visit at your wonderful hotel. We always meet such interesting guests too!

title: Perfect place for a Girls Getaway
text: The small rooms are perfect for a solo traveler and you get a great continental breakfast with very attentive staff, a very nice three hour wine and cheese spread at night....and the staff that work here are very kind and go out of their way.

title: Excelente
text: Muy muy lindo hotel. La ubicación es genial en Upper East side, cerca de todo pero en un barrio tranquilo. Tiene todas las amenities de los hoteles de la Library collection. Yo estuve en la deluxe room with 2 double beds. Las camas son muy cómodas, el baño chiquito pero completo y una hermosa vista a la calle. El desayuno es completo y los quesos, vinos y demás de la tarde son maravillosos, realmente no hace falta cenar después. Yo me hospedé, durante este viaje, en 3 hoteles de la Library collection: en Library, en Casablanca y en el Elysee. Elegiría el Library porque está en frente de la New York public library y literalmente a la vuelta de la esquina de la Gran central terminal. Por otra parte las habitaciones de Casablanca son más cálidas, como quedarse en una casa, con el Rick's Café que es lo mejor de lo mejor. En todos estos tres hoteles pasarla inmejorablemente bien está asegurado. Los tres son una maravilla. El staff es friendly, aunque los mejores están en el Library, sin duda. En fin, una alección segura para la mejor estadía en NYC.

title: Psst, A Midtown Gem!
text:
I cannot think of a better single word to describe my experience at Hotel Elysee than “cozy”.  Cozy is a relatable word for a New England B&B managed by a sole proprietor, but I think it’s a tall order for multi-story midtown hotel built in the 1920’s.  I think there is a great deal of behind the scenes work to achieve this experience.  The hotel and staff delivered from the moment my wife and I arrived.  All of our interactions with staff were 100 percent positive!

Some highlights of our visit:
  Valet parking; flawless
  Front desk, door person, bell person; 5 star efficiency with genuine friendliness
  Club room (breakfast a.m. and wine/hors d’ouerves p.m); facilitates conversation 
  Decor; warm with wallpaper, flowers, hand painted murals, period furnishings
  Bed; in my book, a comfortable bed is critical.  The bed was great.

Is the hotel perfect?  Of course a hotel over 90 years old shows maintenance opportunities.  None detracted from our stay, but here are 3 things I would change: temperature in club room was too warm for my tastes (other guests had similar comments), seating at peak times in club room was tight, and WiFi, although free, was slow.

Overall, we had a great stay and would not hesitate to return.

title: Oasis in Manhattan
text: The Elysee is a jewel, perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan, quiet, cozy and comfortable.  Staff was very friendly and welcoming, from doorman to the desk.  The second floor lounge is a great place to relax quietly over a nice glass of wine or cup of coffee after a busy day. Very nice to start the day with a freshly prepared continental breakfast of fruit, yogurt, a variety of breads and bagels, juice and excellent coffee.  The staff in the 2nd floor lounge is very customer service oriented and helpful.  Our room, while not large, was comfortable and well-appointed, with nice closet which included robes and slippers. These came in handy as our only complaint is that the bathroom was always cold, even when we left the door open to the bedroom.  Not sure if the window or an exhaust vent were the problem. It would have been helpful to have a heat lamp or small wall heater in the bathroom. (It was extremely cold in NYC during our visit, that could have been the problem!), The Elysee evokes the atmosphere of the charming European boutique hotels which my husband and I enjoy so much..  A nice departure from the sameness of a chain hotel environment. Thanks to everyone for adding to a very pleasant long weekend in the Big Apple.

title: Unfussy elegance
text: Room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The breakfasts and evening wine and cheese gatherings in the library were delightful and charming bookends for the day. Staff always courteous and friendly, creating a warm and homelike experience in the heart of the city.

title: Great Stay at Hotel Elysee!
text: As always, my family had a wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee. It is perfectly located in Midtown, close to museums and shows, but not too close! We have been staying at Hotel Elysee every year for the past 7 years. The friendly staff, comfortable rooms and charming lounge (which serves coffee and tea all day, a light breakfast and a very popular happy hour with drinks and snacks-all complimentary!) keep us coming back year after year.

title: Espectacular
text: La ubicación es perfecta cerca de todos los lados de interés. Las habitaciones perfectas y todo el personal es más que amable y siempre pendientes de tus necesidades. Un clima muy bueno entre las personas que estábamos allí alojados.

title: 5 STARS!
text: I hadn't stayed at The Elysee for a number of years but had occasion to do so last month and have to say it's better than ever!  From the moment one walks in the door, you are made to feel at home. Every staff member is not only helpful but gracious.The rooms are very well-appointed, the linens and towels are of the best quality and the guest rooms are immaculate.  The closet and drawer space is plentiful, which is not the case in many hotels.The breakfast buffet (included with the room) is lovely and the wine & cheese offered in the evening creates a very convivial atmosphere.  I travel around the world for business so have stayed at a broad array of excellent hotels but in my view The Elysee is at the top of the list

title: lovely hotel
text: The service was superb. the room nice and clean, breakfast quite good and there is coffee and tea available all day. The only drawback is the hotel has only one elevator and it can get awfully slow to go up and down, particularly in rush hours.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I love the Elysee.and have stayed there over a number of years. The staff is always gracious and helpful. The location is convenient to so many places of interest,  there are good restaurants nearby and a little grocery store five. minutes away.  The rooms are comfortable and the club room/ library where breakfast and happy hour are available is warm, welcoming and has soft classical,music playing in the background.    This hotel is excellent value.

title: attentive service!
text: i have stayed here many times before and absolutely love this hotel. the staff go out of their way to make sure their guests have a wonderful experience. i went with a group of friends and we booked regular rooms plus one of the presidential suites so that we would have a place to be together. it was perfect! there is a living room, dining room and kitchenette so we could spend time together in the hotel. will definitely do this again - perfect for a family as well. location of hotel elysee is perfect - we walked everywhere even in the cold. highly recommend!!

title: La giusta atmosfera
text: Hotel in posizione strategica nel cuore di Manhattan, in alternativa al più “caldo” Village. Atmosfera rétro, camera spaziosa e pulita (alloggiato al settimo piano fronte strada), personale sempre professionale e cortese. La cosa migliore è la sala club sempre aperta al secondo piano, molto accogliente fra poltrone, divani e pochi tavoli, dove poter contare per la giornata su una bevanda calda, frutta, acqua, biscotti e, dalle 17 alle 20, su aperitivo ben organizzato. Nota per i celiaci: toast senza glutine disponibile, però imbustato in carta per essere scaldato nello stesso apparecchio dei toast con pane normale. Sarebbe bene avere due tostapane diversi. Unico punto debole: la prima colazione - in relazione al costo dell’hotel - meriterebbe un po’ più di salato (solo uova sode). Hotel da consigliare comunque.

title: This was our second stay at the Hotel Elysee and once again, it did not disappoint.
text: This was our second stay at the Hotel Elysee and once again, it did not disappoint. This trip we were travelling with our three adult children and all agreed that the Hotel Elysee was the best hotel (overall) that we stayed at during our travels through the US and Canada. Breakfast is complimentary, as is the wine and cheese each night. The club lounge is a great way to unwind after a full day of sightseeing. The Hotel is located close to Fifth Avenue, so perfect for those wanting to shop. It is also an easy walk to several subway lines, making everything in the city an easy commute from Hotel Elysee. Our stop in NYC was the second of seven stops around the USA and Canada to celebrate my 50th birthday and our 30th Wedding Anniversary. It was lovely that the hotel acknowledged both these celebrations

title: A Unique and Memorable Stay in the City
text: The Hotel Elysee is part of the Library Hotel Collection which consists of a small group of boutique hotels each with a very distinct personality. If for whatever reason you require more standardized accommodations when you travel, you would be better served sticking with one of the more generic, large hotel chains. As to the Hotel Elysee itself, it offers an excellent location in NYC on E. 54th between Madison and Park with a good selection of fine restaurants and other services in the immediate vicinity. There is an interesting variety of room types available so choose carefully when you book. My Junior Suite was very generously proportioned and featured an ornamental fireplace.The club room on the second floor, where the included continental breakfast is served, has large windows overlooking the street below, is well furnished, comfortable, and offers a great perch for people watching. Overall the hotel has the residential feel of a classic Manhattan apartment building with some of the drawbacks such as a single elevator. On the downside, the decor is tired and is in some spots worn and threadbare. There also appear to be issues with their vintage phone system. Over all the Hotel Elysee offers a unique and memorable stay in the City.

title: Si no fuera por la cama.....
text: Es difícil para mí calificar este hotel. Tres cosas muy positivas: ubicación, ducha, café y té durante todo el día más un exquisito servicio por la tarde de variedad de quesos y bebidas, todo gratis. Lo más negativo me resultó la cama, sábanas duras, almohadas muy malas y frazada de “sanatorio”. Incomprensible que este hotel no tenga almohadas de primera y un edredón de plumas para que sea agradable y cómodo dormir. No me gustó el trato de la gente de recepción, son correctos y nada más. Destaco a Gustavo, uno de los porteros, que realmente se preocupó por ayudarnos diariamente respondiendo a nuestras consultas. Muy amables también las camareras del desayuno y los tragos de la tarde. No sé si volvería a elegir este hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: the room, desk service and complimentary breakfast, wine and cheese make it delightful and affordable!  Easy to get a cab or ride share; near the Madison avenue shops and a nice walk to theatre district.

title: Great
text:
Hotel Elysee was amazing, beautiful, good location, great hotel services. There was breakfast and a great happy hour free, every day for guests. There was wine, sparkling wine, juice, fruits, diferente tiles of cheese,brad etc. 
there was a good restaurante for lunch and dinner.The staff was polite and helpful. 
The only problem was the WiFi.  In the room the connection was very poor. I couldn’t acces any website. In common areas it was a little better.  This was a big problem.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC!
text: We love this hotel and we have been staying here for years. My husband got injured in NY during the Christmas holidays and was hospitalized there. The staff went out of their way for me. They were wonderful and couldn’t have been kinder. In light of the circumstances, I felt comfortable and at ease—a tremendous comfort when away during a trying time. The rooms are all lovely, nicely decorated and spotless. The breakfasts are excellent. You couldn’t ask for more.

title: BEST hotel in NYC
text: Its been 5 years since our last visit to NYC and the Hotel Elysee once again made it a memorable one!  The rooms were wonderful but what impressed me the most, the Staff's attention to detail.  From the managers personal greeting to Rob's welcome at the front desk...We definitely felt as though "we were home".  Rob at the front desk was very helpful in securing dinners reservations, museum tickets and points of interest.  All and all...A perfect visit!

title: Review of hotel elysee, nyc
text: This is now our favorite hotel when we visit nyc! The staff are extremely helpful, the food is excellent and the rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. The ambiance is so nice that that we always feel like its our home away from home!Thank you Hotel Elysee!

title: Love this Hotel
text: We always stay here when in NYC. It is a small affordable boutique hotel with clean cozy European type rooms. The staff are awesome, so nice and helpful. The hotel is in a great location on the east side of midtown.

title: Christmas Holiday
text:
We stayed over for Christmas. 

On the - side:
The bed was a bit small and the mattress could be renewed (too old).
And there is no soundproofing in the room, some nights were really difficult as it felt you were literally outside on the street.

The minus comments were compensated by those + side:
Location is excellent. The staff is very nice, pleasant, helpful.
The room was big enough to accommodate 2 adults + luggage.
Breakfast was included and good. 
And every evening there was a happy hour (wine & cheese) which was so nice and cosy!

Overall we had a very good stay there, and enjoyed our time very much !

title: New York at Christmas
text: I chose the Hotel Elysee for its great location and wonderful reviews. I was not disappointed by either. I can't say enough about the amazing service and staff in all areas. I had only to request something and it was taken care of very quickly and efficiently. On the occasions we wanted to take a taxi rather than Uber, the doorman would walk to the end of the street if necessary to get one and bring it back. One of the highlights of the day was the afternoon wine and cheese reception in the club room. It's such a beautiful space in which to just rest and enjoy a little pick-me-up before the evening.This is truly a beautiful hotel, full of charm and elegance not present in newer chain hotels.I recommend it highly!

title: Excelente
text: O hotel è muitob bem  localizado com excelente equipe de atendimento que atende sempre com cortesia a diária contempla o café da manhã e free internet por ser um hotel menorRecomendo sem duvida quando em Nova York

title: Good Experience
text: The Elysse has a great location  and an informed and helpful staff.  It is missing some amenities of a luxury hotel but the second floor gathering place for breakfast, late afternoon food and drinks is terrific.

title: Classy and Classic
text: I take an annual pre Christmas trip with my daughter every year. We were always loyal to Waldorf and Essex House and decided to try something new last year. I can’t say enough about this hotel to do it justice. The staff all is amazing. The rooms are classic and comfortable. Spacious and classy. The breakfast and happy hour are fantastic. Whether you are traveling as a family or a couple, you will fit here. I would highly suggest the grand king suite. It’s beautiful!

title: Great location and great hotel
text: This hotel was in a perfect location that we could walk to Central Park, XMAS windows in all the stores and almost everything else that we wanted to see. Excellent staff and great continental breakfast.

title: Hotel Stay in NYC
text: Greeted by friendly doorman, who saw our luggage to our room. Check in was efficient and was handled without a hitch. Room was spotless and well appointed. Each day breakfast was available on the second floor which included coffe, juice, assorted pastries, cold cereal and fresh fruit. At 5:00 pm wine, cheese and crackers were available again on the second floor.

title: We love this quaint hotel!
text:
Stay here for friendly service and a terrific location. The club room on the second floor is a wonderful way to start the day with cappuccino, a Continental breakfast and newspapers. We also enjoyed the wine and cheese offerings before heading back out for dinner each night.

Ask for earplugs if your room is on the front of the building, and expect slow elevator service at the times mentioned above, but these are minor concessions for an otherwise perfectly charming hotel.

title: Still Excellent!
text:
We arrived for our annual stay at this hotel for Thanksgiving weekend, anticipating the wonderful service and cozy touches that make this venue such a cozy home away from home.  It's very old-school, only one elevator (and no 13th floor - it's 12A, per old NY tradition.)

Everything was a comfortable and welcoming as we expected, the room (King Deluxe - recommend) is well-appointed, and many thanks for the complimentary bottle of wine.

This hotel is extremely well-run, with excellent service and attention to detail.  The location is walkable to almost everything in or near mid-town, and there are subways very nearby, too.  The complimentary continental breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese are very well done.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: The room was beautiful and spacious. The wine and cheese happy hour along with a continental breakfast is a great perk and is included with your stay. The staff is exceptional and professional. We have been coming here for years and love the experience.

title: Hotel full of Monkeys
text: Its is a great comfortable place to stay especially if you want to be on the quiet side of Christmas or any holiday crowd. You can still be in the absolute center of it all. Service is fabulous, rooms are beautiful and if you want a really good drink go to the Monkey Bar within the Hotel and let Ed do his job. Great friendly bar but don't pound on the bar for service it makes Ed nervous.

title: Midtown Gem
text: We always enjoy our stay at the Hotel Elysee. Our only criticism is that the hotel could improve thequality of the coffee served in the morning.  It is labeled Dark Roast, however, it tastes very weak, and was usually just warm and not piping hot as it should be.

title: Hotel Elysee Continues to accommodate
text: On return visit to this hotel we had 2 rooms with family for Christmas visit. The staff is just super accommodating. Lots of luggage stored with no issues. Hospitality room is so convenient throughout the day for a short respite between activities. Be back soon.

title: Excelente lugar
text: Súper recomendado, la ubicación es próxima a casi todo, cercana a la estación del metro, al MoMa, las habitaciones muy lindas, muy limpias, el personal mas que atento, las chicas que servían el desayuno eran sumamente amables. Por la tardecita se sirven quesos y vinos, e incluso se pueden llevar invitados para que compartir un grato momento de charla

title: NYC Dec 2018
text: As always....excellent room, staff and amenities!  Mezzanine level is excellent.  There is always coffee, water, tea and treats.  IN the morning there is breakfast and in the evening wine and cheese.  The hotel is decked out for the holidays.  The front desk is tremendously helpful and provides excellent suggestions for our time in New York.

title: Feels like home
text: Love everything about this hotel. Elegant but unpretentious, with a really charming, supportive and polite staff, good services and an exceptional location. Each room I've stayed in has actual character and charm.

title: Like coming home!
text: Our family absolutely LOVES this property! The Elysee is very clean, well appointed and welcoming!The lobby and guest services attendants are extremely attentive and accommodating.  The breakfast and cocktail hours are delicious and make starting each day a breeze.  The lattes are delicious as are the fresh fruits and pastries.  The prosecco and cheeses during cocktail hour offer just enough to tide you over during a theatre performance until you can make a late dinner (or not).We are so thankful for our home away from home in the big city!

title: Great small hotel
text: Although the rooms are small, the location works well for us; and, it a clean, friendly and safe feeling hotel. It is civilized and not a madhouse.The attached Monkey Bar and the second floor breakfast/lounge area are a plus as well. We will continue to return.

title: December NY visit
text: The Elysee is a true jewel midtown.  The staff is very helpful and the rooms are nice and the amenities are excellent.  We have been staying there for 20+ years.this review is supposed to be 200 characters and now it is.

title: Great hotel
text: Friendly staff, comfy room,great location, what more could you want. Have recommended this hotel to friends and they all thank me. Small boutique hotel close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and great restaurants

title: repeat
text: As always Hotel Elysee was wonderful.  From the friendly staff to the afternoon tea and breakfast provided it was delightful.  My sister and I come for an annual holiday visit and look forward to iteach year and next year will extend it.

title: Comfortable
text:
We stayed here based on a friend's recommendation and the fact that it was the 8th ranked hotel in NYC on TripAdvisor.  The hotel was nice but I've got to believe there are more than seven hotels in the city that are better.  We were in a suite on the back of the hotel on the 8th floor.  It was spacious (the size of two regular rooms) and very comfortable, though it's starting to appear a bit worn.  If you're over 60 the décor will remind you of your grandmother's house.  The bathroom was fairly well lit but no exhaust fan, no fog free mirror, no heated floor, no soft close toilet seat and minimal room for toiletries.  The tub/shower combo had an old fashioned shower curtain and no hand-held sprayer.  The towels were regular size but very thick.  The bed was king size and comfortable.  We had to order other pillows as the ones in the room were too soft for side sleepers.  There were two closets with plenty of room for clothes storage (in the closets and in drawers).  The floors in the suite creaked as we walked on them.  There were separate HVAC controls for each room of the suite - a very nice touch.  The breakfast is on the minimal side and it can be very crowded in the relatively small lounge.  There is a happy hour in that same space every evening with complementary wine and light snacks.  The lounge is open 24/7 with coffee, tea, fruit and cookies (no coffee service in the suite).  We didn't need anything from the front desk, so I can't comment on service other than our pillows and ice one time.  Photos are attached.

Thanks for reading.  I’ll appreciate a thumbs up below if you’ve found this helpful.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: All staff are very welcoming and anticipate ones needs. Rooms are spacious, spotless and very comfortable. Breakfast a joy , friendly staff and delicious food. I would recommend this hotel in the heart of the city but remains a haven of peace

title: Volveremos sin dudarlo
text:
Este hotel boutique ha sido sin duda la mejor de las opciones. Incluso, en comparación con los hoteles en que estuvimos en oportunidades anteriores.
Las habitaciones son grandes y cómodas y con un living que permite pasar allí tiempo leyendo o descansando.
Luego, el desayuno es servido en el piso Segundo (de 7 a 10,30 hs.), que tiene livings hermosos y también mesas con sillas, todos muy cómodos. Además, diariamente sirven un “cheese and wine” muy generoso, que también incluye verduras y algo dulce. 
Durante todo el día (cierra en la noche) ofrecen té y café ilimitado, y el lugar reiteró que es muy acogedor y con una vista hermosa a la calle.
La limpieza es excelente, igual que la comodidad de la cama y la ropa blanca.
Destaco la atención de Jaron y Chris, muy atentos y dispuestos a colaborar con todo lo que necesites. Asimismo, es fantástica la atención de las chicas que sirven el desayuno y el cheese and wine, vaya nuestro más sincero reconocimiento para ellas.

title: Amazing Staff!
text: I  have been staying at the Hotel Elysee for many years and the main reason is their staff.  From the moment I arrive and am greeted by a Bellman, to the Front Desk, Housekeeping and Lounge staff, I always feel so welcome and happy to be back. The breakfast, wine tasting and tea service are an added bonus.If you need to be in midtown, this is the place to stay!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This hotel has an excellent location. Walking distance to many attractions. The room is lovely and comfortable. The only downside is the noise level. My room was facing 54th street and it is really busy.

title: A charming hotel in an amazing location with fantastic staff.
text:
This small chain came recommended from an American friend. It did not disappoint.  The service was exemplary from start to finish.  They kindly upgraded us to a suite as we were on our honeymoon and knowing how nice it is I would pay for the upgrade next time.  The morning breakfast was good if a little simple (actual English tea was a nice tough), the wine and the cheese afternoons were a lovely little extra.  Rooms were cleaned, turned down for bed and very comfortable.  Whilst we loved the country inn style of the hotel the only minor criticism is that the Club Room was very dated and in need of a bit of a spruce.
All in all I would always look to stay here in the future whenever I am in NY.

title: EN MI SEGUNDA VISITA ME DECEPCIONÓ
text: Ya habia estado en este hotel, razon por la cual volví.., pero esta vez me decepcionó, fué una pena, porque volví a celebrar mi cumpleaños al hotel , iba por segunda vez, lo mencioné en mi ingreso, pero lejos de hacerme un “cariñito” nos asignaron una habitacion infinitamente peor a la anterior vez...una habitacion pequeñísima, con el baño recortado por estar en una esquina, crujían las tablas al caminar, no tenía vista y era muy, pero muy ruidosa. Me dió una gran pena, ya que. Iba con los mejores recuerdo de mi anterior visita. El resto igual, el desayuno (aunque ántes incluían algo maš en lo que ofrecían) las señoras del desayuno MUY simpaticas. Tristemente voy a decir que no voy a volver

title: Un hotel boutique nel cuore di Manhattan
text:
Hotel centralissimo, cura molto gli arredi d’epoca mantenendoli in efficienza, ma,  a mio avviso, finendo In alcuni casi nel “vecchiume” . La mia stanza (nella parte interna era senza luce, piccola e molto rumorosa per la vicinanza ai motori dei condizionatori), le moquette polverose. Colazione modesta. Personale gentile e professionale. 
Prezzi elevati in relazione ai servizi.

title: Wonderful location, very nice hotel
text: At first glance, the interior will seem frozen in time. Some might say “dated.” They would be correct. This just doesn’t seem to matter as you get settled into your room and discover the dozens of amenities and top notch service. While our room could have used fresh wallpaper and carpet, it was clean, spacious and inviting. Lighting was ample and the bathroom was well done. The bed was firm for my preference but they do offer a feather mattress topper, if you would like. The breakfast area was comfortable and all items for the Continental Breakfast were fresh and nicely presented. The best part? Location for the price can’t be beat! When we are in NYC we spend very little time in our hotel so this suited us well. We are planning to return next month.

title: Always the Best
text: Always stay at the Elysee the perfect location and the best service and the Monkey Bar is such an added pleasure. The service could not be better. Front desk is so friendly and professional. Can’t say enough about about this Hotel !!!

title: 果物が食べ放題
text:
ともかく便利な場所にあります。セントラルパークにも近いし、少し遠いところには地下鉄でいけます。
我が家は旅先では歩くことがモットーなのでチェルシーのロブスターも歩いて食べに行きました。
ラウンジには常時、果物や飲み物が豊富に用意されています。イチゴが好きな私にはありがたかったです。

部屋はツインの部屋でしたが広さはニューヨークにしては広い方だそうです(ニューヨークは初めてなので）。
エレベーターは狭いです。パリを思っていただけるといいかも。

バスチーユデイが行われる場所にも歩いて行けます。お祭りの雰囲気がよかったです。フレンチカンカン娘の
圧倒的パフォーマンスにはびっくり♪

ホテルのフロントデスクには笑顔が並びます。
部屋には冷蔵庫がないのですが頼めば持ち運んでくれます。

また訪れたいホテルです。
（この訪問は2017年7月です）

title: returned again to this outstanding boutique hotel
text: it is more like staying in someone's home in an outstanding area of Manhattan rather than at a hotel.   The entire staff is very helpful - the personnel at the desk, the person who takes your luggage as well as  the staff who serve wine and cheese in the afternoon and breakfast in the morning.  The hospitality, the ambiance and the service are outstanding.  We stay at hotel Elysee every year on our wedding anniversary --  it is a very special place - I  highly recommend it. In my opinion the best place to stay in Manhattan

title: Charming Paris-like boutique with excellent service, location and inclusions
text:
First time staying at a boutique hotel in NY and chose it for the location which was great for being close to midtown, central park, theatre district and subway.  The staff was very friendly, eager to help and prompt with requests.  Specifically, we want to thank the staff on the club level who work very hard and are eager to please serving breakfast, cocktails and appetizers.  The front desk staff as well as the doormen were outstanding.  We ordered a bucket of ice and it arrived within 5 minutes.  The beds are wonderful, rooms are large for NY and bathrooms adequate.  7th floor room without a view was ok because we were not in the room a lot.  Very little to no street noise.  Food/beverages included for breakfast, all day and evening are excellent as is the club room.  This definitely sets the hotel above other 4 star hotels in the city. Wish I could give them a 4.5!

A few small details that would improve to 5 stars for us would be to get rid of the nonworking hairdryers on the bathroom walls (they supply plug ins in the room but we did not find ours right away); update/upgrade towels; change doorbell tones (they are very startling and loud when you are not expecting them) and expand room service offerings.  Thank you for a lovely stay!

title: Maybe even better this time!
text: We stayed with all of the family at this hotel in 2016, celebrating my wife's 50th birthday. We always hoped to return and we did so to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and my retirement. Sometimes it's risky to return to a place where you had a special experience but we were definitely not disappointed. The room (a Junior Suite - we asked for the same one if possible) was just as beautiful, and if anything the staff were more helpful, friendly and charming than last time. The breakfast and especially the 'wine hour' buffet are really exceptional and add so much to the overall experience. We are already wondering how soon we can return: there is no way we would go to NYC and not stay at this fantastic hotel.

title: Excellent hotel very attentive service spotless
text: Stayed here again for fun couple of days As before the service was top notch, clean and well appointed rooms and wonderfully quiet and tasteful.  Terrific happy hour and breakfast in lounge. Small and friendly. My daughter and I felt very safe and well taken care of. Will definitely come again and now we think of no other hotels for our NYC trips

title: Smashing boutique hotel
text: Stayed here for 6 nights in October. The room was huge, had a corridor where the wardrobes were and before this we had an area with a sink, fridge and microwave.  Such a surprise.  Bathroom was good although I would have liked a shelf by the sink but because of the layout in ours  this was not possible.  Bed very comfortable - no backache for a change.  Staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful.     Breakfast was a buffet quite adequate for us as we needed to ease off after a 10 day cruise.  Free Prosecco and wine between 5pm and 8pm with nibbles.  Great after a day out.  The location is brilliant.  But take ear plugs as everywhere in New York is noisy. So glad I took mine. Highly recommend hotel.   Small and cosy.  As this is on E 54th Street only view is of street which is not posh but it's ok.

title: Location, Location, Location, plus service and value.
text: We have just returned home to the UK, following a second visit to this remarkable hotel. What makes people keep coming back, and recommending their friends to join the club. The position is ideal, the rooms are well set out, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms ample in size. Housekeeping is very thorough. The staff at the front desk and door men are helpful and friendly, what's not to like and that is why their occupancy rate is so high. You will need to book as soon as you know your dates. Two comments about renovations  to some rooms would be welcomed, and the noise from traffic and local construction work that sometimes goes into the night. Well done John Avina and his team, looking fwd to our next visit.

title: Home away from home
text: Hotel Elysee was by far the best New York hotel we have stayed at. Over the years we have visited New York many times. Our recent stay at Hotel Elysee was our most enjoyable. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff was superb. We will return.

title: A calm, friendly retreat in the busy city
text:
Hotel Elysee is one of those places where you immediately feel comfortable. We stayed for 3 nights in mid October '18 and from the first welcome as we checked-in after a long journey from the UK, we experienced nothing but excellent, polite and friendly service across every department.
The rooms are large and decorated in a traditional style. The bathroom works, with good water pressure and there are an ample (refreshed) supply of bathroom lotions and potions.
There is a complementary breakfast and complementary wine and cheese every evening. 
The Hotel immediately became our home from home as we returned from our exploration of New York.
We were sorry to leave and will return on our next visit to New York.
The hotel is a great place and we had no problems or concerns.

title: Friendly small hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Elysee. The location was fantastic. We walked everywhere and were specially pleased on our theater nights as it is a short walk from Broadway and the Lincoln Center. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was simple but nice to have on site. Our room was a very decent size and in good condition. We will definitely stay again when we next visit New York.

title: My one complaint
text: We've stayed with you many times.   I have to say that I will probably book elsewhere.  Reasons:  absolutely no space to put toiletries in the bathroom, made for a lot of inconvenience.It's time to freshen up; the carpet was tattered and didn't feel clean.  If I learn there will be a remodel, we'll come back.  We like the staff and the location and the breakfast room.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Just spent four nights here with my sister, celebrating my 50th Birthday. The hotel was just perfect, with excellent personal service.  The beds in our room were very comfy, just what we needed after exploring New York City, during the day.  The lounge area for breakfast and pre dinner drinks was charming, and relaxing and again the staff here were so helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to be made to feel welcome and enjoy there stay in this city.

title: Highly recommend!
text: If you want a modern, corporate, identical in every city type of hotel then Elyse is not for you. However, if you prefer a hotel that is friendly, welcoming and oozing character then I suggest that you give this hotel a try. We would love to return, and we witnessed many guests being welcomed back by the staff, who obviously see them regularly.

title: Pretty tired hotel
text: I stayed here for one night and didn’t like it much. While it was clean and the bathroom was pretty fresh looking, the entire hotel had a mustiness about it that I didn’t enjoy, from the carpeting to the furniture.

title: NY Weekend
text: We have tried many hotels in the mid town area looking for a combination of quality and value. Hotel Elysee was very nice and a reasonable price. We were impressed with the comfortable bed and complimentary continental breakfast.

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
Very helpful, friendly staff!  Location close to Central Park and shopping.  Enjoyed the breakfast, snacks, coffee, and fruit all day, and wine and cheese in the afternoon.
The room was perfect, with the bonus of a balcony. Housekeeping always done when we got back from our day's activities.  What I liked best was that it was a small, classic, older, and more intimate hotel than many I have stayed in.  I enjoyed conversations with other guests.  This was our first time in New York.  The staff was extremely helpful with all of our questions.

title: Beyond expectations!
text: A fabulous experience.  Upon arrival we were advised that we had been upgraded to a suite.  It was beautiful … a living area, fireplace, etc.  The front desk was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants, making Central Park tour reservations, etc.  Many thanks to Isiah for his help and friendly welcome each time we returned to the hotel … wonderful person.  The free breakfast was excellent … fresh fruit, cereal, etc.  Directly across the street is Cellini's … the best Italian food. .. cozy, quaint, and authentic.  Many thanks to Hotel Elysee for making our NYC trip wonderful.

title: Fabulous stay in central NYC
text: I stayed with my Mum & sister and met up with family from Scotland. The happy hour(s) and lounge area was a great place for us to start each morning and take a break in the afternoon all together. The staff were fantastic, very friendly and the rooms were clean. Centrally located. It was a tad more than we wanted to spend but worth every penny. I would stay here again!

title: Home From Home
text:
We've been staying at the Elysee for over 20 years which I guess in itself says just how much we like it.

The staff have always been very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and the large first floor lounge is warm and welcoming. Everything works and everywhere is clean.
 
A buffet breakfast with quite a good choice. Complimentary wine and cheese each evening between 5 and 7pm provides a very welcome relaxation after a full day out and about. In many ways it reminds me of a private club rather than an hotel.

It's well located  for walking in mid-town, to 5th Avenue, Central Park and the Lincoln Centre.

It's not the swankiest hotel in town and doesn't pretend to be but like us it has a very loyal clientele who would stay nowhere else when in NYC.

title: OurFavorite Hotel in NYC
text: YOU HELPED US CELEBRATE OUR 64th anniversary with comfort,joy & happiness - service super, room spectacular/comfortable, staff fabulous/friendly - morning breakfast & happy hour sooo enjoyable/delicious .   Definitely worth every dollar spent.  Look forward to returning for anniversary #65.

title: Comfortable and quiet
text: This hotel is nothing fancy but the location is unbeatable, everyone is friendly and helpful, everything works, everything is clean if a little worn, and it is quiet. We especially enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the win and cheese in the afternoon in the second-floor lounge and lobby.

title: OLD WORLD CHARM - BOUTIQUE HOTEL
text:
Whenever we visit NYC, this is where we stay. We wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else. 

Before we discovered Hotel Elysee, we did stay elsewhere (in midtown Manhattan). But, after our 1st stay, we knew we had found our home away from home. It meets all our needs. It has everything we could possibly want & then some.

I would describe the vibe/decor as simple elegance. The room rates are reasonable & affordable. The "perks" provided at no extra cost are many. 

I have only positive things to say about this high-end, luxury hotel that exudes class.

The staff - friendly, cheerful, efficient, professional, courteous 

The rooms - clean, comfy, cozy & quiet, well-equipped (they even provide a in-room safe)

The location - ideal, within walking distance to SO much to see & do

Treat yourself & experience ALL that Hotel Elysee has to offer.

title: Excellent Service
text: Service staff was friendly and very accommodating.  The amenities of the breakfast and evening Bar worked out very well for our group, both as a gathering place, and a flexible (and quick if needed) place for food & drink.  Common rooms and hallways need to be updated, but the experience was excellent.  Thank you.

title: Fabulous hotel! The ideal home away from home!
text: This is a fabulous hotel! Warm, intimate cozy, staff are super smart and attentive, rooms are beyond lovely and comfortable. The is my ideal home away from home! I look forward to exploring its sister properties in the Collection.

title: Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly staff!!
text: A rare find in New York City!  A hotel that includes a continental breakfast, and wine and appetizers in the early evening!  This hotel is in the perfect location and the staff is very friendly and accommodating!  It is a small boutique style hotel, so there is only one elevator, but the room was surprisingly large and the bed was very comfortable.  I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again for any future visits!

title: Tired and dated
text: One of those old New York hotels that look to survive on their location and what they see as their old world charm. The room was sizeable enough, but as usual a view into an internal chasm and some old air con equipment. The bathroom has not been done up for decades. The breakfast room is poor.  The lifts pokey. You get the drift.  And of course expensive for what it is. Guys, time for some serious updating!

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: We had a great stay . Everything was great . Will be back 2x in December with our family. The rooms are awesome . Clean neat and always done with a touch of class. We have been coming to the Elysee since 1996 and will continue for years to come.

title: Deja Vu
text: We keep returning because it's like home; not everything is perfect -- only one elevator, but the rest is great. The staff is pleasant, the rooms are cozy and the location is perfect. Also, it's quiet.

title: Always delightful
text: It’s always a delightful experience to stay at the Hotel Elysee. The rooms are always clean, lovely and comfortable. Every staff member is courteous, friendly, welcoming and helpful in assuring that your stay at the hotel and your experience in New York City is the best it can be. I wouldn’t think of staying anywhere else when I’m in New York.

title: Friends reunion
text: Service was excellent.  Only 1 complaint,  the mirro to check how we looked was inside the closet which we had to hold open with our foot,  awkward.  Other than that it was perfect.  We especially loved the lounge and services on the 2nd floor,  spend hours there with friends reconnecting.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
text: If you are looking for a classic style hotel check out the Hotel Elysee!  My wife and I were looking for a vintage style hotel for our anniversary weekend get away.......the Hotel Elysee was just what we were looking for. Not the hustle and bustle of those large chain hotels.  Great vintage character, large rooms, wonderful complimentary continental breakfast and wine & cheese and the famous Monkey Bar next door.  The hotel staff was fantastic and very pleasant.  Will definitely be back and highly recommend the Hotel Elysee!!

title: Enjoy Staying Here
text: While it is crazy expensive to stay in NYC, I have always enjoyed my stays at the Hotel Elysee.  The rooms are comfortable and the Staff are very helpful and friendly.  The breakfast offering is ample (good selection of serve yourself items- no "hot" breakfast items) and it is convenient to be able to eat at the hotel.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: This hotel has service perfected to a tee. Excellent reception, excellent housekeeping, excellent happy hour, excellent breakfast. My husband and I have not been to NYC in many years, but we will be coming back and staying at this hotel.

title: Regular "home from home" stay
text: Great personalised service from people many of whom have been there for years.Unbeatable location combined with value for money.The unique evening complimentary drink, and a legendary simple breakfast.Plus the Monkey Bar.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed at the Elysee for 2 nights in Sept.  Our 2nd stay there. Great location, very nice rooms, good continental breakfast and very nice wine and cheese, veggies in the evening 5-8. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Superb hotel
text: Loved the hotel, great location, staff excellent, great complimentary happy hour with wine, cheese, bread, fruit.  Coffee available in the lounge all day long, very comfortable lounge on the second floor of the hotel for relaxing

title: A classic hotel
text: Perfect location, wonderful service, great rooms.The complimentary breakfast is excellent. The staff goes out of its way to make you feel at home. There is a warm and cozy feeling to the hotel. I would highly recommend it.

title: Outstanding
text: We had a wonderful time..even with horrible weather!  The staff couldn't have been more helpful.  Thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast and the wine and cheese in the evening.We will definitely be back.  Thank you for such excellent service.

title: Elysee stay
text: Was again great to come back to Elysee Hotel, nice people , good room, good service and great location . Just need to renove the climatizing and heating system, a bit too old , . Will be happy to come back next January during fashion market thank you benjamin

title: Perfect hotel
text: Excellent location, near metro direct to jfk Airport. Great room and wonderful food especially the fruit salad for breakfast and the wonderful snacks at tea time, no need for supper. The staff were very helpful and I can recommend it without hesitation.

title: A Little Gem in Midtown
text: The Hotel Elysee is a delightful small hotel with great amenities. Conveniently located in Midtown, the rooms are large, quiet and very nicely appointed.  The hotel has a lovely vintage feel with beautiful murals and woodwork in public spaces.  And amazingly, in their library, there is a free continental breakfast every morning, wine and cheese in the evenings as well as coffee service and snacks throughout the day -- so concierge services but for all guests. The staff were very gracious and helpful. And, the Monkey Bar on the first floor is a New York classic.  Now that we've discovered the Elysee, we won't stay anywhere else in new York.

title: An oasis in the big city
text: With its wonderful proximity to Fifth & Park Avenue shopping, Central Park, MoMA, dining, this is a quietly elegant place to stay. The people are awesome, caring, & helpful. Rooms are clean & spacious.

title: Best Boutique Hotel!
text: As usual, the front desk staff, doormen, and bell hops were wonderful.  In addition, the young ladies working in the lounge were friendly and incredibly helpful.  One of them even taught me how to make a flower out of a strawberry!  The Hotel Elysee staff is consistently great and always go above, and beyond!

title: Very good stay
text: My wife and I had a very good stay at the Hotel Elysee.  The location is great, the staff is very helpful, the complimentary breakfast is very good, and the overall impression is very good.  The only reason I have not given the hotel a five star review is that the decor could use a bit of updating.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: The rooms are lovely and the staff looks after you very well. Breakfast is very tasty and it is pleasant to enjoy a glass of wine a little nosh after a long day sightseeing. This trip was a birthday celebration for my sister and myself and the hotel did not disappoint. This was my third stay at the Hotel Elysee and the experience was a good as the previous visits!

title: Very good location but refurbishment would be needed
text: Nice hotel, very well located, good breakfast, nice and diligent personal but several aspects require refurbishment such as the air conditionnary (very noisy), bed, bathroom, sockets, lights of the room ....

title: Hidden treasure
text: What a wonderful hotel! It is well located, within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller center and Times Square. It offers breakfast and afternoon wine in a cozy lounge.  What NY hotels offer that?! We were upgraded to a suite, which was gorgeous. The Monkey Bar is right next door for a drink or a bite. We will never stay anywhere else!

title: Europe in NYC
text: Love this hotel, has a real European feel to it. We stayed in one of the premier suites with family in the adjoining room. It felt like a home. My go to hotel when staying in NYC. Great location, great breakfast and everyone, guests included, are so friendly.

title: Excellent location for family break
text: We met Canadian relatives for a NY break. The hotel is well located with many attractions walkable and a subway station on the same block.Staff are very friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast adequate and convenient and complimentary early evening wine an excellent refresher after a busy day. We have already recommended to friends.

title: Good location but old fashioned
text:
We stayed here for 4 days and overall it was a good visit but it was marred by an extremely noisy air conditioner, somewhat dated and room and TV.

Good breakfast and excellent friendly staff and well located for New York. Also reasonably priced for New York

title: A charmer
text: This is my third visit to New York and the Elysee was by far the best accommodation I have stayed.  Rooms are large by New York standards and the building has a wonderful history and ambience.  It is also within walking distance of most of the major attractions. Kudos for the included breakfast and afternoon drinks, a stark comparison with other American hotels and activities where there is often a handout mentality for any extra service.  The staff are very friendly and attentive and are a credit to their employer.  Probably being a little harsh in not giving the hotel 5 stars, however as with any old building, there can be little irritations.  Unfortunately there was issues with the one lift in the hotel and a very noisy air conditioner during my stay.

title: Nice nice nice
text:
A beatiful hotel in the heart of the city. 

Big room, good breakfast but the wine hours is the jewel: 3 hours with free wine, vegetables and free cheese: Amazing!
Also the snacks avaible the entire day are an important point!

I strongly recommend it!

title: Best terrace ever, awesome staff
text: We stayed her for a family get-together and were very pleased with our choice, This is a classic, European-style hotel in an elegant building (probably built in the 1920s?) and it is packed with old-world charm. The mid-town location was perfect for the various needs of our large group; for the family with infants and 11-yr-olds, Central Park and all it has to offer is just a few blocks away, and for everyone else, the entire City is easy to access. Extremely comfortable bedding, and I really do believe this was one of the nicest terraces I have ever had the pleasure of using, it was large and had an awesome City view. We have always enjoyed the Library Hotel Group and this property is a lovely example of why: always clean, always friendly and always an interesting property to spend time at when not out about in town.

title: My Home Away from Home in New York
text: My husband and I  love the Elysee Hotel. It is conveniently located for visits, Board meetings and the US Open. The breakfast and happy hour are great perks and there are four great restaurants nearlby.The Money Bar is attached to the hotel. Bill's is across the street as is Cellini and the new Greek restaurant whose name escapes me. It is close to the Lexington Subway station. We have stayed there 19 times. It is also historic which I love. Tennessee Williams came to stay and stayed for 15 years.

title: Fabulous vintage hotel
text: In the heart of Manhattan. All staff exceptional front the front door to hotel assistants. Front desk staff very knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast great and cheese and wine a lovely touch in the evening . Will definitely be back . Compliments to the manager and staff

title: Unique place in the heart of Manhattan
text: Very convenient place, friendly staff, lovely rooms, Library hotel concept is perfect whenever l travel to New York my first choice is Elysee hotel or any other hotel out of Library Hotel Collection because in all of them l feel like at home

title: The Best!
text: We've stayed at the Elysee many times and we wouldn't even consider staying somewhere else.  Sure there are cheaper places, bu this hotel is home to us.  They are so hospital, the rooms are lovely and the location is great.

title: Loved it!
text: This elegant hotel in Midtown is a great value.  A delightful surprise: we were upgraded to a junior suite.  Beautiful furnishings, marble bathroom, and the largest room I've ever had in NYC.  Add to that, comp breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evenings, plus the cool Monkey Bar.  We feel like we have a new fave in New York.

title: Love this place!!!
text: High quality at a very reasonable price. The room was very clean, with great charm. The staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant to deal with. The breakfast and evening wine/cheese was the bonus on top. The bed was very comfy and a quiet roon setting.  I stored a car next door for 4 days. Our trip went perfect as we also loved the location of the hotel. I'm a tuff rater but I give Hotel Elysee 5 Stars. This place is the best!

title: Always wonderful
text: We love coming back to this hotel for so many reasons.  It's very clean, staff is wonderful, breakfast and nightly evening reception are definitely worth attending, reasonable parking prices and great location!!  What more could you ask for?

title: Perfectly perfect hotel❤️
text: Hotel Elysee is a perfect hotel in NYC. A small boutique hotel in East Midtown, the amazing staff will make your stay very memorable!! Service is their trademark and it is evident in all of the staff interactions with guests. I am only sorry that I didn’t write down each staff member’s name to acknowledge them all. From the meticulous housekeeping staff to the gracious doormen to the attentive front desk personnel,  your needs will be met!! Good location convenient to much and a block to the subway.

title: A real gem in a fantastic NYC location!
text: The entire Hotel Elysee staff makes this European-feeling boutique hotel such a pleasurable experience.  As a guest (and I travel A LOT for business) I can truly say the Elysee is one of my favorites!  The location is blocks from great shopping and many fantastic restaurants.  Breakfast and happy hour are included gratis and the library/lounge is a fun comfortable appt to gather.

title: Delightful as always
text: Enjoyed the same warmth and familiarity again!  There is something so inviting about this little jewel of a hotel.  The room was updated, clean and comfortable.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  We look forward to being back next year!

title: Great stay!
text: Came into the city to see a show and loved staying here! The beds are so comfortable! It’s a great location! It includes snacks and wine at 5 and a free continental breakfast in the morning. Overall it was an excellent stay!

title: Excellent hotel with spacious rooms!
text: Loved our stay here--our room was huge and comfortable and staff was very welcoming and helpful. Will definitely stay here again. We didn't get to try the free breakfast because we had breakfast plans but I look forward to trying it next time. Great location, too!

title: A quiet hotel in a great location
text: Quiet hotel very near to 5th Avenue so great for shopping! The subway station is just around the corner so it is very easy to get around Manhattan and beyond. We walked a lot too as Central Park, Rockafella and Time Square are all manageable. Hotel has a buffet breakfast  - continental style, you could ask for toast/toasted bagels but apart from that nothing else was cooked.Staff were helpful and constantly topping up the food which seemed to run out quickly.  Needed to pick your time to eat though as it got rather busy and we had to wait for a table on a couple of days.Nice touch to have a free wine and cheese from 5pm each day. Front desk staff and doormen were friendly and helpful too.  Our room on deluxe double 8th floor was a good size considering we were in the middle of NYC. Would stay again

title: Excellent - Top Quality Hotel
text: What's not to like - great location in Midtown - easy walk to Central Park and other locations like MOMA. The staff are great and very helpful, the rooms are well maintained and spacious and the club room is an oasis with food and drink available all day and complimentary wine and cheese available in the evening. We were very happy with this hotel and have no hesitation recommending it. It presents good value for money and we would definitely stay here again

title: Hitel Elysee: where guests feel like VIP Family Members
text: Luxury, charm and outstanding personal service continue to be the hallmarks of a wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee. The doormen remember your name as to the front desk attendants. The Club Room with oh so comfortable couches, and a variety of seating arrangements always has coffee tea,fresh fruit and delicious cookies 24-7. However, you leave room for   a wide array of breakfast offerings in the morning and wine and cheese and so much more in the late afternoon.all serviced by a group of charming attendants eager to serve you..

title: Amazing cozy hotel in a great area!
text: Cannot say enough about this perfect little hotel! Don't stay here for the amazing views of the NYC skyline, because there aren't really any. Don't stay for the pool or the rooftop bar, because they don't exist. But stay here if you value service and attention to detail. Stay for the good beds and great showers. Stay for the great rates and the morning breakfast that's included and the evening reception that has wine, cheese and crudités. Stay for the location which is convenient to so much but away from the hustle and bustle. Just a few blocks from Central Park and close to so much shopping.  A few minute walk to theatres and so many attractions. Convenient to subway and other transportation. Stay here. This is your hotel.

title: A wonderful hotel in easy walking distance to so many places!
text: I just returned from a week in NYC and stayed at the Hotel Elysee for 8 nights.  It is a lovely hotel and we will certainly stay there again when we are next in NY.  The staff is very professional and very helpful.  Our room was lovely and very comfortable.  We enjoyed the breakfast offerings every day on the 2nd floor and stopped by often for a glass of wine in the early evening.  With access to a great health club nearby, it is really a perfect spot offering everything and letting us enjoy this wonderful city.

title: Idyllic
text: My younger daughter and I visit this charming hotel on our annual trip to NYC. Its location, staff and accommodations suit our needs perfectly, and we always enjoy going back. We would highly recommend it as the place to stay when in Manhattan.

title: A good starting
text: Point to see NYC. You can walk to quite a few sites and the East side is generally quieter. Try to get a higher floor because the garbage and delivery trucks start around 4:30am an will wake you up. The staff was mostly friendly and the breakfast was enough to get you started in the morning.

title: Our new favourite place to stay!
text: Had a great stay at Hotel Elysee recently.  We booked two rooms, one with two beds and one with a king.  The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to 5th Avenue, Central Park, Times Square, Theatre, etc., but quiet and far enough away from the Times Square madness.  This was the first time we had stayed a more "boutique" type hotel and really noticed a difference in the level of attentiveness and detail.  It's a smaller hotel, but as a result, you're greeted whenever you enter or leave, the staff know who you are, which is nice.Breakfast is included and it is the same everyday - hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereals, bread, pastries, instant oatmeal.  It is fresh and enough to get you going.  Valet parking is $30/day which is very reasonable.The room with the two beds somehow felt more spacious, and had a tub.  The king only had a shower.  Both were super quiet at night which is great for a light sleeper like me.  A great stay, and we'll be back!

title: Theatre Trip
text: Everything at the Elysee was wonderful, as usual.  We are loyal guests.  Staff, room, breakfast and evening refreshment excellent.  The front desk even arranged for our pick-up at the airport and the return trip to the airport.

title: Once again, our home in NY
text: Terrific location, accomodating staff, nice rooms and breakfast. We really like the Elysee. Many of the guests return  year after year. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Columbus Circle. Multiple subway options.

title: Great Stay at the Elysee!
text: Spent a fabulous two nights at the Hotel Elysee! My sister, from California, and me, from Georgia, flew in to meet our niece who lives in the city.  We pampered ourselves with facials at Bliss, shopping at Bloomies and the big treat - we saw Hamilton.  Of course, we enjoyed the wonderful hospitality of the Hotel Elysee which made the trip truly special.

title: great stay
text: The customer service and amenities were fabulous.  The hotel is convenientlylocated, and I felt safe and comfortable.  I will definitely put this hotel at the top of my list of preferences when I visit New York City!

title: Great Location and Terrific Staff
text: This was our first visit to this boutique hotel and although we had an air conditioner issue that was resolved with a room change, the experience in total was very positive. The room was clean and spacious (for NYC) and the morning continental breakfast was very good.  I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay.

title: Una casa in centro a Manhattan
text: Hotel raccolto, in pieno centro. Ottime le camere ed il servizio, personale davvero cortese, cosa non certo comune qui a new York. Pulizia molto buona. Ottima la colazione ed il servizio club che ha il suo massimo nella merenda pomeridiana a base di vini e formaggi.

title: First time stay, already looking forward to the next time!
text:
The Hotel Elysee is truly a gem. This restored boutique hotel embraces its traditional decor, obviously refreshed and well maintained. The room was spacious, especially given its location the heart of NYC. Wonderful staff, and we greatly appreciated the continental breakfast and the wine and cheese happy hour. 

The hotel is well located, in very walkable distance from Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue. 

Thank you, Hotel Elysee! I look forward to staying with you in the future.

title: Hospitality personified
text:
The hospitality shown by all staff exceeded any expectations I may have had. The hotel is steeped in NYC history, location was excellent, rooms immaculate and well appointed.  The complimentary breakfast and nightly wine and cheese event was an added bonus to a very enjoyable stay.
It was our first visit to this hotel but will not be our last. We can't wait to return.

title: Love, love, love this hotel
text: Fell in love with this small, boutique hotel.  Everything was incredible--the staff was so warm, engaging, friendly, and genuine.  Can't imagine feeling more welcomed and valued!  They have perfected the culture of lagniappe!  We were in room 51--the smallest on the floor, and it was still warm, embracing, and very comfortable.  The extended happy hour featured nice wines and a selection of lovely cheeses.  Breakfast, continental style, was equally pleasing.  Our bathroom was spacious with lighting that inspired the Hallelujah Chorus!  Bed had a feather topper and down comforter and pillows.  So comfortable!!!  Can't wait to return!

title: Perfect in every Way!
text:
First time to stay here on our annual Theater Trip to NYC.
Great Happy Hour and breakfast each day in the Club Room with comfortable seating and newspapers provided.
Wonderful help at the desk with everything from tickets, restaurants to transportation.
We’ll be back!

title: Always Great
text: I love the Elysee Hotel.  Great team of personnel who are extremely accommodating to your every need.  The location is perfect for my stay with the things I like to do! I love the comfortable old fashion rooms. I only wish the bathrooms were larger and more modern and that they had one more elevator.  I love the buffet breakfast and the cocktail hour, both complimentary in a charming living room/ library area on the second floor.

title: Good location, hard beds
text: The hotel is charming and old, the bathroom was lovely and the building is in a great location. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There are nice places to eat very close by. They offer nice services like breakfast and happy hour. But we stayed five days, and after the first couple, the offerings became a little boring.  The food was pretty ordinary to begin with, and they never changed anything up. It sounds terrible to complain about free Prosecco and wine, but that is the reason that I marked the hotel average rather than very good. That and the fact that the bed was very hard. My husband that the bed was fine but I thought it was pretty hard.

title: Lovely hotel; we'll be back
text:
My family and I enjoyed our recent stay here. We took in a few Broadway shows, visited a few museums, and took a guided tour of Central Park -- all within walking distance of the hotel.

The three of us stayed in a King suite, which offers a pullout sofa bed, which was perfect for our teenage son.

Everyone on staff is extremely pleasant, and the morning breakfast and evening wine/cheese offerings are a nice touch, too.

We've been to NYC many times over the years, and this hotel was one of the nicer ones we've stayed at. We hope to see you again next summer!

title: Hidden Jewel in the big city!
text: Truly the kindest hotel I have encountered in NY. Very accommodating, clean and quaint. The light breakfast and afternoon cocktail hours are nice touches. Quickly becoming my go to hotel when we visit the city.

title: Great place
text: The Elysee was a great place to stay for a first time visit to NYC. Easy to get around the city from there and in a very nice area. The room (junior suite) was large enough for 3 women. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our visit. The breakfast in the morning and the happy hour in the evening were also very nice additions to the trip.

title: Stop reading reviews and book this hotel!
text: We stayed at Hotel Elysée on our wedding night and it truly was the cherry on top of our day. Between the smiling, helpful and kind staff in the front lobby to the beautiful suit we had that night. A few of our friends and family came in to go out with us that night and they too were blown away and had wished they booked to stay there. We will certainly make staying at this hotel an anniversary tradition.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: We love staying at the charming Elysee! The front desk is so friendly and helpful, the room so tasteful, and the breakfast and wine hour are delicious and so inviting. We feel as if there is no comfort which isn’t thought of and provided for you.

title: Small, diversity of languages, relaxing
text:
We enjoy all of the library collection however this one we return to more frequently. Nice location for walking to Times Square or Central Park or museum mile or even downtown (though that’s further) 

They also are the only library hotel where we have been able to accommodate 2 adults and 2 teens in one room. 

Fabulous staff throughout the hotel especially at the front door!

title: Boutique Hotel
text: Exactly as anticipated; Boutique hotel in NYC; Quiet - even with a window on the street side; Clean; Staff personable; Side street - ie quiet, but a little difficult to hail a cab, the doormen were helpful on this point; breakfast on the 2nd floor was a time saver; Not one complaint and we would stay here again.

title: Theatre Visit
text: . My wife and I have stayed at the Hotel Elysee countless times and have recommended a Library Hotel to numerous friends and family. The staff works is so friendly and helpful making our stay so enjoyable.

title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee
text: We will definitely stay here again during our next trip to New York. The staff are very friendly and happy to assist with any requests we had. King sized bedroom was spacious and quiet. Added bonus is the complimentary breakfast and wine /snacks in the evening. A real treat to have. Location is very central and we walked to most sights such as the Met museum , Central Park, Frick Museum . 5th ave and Madison ave shopping, etc. We had an excellent dinner at the Monkey Bar restaurant which is located  in the hotel lobby. All round superb time thanks to the great staff at Hotel Elysee.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service
text:
