Stayed here for a couple of nights, my wife had stayed here a couple of times befoe and recommended it, I can now see why. Full of character and just a few blocks from Central Park. Check in was very efficient and the room was very nice and clean. Room was on the 6th floor.
Superb happy hour with wine and lovely nibbles. Breakfast was continental style and enjoyable. The staff were excellent and most helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel and will stay here again next time we are in town.

title: Hotel Elysee, NYC
text: Great location on 54th near Park Ave. We had a very large room with 2 queen beds, bath is small but very nice. My only suggestion would be that for the breakfast they should have homemade oatmeal and not  instant packets.

title: Hotel Elysee is a hidden treasure!
text: Hotel Elysee is a hidden treasure right in the best part of midtown. You can tell by the staff and their attention to so many details, this small chain of grand hotels is totally committed to the optimal guest experience!

title: Nice Retreat
text: My wife and I spent two nights the Hotel Elysee. The staff was excellent. We enjoyed the wine and cheese both nights and met several other guests. Breakfast is also a big plus. Great location. We enjoyed the city. I thought the carpets were getting a bit worn but overall a great experience.

title: Hotel Elysee exquisite!! Excellent service!
text: First time to stay at this beautiful hidden gem! And we will be back. Great location. Attentive staff. Nice size rooms. Comfortable, cozy and lovely accommodations..6 Stars!! Hearty continental breakfast daily and complimentary wine/cheese happy hour.

title: Looked After
text: We had a great stay. The staff were very attentive and all had smiles on thier faces. The breakfast was excellent. The bed was very comfortable. The evening wine and cheese was an extra treat. No probs with the Wifi too.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: This was my first trip to New York and thanks to Hotel Elysee it won't be my last.  We came to New York to explore and celebrate my birthday. The 2nd floor reception was outstanding.  We received assistance from Jennifer and Alexandra in planning our itinerary, they should be commended for taking the extra time to educate us on how to get around and where to go.  Thanks to them and their great hospitality and service we were able to better understand how to use the subway and they also had great advice on restaurants in the area. Also a great thanks to them as we will be back! Jennifer was so kind to even give us a card to use for the subway. Please thank her for me she was very helpful and went the extra mile in service to us!

title: Wonderful Family Hotel
text: We had a fabulous time at the Elysée celebrating our 20th anniversary with our family. This was our third visit and each stay has been memorable. The Elysée hotel is gracious, comfortable and provides wonderful service. They always go out of their way with champagne and chocolate to welcome us. We adore the Monkey Bar downstairs and can’t wait to return.

title: Great Service - Monkey Bar
text: Rooms are nice, clean with decent views. Staff is excellent. It is an older hotel that is kept up but only one elevator. quite part of town as bartender told me the "soulless" part of Manhattan.  Note that other bars in this area close early (10pm) in summer. The Monkey bar and restaurant has great drinks and food. I apologize for the rowdy Texans last week.

title: nice hotel
text: The elysee hotel is a very nice hotel in a great location.You can walk to central park in about 15 min.Shoping on 5th ave and madison ave are only a short walk.My room had everything i needed,safe air conditioner big screen tv and comfy bed.I suggest getting a room in the back as the front facing rooms can be noisy.They have a free continental breakfast to get you off to a good start.Everyone at the front desk was friendly and helpful.This is a very nice 4 star hotel.It is good value for your money.My room was less than 300 dollars.I will be staying here when i need a hotel in nyc.

title: Absolutt fantastisk
text: Svært hyggelig velkomst! Flott og rent rom (jr suite). God men enkel frokost. Svært hyggelig gest å servere vin og ost hver dag kl 17. Betjening er alltid smilende og hjelpsom. Svært sentralt beliggenhet. Vi kommer gjerne tilbake hit. Anbefales på det sterkeste.

title: Another AWESOME visit
text: Stayed here once again and it did not disappoint. Staff is one of the best I’ve ever encountered. Hotel rooms are extremely clean but could use some updating. Nice touch is the breakfast offering on second floor. This just happens to be my go to place while I’m in the city.

title: Great location and staff
text: Excellent service and as good a value as you'll get in midtown. We like modern, clean hotels but these older rooms are charming. If they fix the terrible air conditioning in the rooms we'd give it a 5.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: We stayed for 5 nights and we had a great stay. The staff and services were spot on. It was the first time we stayed at Hotel Elysee and next time we visit NYC for sure we will be staying there again.  Very quiet, quaint hotel and the hospitality was great!!!!

title: Elysee Fan
text: This lovely Boutique Hotel is my favorite place to stay when I visit NYC.  The location cannot be beat for Shoppers!  I’ve been staying here for the past 20 years & the level of service and charming rooms have not changed-thank goodness!

title: Good base
text: Lovely older style hotel with personal service and great place to unwind almost like a step back in time. Ideally situated. Very friendly staff added to this communal areas are very appealing and the afternoon nibbles are very nice.  Rooms are a very good size, we were spoilt for room which is rare in NYC

title: Elysee in New York City
text:
It is a French-style hotel, of a very stylish and beautiful design.
The room was excellent, delicious breakfast, great service, location close to Fifth Avenue and Central Park,
There is a fine restaurant in the hotel
Transportation is available not far away
The receptionists were very nice
Free WiFi
From 5 pm to 8 pm the hotel offers wine with cheeses and all for free, we loved it very much.

Dining room is too small

title: A good boutique hotel......
text: A nice boutique hotel at a convenient location. Rooms were clean and spacious with good and courteous staff. Particularly liked the happy hour where, besides wines etc., there were gold selections of teas and coffees with assorted cookies and varieties of cheese and a pleasant environment. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Great location in Manhattan
text: We had a fabulous time at this hotel.  The service from the staff, whether it be reception, the dining room, front door or cleaners, was outstanding. They are the key factor in why we would stay here again, or recommend to others.  The decor of the hotel is a little bit tired, but nonetheless all the amenities were fine - happy hour was awesome.  Our room was big and comfortable, although the air conditioner sometimes sounded like we were back in an aircraft.  Location was perfect for us to wander around on foot and the subway was only a block away.

title: Charming hotel in a great location.
text: With friendly staff, and clean, quiet, and well appointed rooms, the Hotel Elysee is an affordable option for people wanting to stay near the excitement of Midtown Manhattan. It's close to Fifth and Madison Ave. shopping and near to the subway, so all of NYC is at your feet.

title: First time at Elysee
text:
I had always wanted to stay at the Elysee.  I have a conference nearby which worked great.

Room and bathroom were small but ample for NY.  AC was great which sometimes is an issue in NY in summer months.

Breakfast on floor 2 was welcome surprise.  

Staff was really friendly

I look forward to coming back soon

title: Has real charm
text:
When we arrived the front office great, but not all was Good? 
The air conditioner sounded like a jet plan, our room was not made up on a couple of occasions, there is only one lift in the hotel. One could be waiting for the lift to go back down, then Gav a number of stops on the way up to find there was no room, so we waited again.
Breakfast could have had a change up, same, same each day. Staff not really attentive at breakfast, no one rally overseeing this? Front door guy was playing on his phone, not a good look.

On the good side. Good size rooms, great location, the hotel has a real country inn feel about it.

title: Great stay - checks all the boxes I look for
text: When I stay in a city hotel, I’m normally focused on a clean, quiet room and a good location at a reasonable price.  When I’m traveling with my wife and kids, I’m also looking for enough space such that we’re all comfortable.  My recent stay at the Hotel Elysee checked all the boxes.  The location at 54th just off Madison is central to much of Manhattan.  As recommended by some reviews, I asked for a room at the back of the building and the room had no street noise - you could hear the building air conditioning units a bit but that was a less offensive white noise.  The room was clean and we booked a 1 bedroom suite for about the same price as a regular room in Manhattan ($329).  It came with a good sized pull-out sofa and a separate bedroom with a King-size bed.  Plenty of room for all.  While the value of the room was good, it was the lack of penny pinching so prevalent at many hotels that was particularly appreciated.  They had two complimentary bottles of water in the room.  There was a “thank you” brownie with a business card from the manager wishing a pleasant stay.  WiFi was included and even the valet was extremely reasonable - $30 per 24 hours is very fair.  It’s little things like that, along with the excellent service of all staff members we encountered, which means we’ll come back again.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel in Perfect Location
text: The staff here are fantastic, from the doormen to the front desk staff and those managing the breakfast room every day.  The rooms are good size, bathrooms are very nice and the linens are soft.  The beds are very firm so for those wanting a soft bed, that may be a challenge.  That said, they offer feather beds along with a list of other items you can order (we ordered a coffee maker for the room).  The breakfast is very nice and they'll make you a cappuccino the moment you arrive.  It's more of a continental style but has everything you need to start you day off perfectly.  The complimentary wine and cheese each night is a nice touch as well.  The staff really make this quaint hotel and the location is perfect....a few blocks walk to 5th ave/Central Park, Rock Center, Times Square etc.  You will enjoy the quiet street and very nice part of town and can easily walk to the chaotic tourist spots!  This will be my NYC hotel without question when I return.

title: Perfect place!
text: I strongly recommend this hotel. The location is perfect, rooms are large and the standing is high. For such a central place, the hotel is very quiet if you ask for a room off the street.Breakfast and happy hour are definitely a plus. Highly recommended.

title: Nice little hotel with a great location!
text: I booked this hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary and we couldn't have made a better choice! We had a nice room set-up with chocolates waiting for us on our arrival. We enjoyed breakfast as well as the

title: our favorite
text: when the price is right this is our favorite hotel in NYC. very congenial, the library is lovely and the breakfast generous. the rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. the location is perfect.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
Attention to detail fantastic.....Perfect location
Staff went above and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed
Can't say enough about this hotel*****
It is now my home when visiting NYC
Great Happy Hour and a wonderful breakfast as well
The Monkey Bar was a perfect spot to slow down and re-group
Rooms was clean and lovely and had everything you would need
Very happy i found this gem....can't wait to go back

title: A most enjoyable stay!
text:
Queen bedroom was poor... Better book for the king size room! 
The stuff was most polite and always willing to help!
The location of the hotel was perfect, and breakfast was very generous and had a lot of fresh fruit!

title: Wonderful!
text: My husband and I enjoyed a three night getaway in NYC and Hotel Elysee was a great place to escape the busy streets!  Everyone was friendly, helpful and professional. Location was great!  Thank you!  We will definitely try other Library Hotels. You will be very pleased!

title: Hotel Elysee to the rescue
text: I found myself stranded in NYC last week due to massive flight cancellations.  At the last minute, I called my favorite hotel to see if you had availability.  My two friends and I we so dry, happy and comfortable at Hotel Elysee that we wanted to extend our stay.  Always incredible customer service and beautiful room. Thank you.

title: excellent
text: we couldn't have been happier with our stay of three nights at the hotel Elysee.  we plan on coming back soon.  we will make the Hotel Elysee our go to Hotel. not only is the staff amazing but the location is wonderful

title: Hotel Elysee
text: Bed was super comfortable, bar is awesome.  I love small boutique hotels.  When your room number is 97, you know its a small hotel.  Feels like home. For a small hotel, had a stocked minifridge and the bath accessories were nice.  Could use an upgrade to the TV's.

title: Cousin trip to NYC
text: We loved our stay at Hotel Elysee.  The rooms are so spacious and nice.  The best location too.  We could not have been more pleased with this hotel.  The breakfast every morning was wonderful and the staff is so helpful and nice.  We cannot wait to come back!

title: We have been staying at this charming hotel forty years and have only had wonderful experiences.
text: Besides the room being nicely appointed and the complimentary breakfast, wine & horsdoeuvres served in a charming lounge that has the feel of an elegant old library, the staff is just as charming. We have been staying here for forty years and always look forward to returning.

title: Trip to NYC
text: This was our second stay at the hotel. We have always found the staff to be friendly, helpful and professional. The clubhouse breakfast and cocktail hour are a wonderful treat and the staff were very attentive to our needs.

title: Elysee - NYC
text: Comfortable, welcoming, highly professional and responsive staff. Great location convenient to my meetings and great restaurants nearby. Staff in the Club room was first rate, suite was especially spacious and wonderful for entertaining guests.

title: Great value for money.
text: Stayed for a week in July. Breakfast and wine/nibbles reception each evening are included in the cost. Whilst NY breakfasts are easy to come by this was a good deal as it included cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, yoghurt, fresh fruit, juice, tea and coffee so we ate there each day. The hotel is quite traditional in style and decor and the clientele are probably on the more mature side but again this made for a quiet hotel in the middle of noisy NY. Ask for a high floor and a room not facing the street to ensure a good night’s sleep. Staff are very helpful and attentive, especially the girls at breakfast who are lovely. Hotel needs a refurb really as some rooms/bathrooms are quite tired.

title: Outstanding as always
text: Made a fairly last-minute decision to stay over after seeing a Hamilton matinee. The staff was courteous and gracious as always and gave us a fantastic corner room. They kept our bags during the show, provided extras we requested and overall made us feel welcome in our New York home base.

title: Perfect stay at Hotel Elysee
text:
I loved this hotel.  It is quaint and antique looking and not very large.  The rooms and street were very quiet.  We were in room 121, two queen beds in a spacious room with a decent sized bathroom.  The room was very very clean and the beds were devine to sleep on.  The staff were always so lovely, welcoming us back each time we came through the doors, be it 5pm or 2am!

The breakfast is excellent (by American standards), but the highlight was the wine, champers, cheese, olives, etc in the afternoons.  It's a lovely touch.

The location is easily accessible by subway or on foot to many famous streets and shopping locations.  Thank you again Hotel Elysee!

title: A relazed and cozy respite in a hustle and bustle environment
text:
We stayed here due to the remodeling of the Waldorf Astoria. We were looking for a hotel with a similar environment and the Elysee seemed to be the place. 

This hotel has the classic style of the Waldorf however on a much smaller scale. There is a second floor refreshment area that serves continental breakfast and snacks throughout the day. 

The room itself was small but very comfortable and has the vintage style reminiscent of the Waldorf, which is what we were looking for.

The main drawback is there being only one elevator which resulted in much waiting. On several occasions we took the stairs down from the 6th floor to save time. Additionally the hotel seemed a bit expensive for the experience. 

The hotel is conveniently located between Madison and Park Avenues providing easy access to both 5th Avenue and the subway. The staff was quite helpful and friendly providing a welcoming feeling.

title: Love this gem of a hotel
text: I have stayed at Hotel Elysee 6 or 7 times.  I love this place.  It's in a wonderful location, close to everything.  The staff are warm and welcoming.  The rooms are large and very suitable.  The lounge is open at all hours with complimentary breakfast and wine/cheese.  It is like an oasis in midtown Manhattan.

title: Charming, great value in Midtown
text:
Our first stay on recommendation of friends, and couldn't have been more pleased. This almost boutique-style hotel is small by Midtown mega-hotel standards, but that absolutely works to its favor. The location, a half block east of Madison on 54th, is close to everything, but perfectly far enough away from the more crowded Midtown craziness. To a person,all management and staff were professional, friendly, and helpful. Our Grand King Suite on front side of hotel was spacious, quiet, and very clean. The bath was older-hotel small, but was efficient and nicely finished with marble. In general, the room and furnishings could use a refresh, but certainly fine for this price point, and the bed very comfortable.
Regarding value, there is much to like here. Daily continental breakfast, and evening wine and cheese are served in the cozy second floor Club room with large windows overlooking 54th St, all included with the room charge, plus the hotel does not tack on any of those annoying resort fees, unlike so many other hotels. Valet parking is a Midtown hotel bargain at $30 per day.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Elysee, and would certainly choose it again when staying in Midtown.

title: I loved this hotel!
text: This hotel is old school charming not old school outdated.  You could be fooled by the lobby since the only sitting area are 2 wall flower arm chairs surrounded by antique looking furniture.  The staff is friendly, helpful and professional.  The continental breakfast is adequate and the 5pm happy hour lovely.  Be careful not to fill up on the complimentary cracker/cheese/olives/cookies before dinner.  We had 2 rooms.  Same column, but different floors since I requested 2 queen beds instead of king beds for our family vacation.  You wouldn't think room 125 would be good because it's right off the elevator and between the stairwell and elevator, but I heard NO outside or neighbor noise and would request this room in a heartbeat.  My husband and other son were in room 135, same set up, but the room has a darling balcony complete with table, chairs and flower pots.  Rooms are good size.  Big enough for 2 queen beds, desk, 2 arm chairs and I opened 2 suitcases and left them open.  The decor is antique.  Bathroom is fine.  Good water pressure.  The best part, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean!!  The hotel is situated on a quiet street, so I suspect noise is limited.  A quick walk to the 4,5,6 subway line at Lexington and 51st.  Also a quick walk to 5th Avenue, Times Square, the UN, basically anywhere in midtown.

title: Perfect location, cosy atmosphere. Helpful, professional and friendly staff, good restaurant and bar.
text:
Superb location to visit NYC. 
Rooms are clean and comfortable, staff is friendly and professional and bar + restaurant are very good.
Nice breakfast buffet, + we appreciated the 5 o'clock wine and hors d'oeuvres !
My husband stayed at the Elysee on is own before we met, we stayed there to celebrate our 10th anniversary in 2007 and came back this year with our 2 sons. We think that Elysee Hotel is perfectly suitable for business travelers, couples, and families :)

title: Wonderful Staff!
text: Took my daughter on a trip to NYC to celebrate her 16th, and I was lucky enough to book this hotel! The entire staff was lovely-helpful, kind, funny. They gave us advice, ordered us amazing New York style pizzas (we’re from Colorado) when we were too tired to go back out for a late dinner. They got us taxis and arranged cars when we needed them.

title: So Disappointing
text: Having stayed at both the Library Hotel and Hotel Giraffe previously, we had reasonable expectations of this property when we booked 2 rooms (a double and a twin bedded) for a few days. It became clear from other reviews and our own experience that whether you will like your stay here depends largely on which rooms you get, and unfortunately we align with the despondent ones. Our only saving grace was that we were hardly there, having a full schedule that took us away all day and much of each evening but the issues we noted were unacceptable. The double bedroom was just adequate but had some shabby worn furnishings and a bathroom with no free shelving for belongings. Also irksome was that aggressive bar fridge notice which scared us off ever touching anything in there and oh yes, that used shampoo bottle left by a previous guest in a corner of the shower which stayed there throughout. The other, twin bedded, room on a different floor seemed to be haunted by extremely noisy housekeeping staff in the corridors whose walkie talkies echoed for intense periods, and there was one occasion when a ‘supervisor housekeeper’ woman barged in without knocking and then left without apology. Shame that didn’t coincide with the time when we slid one of the single beds aside to look for a dropped piece of jewellery and ... well, suffice to say we regretted looking under that bed. Don’t want to hear that we should have faced the hassle of reporting any of this; a hotel of this long-standing should have monitoring systems in place. We allocate 2 stars  because the guest lounge looked lovely and the waitstaff there very welcoming, however we never got to have breakfast there because there were no spare chairs and so we gave up and started our days at a great little coffee shop just down the street. Front desk staff were ok, though they didn’t manage the occurrence of a mysterious extra charge at checkout very well.  We were told ‘don’t know, it’s after hours’ so we let it go as we had a plane to catch and we just wanted to leave.  Would never return.

title: Recent Stay
text: Great location attendant service clean rooms and common areas Nice breakfast and all day club room.  Wine not so much but cheese and crackers nice.  Elevator slow but manageable.  Monkey Bar expensive but a lot of fun!!

title: Excellent location and amenities!
text:
Our room was on the 3rd floor, which is an easy walk down one flight to the Lounge or two flights down to the Lobby.  We had friends staying on a higher floor and with one elevator, there could be a wait at busy times. 
Front desk staff - excellent!  Friendly, helpful, and professional.  Special thanks to Jeron who assisted me with getting tickets to another Broadway play and always took time to greet you! A doorman is always ready to assist and all were so friendly & helpful! 
We had an end room (#34) which we found to be more spacious than other rooms when compared to our friends room in the same category. Mattress & pillows VERY comfortable!  Room had 2 mini-fridges (one with mini bar with for fee items and the other just an empty mini fridge that we used to store our drinks & leftovers. (I believe you can request an a fridge when booking online).  Two complimentary bottles of water and a chocolate bar.  Housekeeping came twice daily. As with many properties in NYC, don't expect a view from your window.  There was one window in this room (bedroom), it had opaque glass on the lower part and clear glass on the upper part and looked onto another building. As a result, not much sunlight even on clear days & difficult to determine the weather. 
The Lounge was one of our favorite amenities - convenient and complimentary continental breakfast items and wine / cheese from 5-8 PM. This saves time when you are on the go!  Lounge sofas are comfortable and provide a view of front of hotel. 
The location of this property was so convenient to walking -- to Central Park, to 5th Ave, Times Square, Broadway theaters, subway stations, and many restaurants. 
We really enjoyed the Old World charm and convenience of this property.  We would stay again without hesitation and highly recommend!

title: Authentic and charming
text:
Excellent charming boutique hotel in the heart of NewYork City
The amazing staff will great you from the moment you enter and you will
be treated with caring and professional employees
We have been coming here for years and there is no other hotel that we would rather stay at
Everything is close by from theatres, museums, operas and ballets, Central Park , shopping all
accessible.Did I mention also great restaurants
Enjoy and once you’re here you can’t wait to return

title: Good Location, Elevator is only drawback
text: John the manger replied when we had an issue, and even left champaign and chocolate. The hotel is in a great part of town, perfect for shows and central parkl walks, shopping on 5th avenue. The only word of caution, I am claustrophobic, and the elevator is very small, old and not programed for smart floor stops. The lounge is on the 2cd floor, so if you have a higher floor, you may have very long waits in the morning for a lift.

title: Feels like home
text: I love this hotel. It’s charming, the staff are all professional, friendly, and beyond helpful. The amenities are exactly what I need. Continental breakfast is great, coffee is available all the time, and the lounge is relaxing. It’s European in style, so don’t expect huge rooms, elevators, or hallways. Do expect bathrooms with marble finishes, lovely flowers in the lobby and lounge, and fantastic hospitality.

title: Love the Hotel Elysee!
text: We visited New York in July and found the accommodations at Elysee wonderful.  The staff was very friendly and very attentive to any of our requests.  Elysee’s second floor lounge with its continental breakfast and enjoyable evening spread made for a comfortable base between our various city excursions.

title: Great Hotel
text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Elysee with my 14 year old son for a quick weekend get away. The hotel was terrific--especially the service. The staff was always friendly and helpful as well as accommodating. In addition to making reservations and offering suggestions, they were always friendly and happy to try to help. Would definitely stay at the Hotel Elysee again.

title: Wonderful
text: This hotel was a real find.  Everything, from the amenities to the staff was just wonderful.  It is convenient to shopping and theater.  I look forward to my next opportunity to be in NY and will definitely choose the Elysee.

title: again and again
text: This is my fourth or fffth stay at the Elysee and I know why I return the staff are welcoming, efficent yet at the same time are not in your face.  A great place to stay and withing walking distance of many places of interest.

title: Great hotel in midtown.
text: The staff is very friendly and kind. The hotel offers many extras for free, including breakfast and evening goodies. The latter includes wine, cheese, and other edibles. The hotel is located within walking distance of the theater district and key museums.

title: Feels like home in the big city
text:
I love the location and the club room
Employees are always friendly and accommodating and call you by name
My preferred hotel in NYC
This trip was extra special because it was my almost six year old granddaughter’s first trip to NY

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: If all hotels would use The Elysee as a model, the hospitality industry would be a better place. I was blown away by their attentive customer service, room size and cleanliness and value for the money!

title: The only place I stay in nyc!
text: Coming to Hotel Elysee is like coming home! I’m always warmly welcomed and the staff couldn’t be more accommodating. I especially enjoy the vibe at this hotel where it’s low key and elegant. The location couldn’t be better for midtown activities. Feels like my home away from home. Highly recommended 👍

title: Charming
text:
My husband and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary last week and decided on a show, dinner and an overnight stay.  The Elysee had been recommended to me a couple of years ago and we finally had a chance to try it out.

From the moment we pulled up in front of hotel we were met with kindness and professionalism.  The Doormen, Front Desk Staff and Bellmen were friendly and took pride in the hotel.  The rooms are beautifully appointed with colors and fabrics you would expect to see in Provence.  They are not large but by no means small.

The wine and cheese reception in the 2nd floor lounge was a nice treat and a great place to meet our friends before dinner.  The continental breakfast blew us away!  There is so much to choose from that we could have eaten there every morning and not been bored.  This brings me to the staff of the lounge which were all friendly, busy bussing tables and greeting guests.  I want to make sure I give them a shout out.

The reason I gave the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because our room which was supposed to be handicap accessible, and was, but missed in a couple of areas.  Now, before I continue,  there is a fully handicap accessible room with a roll-in shower but it was taken when I booked our stay.  They have another room with a tub but it has grab bars by the toilet and being we were staying for 1 night only I booked it.  The problem with the room are the marble thresholds at the entrance to the room and entrance to the bathroom.  If these were removed the room would be easier to use for someone in a wheelchair.  Also, I suggest the hotel check the mattress which is sunken in the middle.  None of this will stop us from staying here again.  I will make sure I book when the handicap accessible room is available.

One more thing.  I mentioned we would be celebrating our wedding anniversary when I booked and when we got to our room there was a bottle of wine and a box of chocolates from the hotel.  What a nice touch.  Please try this lovely hotel when you are in NYC.

title: My go to midtown hotel
text:
I have been staying at the Hotel Elysee for at  least 7 years. It is the perfect mid town location with easy access to the subway, shopping, Broadway shows and great restaurants. The staff is professional and caring. Complementary breakfast as well as wine & cheese in the evening are served in a comfortable space. You do need to allow time to ride the elevator is there is only 1 and it is old & slow. I did notice on this star that some of the furnishings are starting to show wear. 
If you like a small boutique hotel with personal service I would recommend the Hotel Elysee.

title: Exactly what we wanted
text: My hubby and I stayed here for my birthday trip to nyc and had a great time. Location is perfect for shows, museums, and Central Park. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable. Quiet and clean. Not super fancy but we didn’t want that. Cozy. Nice breakfast each morning and wine each evening. I’d stay here again

title: BEWARE --NOT A TOP HOTEL-
text: I stay at top TA hotels / traveler ranked globally--We booked this after seeing Elysse Hotel as a top 5 NYC--Last year stayed sherrey nederlands was top 5 and it was a GR8 hotel...The Elyyse has one small elevator-, old elevator -had to wait over 10 minutes for the lift 4 times the past 2 days. Mornings are impossible to get the elevator..had to walk down 12 floors ..Our room, the presidential suite has stains on the pillows- terrible internet--and the TV is fuzzy..light bulbs burned out in the room, truly mind boggling how this hotel got a top 5 ranking--curious how all T/A top 5 are library collection hotels in travelor ranked.. This is an old dated hotel not even close to being a top NYC hotel--Location is very good...BUT The hotel is dated, internet slow, TV and our presidential suite is in disrepair, and the elevator should be  a HUGE REASON This is NOT a top hotel in any city... I am super sad trip advisor led me nd my family to  nights at the Elysse Hotel.

title: Always a good experience
text: We have considered other NYC properties but have always decided against it.  Spotlessly clean and comfortable, warm and professional staff, great location and thoughtful touches make this our home away from home.

title: Fantastic stay
text: We stayed at the Casablanca hotel the other times we visited New York but wanted a less hectic location.  Hotel elysee was perfect    Staff was great, rooms were very nice and the location was perfect.   5 stars for everything

title: Excellent!
text: We were really pleased with our stay at Hotel Elysee. We felt at home there. Very cozy boutique hotel. Constant availability of snacks, coffee, hot chocolate and tea definitely a plus! Staff very hospitable.

title: anniverary retreat
text:
The staff was very helpful and professional.  Our room was very clean and nice.  The overnight parking was very convenient.   
The manager provided a bottle of champagne and chocolates for our anniversary and that was a pleasant surprise.
The breakfast and wine hour were an added perk!

title: NYC Birthday break
text: This is my third time staying at Hotel Élysées and did not disappoint, in fact it makes my NYC trip extra special. Even without the upgrade we received just spending time in this hotel is extra special. Breakfast is great and the complementary wine and appetizers they serve just add to the overall experience. I will be back again for sure!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: My wife and I had a great 4 nights stay in the Elysse Hotel. We would certainly return and have no hesitation in recommending it as a base for a Manhattan break. The service and accommodation are of a very high standard.

title: European Charm
text: Perfect location in Manhattan. We could walk to theaters, museums and restaurants.  Everyone at Hotel Elysee is extremely kind from moment the door man opens the doors.  We have been there several times.  It's our go to hotel in Manhattan.

title: Always a great stay.
text: I love this hotel. I have stayed here many times and have zero complaints. Rooms are very spacious, well decorated, comfortable and always very clean. Staff is always A+ and The Monkey Bar is a must to visit.

title: Dated but all the better for that...................
text:
A definite old world feel about this place which beckons one to slow down a bit & enjoy your surroundings. The rooms - clean & spacious by New York standards. The staff - helpful, courteous & go the "extra mile". The Club Room - a great place to relax as well as being the location for our complimentary continental breakfast & also offered complimentary wine & snacks every evening. Location - easy access to all of new York with its near central location. The Monkey Bar - an real bonus to have this bar/restaurant as part of the hotel. Like the hotel it has the feel of a bygone era.
Just make sure you get a room on the upper floors to minimise the traffic noise.

title: Great location and nice NYC hotel
text: Our stay at the Hotel Elysee was really nice. The room was clean and spacious.  The breakfast was fresh and delicious, and the servers were very accommodating. The front desk staff and bell men were very helpful and nice.  We would definitely go back!!

title: Elysee All The Way!
text: In NYC shopping for MOB dress and planning to stay just one night so booked a modest, conventional room. Had stayed here before and love the location, the breakfast/wine and cheese (3 hours!) and the intimate feel. I was floored by my upgrade to a penthouse suite! My flight out the next night got cancelled forcing me to spend another night in the city. The Elysee was sold out and after scrambling to check a few others, I found myself back at the Elysee to collect my bags and relate my dilemma. The clerk said he would talk to the manager and I was offered another penthouse suite at a reduced rate. So grateful for this courteous, helpful staff who went the extra mile for me!

title: A New York Gem
text: This is a hotel for those who appreciate old world charm, courtesy  and efficiency. The bedrooms are spacious and comfortable and the club room an absolute joy in which to rest weary feet after a long day! I have stayed here for  over 20 years. I cannot rate it too highly.

title: Our Stay
text: Enjoyed our stay there. Very well located. Breakfast and 5:00 wine and cheese excellent. My only complaint was it was noisy from street below, although we were on the 7th floor. Stay in back room if available.

title: Perfecto
text: Toda nuestra experiencia fue perfecta! desde la llegada y encontrar la pieza lista a pesar de que era antes de almuerzo. Pieza un poco pequeña pero perfecta para NY, no se necesita más. La ubicación es maravillosa, a una cuadra y media de dos importantes estaciones de metro (incluyendo la linea que va al aeropuerto), a pocos pasos de la quinta avenida y sus atractivos. Personal amable. Desayuno incluido simple pero ideal, rápido y cómodo. Vuelvo de todas maneras.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel...
text: The hotel is conveniently located in Midtown just a short walk to the MoMa, Rockefeller Center, and even Times Square. The beds were comfy with turn down service every night and complimentary bottled water in the room. Breakfast is served daily in the lounge and includes delicious pastries, bagels, cereals, fresh fruit, etc and it has a cocktail "hour" 5-8 every evening with wine, cheese and crackers. The lounge is conveniently open 24/7 with tea, coffee and cookies. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Lovely boutique hotel in fantastic location.
text: Stayed here with my two kids and my mother. All three generations loved it! Incredibly nice staff, comfy rooms, and a location to die for within a manageable walk of Broadway and Central Park. If you are traveling with kids, this place is really ideal.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Great location and very comfortable room. Breakfast and happy hour were an added bonus.
Many rooms have windows on two walls. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great restaurants near the hotel including the Monkey Bar in the hotel.

title: Little to fault at this hotel
text:
I loved staying at the Elysee.  There are just a couple of things that would have liked to make it absolutely perfect, but It was as close to perfect as one could expect.
The location was superb.  Walking distance to everything I wanted on my 15 night stay there.
Great staff who were helpful With questions, directions and advice.
Terrific breakfast and excellent snacks in the comfortable cozy Club Lounge in the evening.
Whatever I asked for was delivered to my room in minutes with a smile and grace.
Even my New York friends want to stay there!

title: Another great stay at Hotel Elysee
text:
As always -  all was excellent -  Hotel Elysee is a special hotel in mid-town -  a quiet retreat.
From front desk to social room all staff was gracious and helpful.
This was my 4th stay at Hotel Elysee and look forward to returning.

.

title: Perfect
text: Hotel Elysee and its staff are perfection in hospitality. This is a charming hotel in a great location with superb service. We were made to feel so cared for and at home by their exceptional staff. Highly recommended.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Wonderful location in NYC. The staff is so helpful and always smiling.  Comfortable rooms with great sheets, pillows and towels.  Nice breakfast and afternoon snacks included in the lounge with is a great extension to your room.

title: Just perfect!
text: The front desk is warm and welcoming. The location on the Upper East Side is perfect for anywhere you want to go in the city. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed and the Continental breakfast, as well as the afternoon wine and cheese offerings are top quality.

title: A gem in midtown
text: I have stayed many times at Hotel Elysee- each time my stay has been wonderful. The rooms are lovely and comfortable, the breakfast and evening wine reception are exceptional, and the staff are lovely. A perfect little retreat in bustling midtown. Highly recommend.

title: Elegant hotel with nice amenities
text: The staff was very responsive and knowledgeable. I liked the location and the hotel, the fact it wasn’t on a terribly busy road, the free gym access, on-site restaurant and the free WiFi. The front desk staff were helpful with suggestions and directions. I had a room on floor 14 that had a very large private terrace. It had a nice table and chairs along with potted flowers. What a wonderful surprise! The room was very large and comfortable. I would be very pleased to stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

title: Outstanding service at the Elysee
text: Loved the history and location of your hotel. The lounge was a great spot for relaxing before and after touring NYC. Service was excellent across the board and thoroughly enjoyed the selections for breakfast and for the evening reception, as well as the coffee and cookies at any time of day!!!  Have already told several friends who travel to NY about your hotel

title: Classy boutique hotel
text:
Great location, walking distance to subway, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, etc
Exceptionally helpful front desk staff....each is a concierge.
Nice breakfast and daily wine/cheese reception.
Rooms are “city small” but comfortable and good bed, linens, etc.

title: A Hidden Gem in Manhattan
text: This lovely, well located hotel has outstanding staff, rooms and service.  The hotel was restored to the grandeur of the majestic hotels of its day.  My wife and I met wonderful guests at the 3 hour cocktail time, each evening.

title: Great boutique hotel.
text:
Lovely property and a nice staff. Everything was well done. The room was attractive with traditional decor.  Even the flower arrangements were top quality. The hospitality room on the second floor is a wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle outside. Classical music and other pleasant background music and a really nice continental breakfast is served in this pretty room as well as wine and nibbles at night. For NYC the rate is very fair.
Would highly rate this property and will stay there again.

title: .o
text:
excellent service, clean and comfortable helpful at front desk.
Excellent location,
good breakfast and nice wine and cheese
I didn't even mind waiting for the one elevator which is too often busy
I hope that when they remodel,  they will not change too much the oldfashion character of this charming little hotel.

title: Love Hotel Elysee!
text: We have had so many great experiences staying at Hotel Elysee! Love it there and have for 20 years! Our rooms were great and the service was fantastic. The breakfasts and the cocktail hour were a big hit with our party.

title: Extravagance and luxury in Midtown
text: Everything about this hotel is extraordinary. From the moment you step in, the decor feels elegant and the staff are ready to assist. The room was very spacious, with plenty of precious hangers waiting to be used (I always seem to run out!). While the bathroom was smaller than expected, it brings to mind the charm of old NYC and is reminiscent of the history of the building (real or imagined). Breakfast was delicious and over-the-top but well worth the price.

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: Location is great. Small boutique. Lovely breakfast with casual seating that allows privacy or mingling with other guest. Great happy hour drinks and hors d' oeuvres --both included in the price.  Near several good neighborhood restaurants.  Professional and very nice staff many of whom have been there for year.  It has been two years since we've been there, but we've stayed many times in the past.

title: Nice hotel
text: This hotel was exceptional in its customer service. Every staff member was polite, eager to please and very knowledgeable. Our room was very clean and offered plenty of room. The room amenities were excellent. The continental breakfast was good but heavy in carbohydrates. We will most definitely return.

title: The perfect boutique hotel for your trip to NYC
text: I loved the amazing location, beautiful and spacious room and exceptionally helpful staff. The buzzing club room offering complimentary continental breakfast, evening cocktails and refreshments throughout the day was also really nice!

title: Romantic and Elegant Getaway in the Heart of Midtown
text: Boutique hotel whose décor and vibe conjours up the finest of early 20th century charm and elegance.  The attentiveness of staff to guests' needs and attention to detail is unparalleled. The cozy parlour (hospitality suite) where complimentary breakfast and afternoon hors d'euvres along with wine is served is a great place to meet other guests in a forum that just does not exist almost anywhere else.   We will definitely be returning either to it or to one of the other Library Collection hotels in the City!

title: Great Hotel
text: The Hotel Elysee was special in so many ways: 1.  it is in a great location.  2. Breakfast! A yummy continental breakfast. So rare in a NYC hotel. 3.  Coffee, tea and cookies 24 hours/day.  Also a rarity and much appreciated. 4. A wine and cheese daily event.  The room was comfortable.  The hotel was clean.  A great choice.

title: Great home away from home in the Big Apple
text: Well-located and central, close to the subway and to good shopping.  Very comfortable small boutique hotel with excellent breakfast provided (lots of fruit) and a fun little wine and cheese (with veggies) just before the supper and theatre hour,  We will come back!

title: Lovely Gem
text: This hotel is very nice. It is quiet and convenient to shopping and Rockefeller Center. Subway access within 3-5 minute walks. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. Beds are very comfortable. The evening wine reception and continental breakfast are complimentary and good! Have stayed here twice this year and will definitely return. One minus is that there is only one elevator.

title: Nice Hotel well positioned
text: The hotel has nice rooms but beware the inner rooms that have windown on the insdide courtyard are noisy due to the a/c units on the building opposite. That really spoilt the stay. Otherwise staff are friendly and helpful and the                         rooms are nice as is the breakfast. The hotel is conveniently positioned .

title: Always a pleasure
text: The Elysee is my favorite hotel in New York. I go at least once a year and would not consider any other place: a perfect location, exceedingly competent and friendly staff, and the wonderful breakfast and Happy Hour included in the price. I even hesitate to give such a good review, fearing that the hotel might be too full to accomodate me next time!

title: Nice boutique hotel, well located
text:
We stayed here on recommendation from some family friends. Our stay was only two nights because we had flown in just to see Hamilton. Check in was very easy, and we were greeted in our room by bottled water, chocolate, and a box of yummy cookies. Our room was a corner room with two windows, which I enjoyed for the view of the street. The first night we were awoken by loud street noise around 2 am, but using a sound machine app on my phone fixed that issue. The room was small, but big enough for our needs, and I appreciated the historic feeling and antique furniture. The bathroom was quite lovely and was well stocked with necessities and soft towels. 

The second day had a few hiccups. We were on the 4th floor and awoke to a broken elevator. After walking down for breakfast in the club room, we were offered use of the freight elevator. This elevator issue persisted the rest of our stay. Not a huge deal, but we chose to take the stairs most times because the freight elevator was overtaxed and slow. After a lovely day walking around Manhattan, we returned for a quick shower to refresh before dinner and found no hot water at all!  We called down and were told someone would check on it, but we had an hour to get ready for dinner and we’re unable to shower during that time.  By the time we returned to our room around midnight after an evening of karaoke, we had hot water again. 

One of the biggest draws in booking this hotel for us was the breakfast and afternoon reception offered in the Club Room. We enjoyed this aspect very much. My husband and I were both able to find something to eat in the morning, from boiled eggs to fruit to pastries and hot coffee. The afternoon reception was also lovely, with several wine options and a fantastic cheese platter with other accompaniments. 

Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again and recommend it to our friends!

title: Terrific Second Visit
text: After a small hiccup on my first stay at the hotel a month ago, I gave it a second try last weekend.  My only regret is that I spent so little time on-site for the one night we stayed at the hotel.  The hospitality was excellent, there was attention to detail at all levels of the staff, and the room was exceptionally quiet and comfortable.  Thank you, Hotel Elysee.  I plan to return on my future visits to NYC.

title: service is outstanding!!!!
text: The service is excelent, they have to renew the elevator, almost 4 days didn´t work. Anyway is highly recomended.They provide all the things that you need and the cleaning and people who atend the lounge are the best.

title: Hotel Elysee
text: Lovely hotel in a very good location - 54th St. between Madison and Park.  Easy walking to shopping.  Close to a subway station.  Very friendly and helpful hotel personnel.  Room was very clean, well decorated, spacious.  Bathroom was very clean and modern.  I especially like the sitting room on the second floor for hotel guests.  I feel very safe at this hotel.

title: NYC Jewel
text: Hotel Elysee is one of the jewels of NYC.  We have stayed there on a number of occasions and have always been so very happy and pleased with the hotel-from the outstanding and courteous front desk staff to the housekeepers and gracious lounge personnel.  We've recommended the place to friends and family and all have been pleased with the choice.  Will stay there anytime we return to NYC!  The Nelsons

title: My goto boutique hotel in Manhattan
text:
I've been to NYC for pleasure about 1/2 dozen times in the last 10 years, and twice in the last year....
This place has become my "go-to" hotel for many reasons. 
1.) location is perfect...not far from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, etc...yet still convenient to the rest of the city.
2.) the rooms are throwbacks to early 20th-century decor and are VERY spacious ..particularly by NYC standards.
3.) Bill's (a restaurant right across the street) is super cool, and the food was awesome, and its also in a super cool setting, with a great atmosphere.
4.) Personally, I would skip the on property "monkey bar" and seek out your entertainment elsewhere. we did go there 2 x during a 4-night stay...but only because it was right there on the way back to our room....and we weren't quite ready to pack it in....

Excellent Serivce Staff, and a wonderful place to stay during the holidays or anytime of the year.

title: Charming Boutique Hotel
text: A friend and I recently stayed for five nights at Hotel Elysée. It is a small hotel, but does not lack for amenities. The location is ideal – we were able to easily walk to a show on Broadway, restaurants, shopping, Central Park, etc. Every morning for breakfast there was an array of cereals, muffins, breads, hard-boiled eggs, coffees, juices and fruit.  We enjoyed the wine and cheese offerings in the evening. The staff was so attentive and helpful. If we needed anything, it was brought to the room quickly. The furnishings are charming and there is a large and comfortable common area where the food is laid out that overlooks the street. I know hotels can’t pick their guests, but we really enjoyed chatting with other lodgers during the breakfast and wine time!  In all aspects, our stay was a most pleasant experience. Yes, the bathroom was small – but then it is an old hotel – and I had read other reviews so I wasn’t surprised. The Monkey Bar is located in the hotel (FYI – not open Sunday night) and is a nifty restaurant and also has a bar area! Even if you don’t eat there, at least take a peek inside to check out the wall murals, and the wooden and brass monkey figurines. The food was outstanding and the wait staff very gracious.

title: Wonderful
text:
Excellent service - from check-in, to doormen, to reception/breakfast/lounge. 
We traveled with a group of 12 adults. Nice to see everyone in the morning for breakfast, and have a place to gather in the evening for a glass of wine before our next adventure..

We loved the room; a lovely siting area, and comfortable bed. Asked for extra pillows and they arrived in minutes. There were plenty of drawers, shelves, places to sort our stuff. The location was great for walking or catching the subway.

title: Third time's a charm
text: My wife and I know there are other choices but enjoy the great service and other amenities.  We like the location and appreciate the size of the hotel as opposed to the mega ones that are available.  This is our third [or maybe it's the fourth] time at the hotel and will plan to stay again when we next visit from Wisconsin.

title: Another excellent stay
text: We love Hotel Elysee. It offers the best customer service, location and amenities.  The breakfast buffet is wonderful and the staff is over-accommodating.  The evening cocktails and appetizers are a perfect preview to a night on the town.

title: So sorry, I’ve not done this before....
text:
We come to NYC about once a year. We sometimes try to use reward points and have stayed at the Marriott and the Hilton... But for the past 25 years, this has been our ‘go-to’ place.  We have brought a teenage girl and an 85 year old abuela... This place makes all others pale. The front-desk staff is both knowledgeable and consistently spot-on for recommendations. The morning staff in the breakfast room are outstanding as are the afternoon ‘cheese and wine’ staff.  It almost feels like coming home.  The housekeeping staff is more than accommodating; the bellmen and doormen welcome you each morning and speak to you by name... We will be back; again, and again; and again...
Thank you for your kindnesses.

title: Great hotel!
text: It is always a great experience staying at the Elysee.  I feel like home away from home.  Everybody is very nice and make you feel welcome.  The location is also great, near everything I am interested in.

title: my recent stay
text: friendly and helpful staff as usual; noted we were celebrating my wife's birthday and we had a bottle of wine waiting in the room with a birthday card from the manager....nice touch. When we stay in NY, it is only at the Elysee!  Also, like the parking right next door and the shopping around the corner. One of our favorites is having a nightcap at the Money Bar as well.

title: Loved It !
text: We stayed at the Casablanca the last time we visited NYC and chose the Elysee because it is part of the same group. We stayed for a week and had a lovely spacious room on the top (15th) floor; people kept asking if we were in the penthouses. Everything about the hotel was just great, it is not rated so highly on here for no good reason. The staff on the front desk were polite and helpful, made bookings for us, printed out tickets, nothing was too much trouble.The club on the second floor is an oasis, lots of healthy food and the serving staff were charming and helpful. Could not fault it in any way, although  it is not cheap. Only very minimal street noise even with the windows open, but one does not come here for a quiet break.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
We stayed for five nights at the beginning of May and really enjoyed our stay.  We were in room 86/85 on the eight floor which was a great size and had a small room for dressing near the bathroom.  The room overlooked the front of the hotel which sadly did lead to many restless nights of being unable to sleep with the noise of the garbage trucks which commenced at approx 2am - 6am every morning.  We did get ear plugs from the reception (who did have selection of sleep aids available (but sadly, even with the help of sleeping tablets (provided by me!not reception...) it was no good but hey! not too worry - its New York!!
Location of this hotel is superb,  Two blocks from Central Park.  We walked everywhere and the sun shone on this wonderful city!
Staff were good, the gentlemen behind reception were friendlier than the female check in staff but all in all everyone was pleasant.
We didn't use the open bar at 5pm - 7pm much as we were out each evening but its a super idea.
Cleaning staff respected the 'Do Not Disturb' sign and the room was spotless each evening on return.
Fabulously located hotel, would return with better ear plugs and stronger sleeping tablet but loved our stay at Hotel Elysee!!

title: Could easily improve if it chooses to
text: First time guest. Stayed for a long weekend. Our room had 2 beds, facing the street. I believe on either the 2nd or 3rd floor—can't recall. While others have commented on street noise, that didn't bother us as we are used to the city.  The room is small but more than adequate for NYC. The decor is dated and worn. They offer a carb breakfast (good coffee) and ok wine/cheese in the evenings which we took advantage of a couple of nights. Me (in my 50s) and my son (in his 20s) were definitely the youngest guests there. There is ample room in their lounge and, with the older crowd, it was very quiet—almost too quiet actually as we felt we should whisper.  The attached Monkey Bar offers excellent cocktails (albeit pricey)—again older crowd. The employees working in their breakfast and lounge area were delightful. The location is within easy walking distance of MoMA, Central Park and the Theater District (albeit the weather was good while we were there).  The reason this hotel gives me reason to pause returning are: 2 doormen/3 people working the front desk and none of them were friendly or helpful. I had to ask for the internet password, ask for the MoMa passes which were included with the reservation, ask where their library/lounge was located and ask how to get to my room. I arrived at 3:10 pm, no-one was busy and was told my room was not ready.  That was annoying since check-in said 3 pm and I had been at airports since 4:30 am. I patiently waited in their empty lounge (after asking how to get there). No further contact until I called the front desk and was told my room had "engineering problems." I had to ask when those would be resolved and the answer was that they did not know but were working on it. Close to 4 pm, a gentleman came and said I was being changed to another room and hoped it was okay.  Since I didn't see the first room, I can't compare and I was so happy to get a room that we just stayed there, which was fine.  Around 5 pm, the manager came to the room with cookies, a bottle of wine and a nice smile to apologize for the inconvenience.  He was the 1st one to do so as the front desk had not.  The Elysee asks for full payment at booking, I realize that this is common amongst smaller hotels but, since it does that, maybe employees working the front desk don't think about smiling or being attentive to their guests. Saying "good morning"and not frowning when a guest asks you for a paper receipt would also be nice. There are better options for the price. And, usually there is something else going on behind the frowns.

title: Best place to stay in NYCity
text: The Elysee is like coming home whenever we are in NYCity. the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet but the best part is the large lounge area where they serve wine and cheese in the afternoon and an exceptional breakfast in the morning. We always feel welcome by the wonderful staff as well.

title: A Petite Jewel
text: I loved staying in this small, charming hotel.  As a white haired woman alone in New York, I felt perfectly safe in this hotel and in the neighborhood.  The people behind the desk in the lobby welcomed me warmly upon my return in the evening, and with cheer in the morning. I frequented  the 2nd floor lounge three times a day - breakfast, afternoon, and in the evening before bed for tea and cookies.   If I am fortunate enough to return to New York, I will certainly stay at the Elysee.  If you're bothered by street noise, do request a room at the back.

title: Fantastic Every Time!
text: My husband and I are never disappointed when we stay at Hotel Elysee in NYC.  It is the only hotel we use and are always so impressed with the attentiveness of the entire staff!  We feel very much at home when we stay at this gem!

title: TIMELESS AND WE LIKE IT THAT WAY
text: Been staying at the Elysee since he 70's.  It was comfortable and welcoming then and it remains that way.  Please don't change (although the rugs could probably use a shampoo.)  The Monkey Bar is wonderful and we've long ago decided to consider the lone, slow elevator charming.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text: The staff, location and amenities at Hotel Elysee are fabulous. It is warm, friendly, yet elegant. I have stayed at a number of properties in NYC and this is by far my favorite. I have never had an issue (though there have been few) that the management and staff have not addressed quickly and to my satisfaction. I love it.

title: Serendipity in The City
text:
Seeking last minute accommodations in Mid-Town we landed on this gem: Old World European elegance meets 1920's New York, including a clubby, speakeasy-type restaurant and bar.  The second floor library and lounge is nice plus; wishing the continental breakfast was amped up a notch, though there are plenty of great places in the neighborhood for breakfast.  

Will definitely keep this one the list!

title: Excellent location and service
text: I have stayed at Hotel Elysee about 11 times and it never disappoints! The service is great and you can't beat the central location. I love the breakfast and happy hour!  The rooms are a good size for Manhattan and very quiet for the area! Because I was a return guest, they brought us some brownies. Will definitely be back!

title: Nice hotel in good location, BUT . . .
text: The Elysee is a charming, well-located hotel.  We found the staff to be universally pleasant, from the front desk to the housekeepers. There are, however, basic features that one expects from any hotel in the 21st century that were missing from our room.  I don't know if other rooms are better.  There were very few electrical outlets in the room, so I had to crawl under the desk to find one (only one outlet) to charge my phone. There were two of us and we could not both charge our phones at the same time.  Forget about charging my laptop.  Please do not tell me I could have asked for an extension cord--I should not have to.  There was very little space in the bathroom to put one's cosmetics.  The shower had neither a non-slip surface nor a grab bar so was a safety hazard. The beds were rock hard and very bad for my friend, who has severe arthritis.  The hotel staff tried to remedy it with foam pads, but nothing helped.  The fact that they offer pads indicates that they know the beds are too hard.  As a result we are leaving a night early.  Our room rate was not cancellable so we are not only losing a day in New York but also losing the cost of the last night.

title: Nice hotel
text: This hotel is in a great part of Midtown--convenient to everything.  The staff are great and very helpful.  The décor is tired and needs refreshing.  The HVAC in our room was loud.  Overall a good experience.

title: Quiet, Comfortable Oasis in NYC!
text: The rooms are spacious compared to many NYC hotels.  Our room was classic, traditional and comfortable. We had two chairs and a sleeper sofa.  Our friend’s room also had a sunroom albeit no clear windows to see outside.  She loved it!  Everyone is very nice, helpful and professional.  Call room service, and the items or service are promptly delivered.  The cocktail hour was very welcome at the end of two days of running around in the rain!  A bellman found a cab for us after running through the rain around the block!  He went above and beyond!  After returning from evening entertainment, it’s nice to have a cup of coffee or tea and cookies in the lounge or taken to your room.  We liked the Casablanca and now also the Elysee.  The Library Collection is very good quality hotel provider!

title: A Touch of Paris in NYC
text: My son and I thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay at your beautiful hotel.  We appreciated that you were able to hold our luggage while we were out and about before our room was ready and that you were kind enough to call us when we could check in.  The room was very clean and beautifully decorated.  The beds were super comfy and the bed linens luxurious and ensured a great night's sleep.  The continental breakfast was really lovely with a nice variety of food...great coffee!  The staff we met during our stay were all very welcoming, professional and went out of their way to be accommodating.  Thanks to everyone who made our stay memorable.  We definitely will be back!

title: Superb hotel
text: Excellent location, superb friendly staff, quality comfort, great breakfast; did not check out the wine hour... Absolutely no negatives whatsoever. My 95 year old Mum was treated like a Queen, she was even given a birthday card and gift!!!

title: Great experience, would stay here again!
text: Staff was exceptionally attentive and helpful. Excellent quality and presentation of evening appetizers & wine along with morning breakfast foods. Rooms very nice and clean. Since this is an older boutique hotel, there is only one elevator. Need to allow extra waiting time for the elevator, particularly during breakfast and checkout hours!

title: A hotel you want to return to
text:
After having stayed at the Library Hotel on the two occasions, we decided to try the Elysee, which was as satisfactory. The location (54th Street between Madison and Park) is among the best you can hope for visiting Manhattan; stops for the subway’s green line are on Lexington at 51st & 59th Streets, which is not really far either way. The only disadvantage is that the departure of the LaGuardia shuttle is a few steps away from Grand Central Terminal, and this makes the Library Hotel more convenient if you choose this mode of transportation. On the other hand, a cab ride from the Elysee is just a few dollars more than the shuttle for two people.

The continental breakfast and the complimentary wine and cheese at the end of the day plus the availability of coffee, tea, and cookies anytime are very good reasons to choose a hotel from the Library Collection. Being able to sit down comfortably with tea and cookies when returning from a concert or the opera is a nice way to end a day in New York. Our room was very comfortable, though the air conditioning unit’s blower makes a noise that would be more appropriate in an industrial setting. I wish the hotel (all hotels) would install silent units. The card listing the hotel’s amenities mentioned that ear plugs were available, but I forgot to ask and ended up setting the unit so that it would not start too often. The rates are not modest but decent for such a hotel in Manhattan during the weekends, when business people are gone, but rise dramatically for weekdays. The free wifi is very efficient, with no nagging screen or registration before being online; only once in a while did pages take time loading. More space to put bottles, tubes, etc., in the bathroom would be appreciated, but it may be difficult to do more in such small spaces.

We cannot consider going to New York and stay elsewhere than in a Library Collection hotel. Though we might try the Casablanca next time, we would return to the Elysee anytime. As with cruise ships, staying in a boutique hotel with hardly more than one hundred rooms is so much nicer than in those gigantic hotels with lots of amenities but little personality.

title: Our choice for a hotel in New York City
text: We always stay at this hotel when we are in New York.  It's location and the staff are two of its strong suits.  The rooms are very nice but in certain cases the bathroom are small.  This time we ate in the Monkey Bar and the food was very good.

title: splendid place
text: The staff accommodated my every need and the king sized room amazed me (not an easy feat) I only wished I stayed longer. It will take more than one visit to fully understand the subway system and planning ahead is the best piece of advice I can give anyone visiting. It has been a pleasure.

title: Home away from home
text: I have been staying at Hotel Elysee for over 14 years.  I stay there because the location is perfect, the amenities are just right for me and the staff is pleasant and helpful.  And I always feel like a very welcomed guest.

title: Best boutique hotel in the Big Apple
text: This is the third time we've stayed at Hotel Elysee. My wife and I come to NYC frequently to visit our son and grandsons and in the past as an academic oncologist I've been invited on many occasions for consultations and lectures. As a result I've tested out more than a dozen hotels. It's like the story of the three bears. Some were too big, some were too small but this is just right. That also applies to value for money. The hotel is welcoming, the rooms are comfortable and the lounge is legendary for its hospitality and happy hour. It's adjacent Monkey bar is great and opposite is

title: Comfortable, friendly and great location
text: I frequently return to this quiet and cosy boutique hotel which is located in the centre of down town NYC. The staff are helpful and I thoroughly appreciate the breakfast/coffee room which is open all day and allows me to relax, snack, read and meet colleagues. I’ll be back again.

title: Same time next year
text: My husband and I spend a weekend in the city every year. We stay at Hotel Elysee. We love everything about it. The staff is friendly and efficient. The hotel is charming. We always meet people to talk to.

title: Just ok
text: The staff from the moment you walked in the door was excellent. So kind and courteous. The also had a nice little continental breakfast and had coffee and small snacks throughout the day on the second floor for all guests. The hotel itself needs a facelift. It was very dated and could use some new decoration to make it worth the price tag that comes with staying at this hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: The best service in NYC in a small hotel. The front desk made reservations for us and the breakfast is excellent. We had a king suite and were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. This was our second stay in four years and we will be back.

title: Nice visit
text:
Great hotel, service was excellent . The happy hours were very nice  as well as the breakfast. Alll around nice hotel. Excellent location. Helpful with directions and good dining.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Business visit
text: It is all about service...and the staff at Hotel Elysee excels. Love the cocktail hour as it seems a lot of guests do before  they head  out to the theater. Not many hotels in NY offer included breakfast.

title: Fine, not thrilling
text: Staff was nice, rooms are quite big and with a unique French atmosphere (design wise). Breakfast is very minimal and there are not enough seats anyway; only one elevator for a 15 Floor building...; I wouldn’t pay more than $300 per night there (inc taxes).

title: Why Stay Elsewhere in New York City
text: With only 100-plus rooms, in Midtown between Madison and Park, and a highly professional and friendly staff, and the well-known Monkey Bar Restaurant on the premises, and a normal complimentary breakfast served to guests in the Guest Lounge in the morning and wine and hors d’oeuvres in the late afternoon, there can be no better place to stay!

title: Quiet NYC Spot
text: Really a wonderful experience the minute you'll your car up to the front door. Rooms, service and general comfort on a relatively quiet NYC street. Everyone is friendly and experienced. the front desk personal is efficient with a sense of humor locked in behind a troop of monkeys. Breakfast is served in a gentile and peaceful room. Here also they don't seem to ever be tasseled and remain ever accommodating. This is a New York gem of a hotel. with direct access to the Monkey Bar and dining.

title: Lovely
text: The location is great. The building is charming. The club room on the 2nd floor is perfect respite from just being in your room. Whether it was continental breakfast, tea and cookies, or happy hour it was a great space. As is so often the case, it is the friendly and competent staff that gives it a high rating from us.

title: 8 days at Hotel Elysee NY
text:
Great staff and a very welcoming and relaxing environment
fortunately on two days, problems with the main elevator
and later 2 days where wifi reception on the upper floors not available
continental breakfasts and happy hour extremely well done
appreciated the wide choice re morning newspapers

title: Wonderful Experience
text:
My wife and I stayed at Elysee for few nights and we had nothing but the best experience.  From clean room to friendly staff to great location and best happy hour..   Just the Top 
We will definitely come again.  
Hotel is at prime location close to everything shopping, museums and entertainment.
My favorite part of the stay was how we were taken care of by the staff.   Someone really knows what they are doing st this place. 
Thanks .. see you again soon

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Everything was perfect-the location, the room, the food/beverages and best of all the wonderful staff who would do anything they could to make your stay relaxing, stress free and fun. Thank you everyone-my daughter and l appreciate everything you did for us.

title: Quiet and hospitable
text: Quiet and hospitable are not adjectives we could apply to previous hotel stays in NYC. Our room on the 14th floor was quiet, clean and comfortable.  The staff were always courteous, helpful and good-humored and the sitting room was cozy and attractive. Breakfast was good and evening drinks and canapes were fun.

title: My favorite place to stay
text: This was our 2nd stay at Hotel Elysee and we still love it.  The service here is amazing.  If you stay here you have to know that it is an older building with charm, so do not expect everything to be new.  It is a great location and we love the afternoon wine hour.  Room was fabulous - King Suite.

title: Our Fourteenth Visit
text:
Once again, we agree that the Hotel Elysse is our favorite place to stay in NYC. We always feel as though we are coming home and we are always treated like family, We know many of the staff and are always happy to see them again. Having stayed in almost every type of room, we have enjoyed them all. The rooms in front of the hotel are our favorites although they can be noisy early in the morning if you are on a lower floor, We've never really been bothered by the noise, just aware of it.
The included breakfasts are excellent with a good selection of fruits, pastries, coffees, teas, etc. Some times are more crowded than others, but we always find a comfortable spot to dine.
I don't think you can find a better location in the city. We already have booked rooms again in September.

title: Fabulous location, staff and hotel
text:
Just spent a week here and wanted to say thank you to the hotel staff for making us feeling welcome and going that extra mile for us on our anniversary. 

We had a corner room which was surprisingly spacious for the two of us, good wardrobe space and a good size bathroom. The room felt clean and the amenities of continental breakfast and happy hour on the second floor were a lovely touch. 

The decor is a little olde-world, but that adds to the charm. We did experience some inconvenience with the lifts when they were out of order, a couple of times, but there was a service lift as backup.

We spent a good amount of time walking around the city so some nights all we wanted to do was get a takeaway pizza and eat it in our room, which was something they could arrange and put on our bill no problem. We arranged for the love package and thought the roses (the most beautiful long stemmed red roses) champagne and chocolates were good value. The whole experience was seemless; from the pickup at the airport, check in, room delivery/service, happy hour and check out, nothing was a bother. Location was great, you can walk to Central Park, great bagel shop around the corner (Essa bagels) plus a short walk to the shopping areas and bars if you like that sort of thing. We packed in so much and wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

title: What a Great Hotel!
text: This was our 3rd time staying at the Hotel Elysee. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in New York. It's a charming old French style hotel. The rooms can be small, though the bathrooms have all been updated with gorgeous marble. The best part about the hotel was the Club Room. A large room with lots of sofas and chairs and low tables. They have coffee, tea, and cookies out all day. Plus a sumptuous Continental Breakfast (cereal, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, and more) and Happy Hour from 5-8pm. They have a great selection of cheeses, crudités, crackers, bread, nuts, and unlimited wine and prosecco. Plus cookies and fruit. We ended up having that as our dinner. Between the breakfasts and full happy hours, we spent maybe $50 on food for 3 of us over 3 days in New York City. Pretty unbelievable! Plus the hotel's location is great ... right around the corner from MOMA.

title: our one-night stay
text:
we came to enjoy an evening at the monkey bar (Tues), only to find out that it was closed for a private event- which no one on the hotel staff knew.
very surprised to find that you had only one (slow) elevator

title: Love this hotel!
