text: The hotel location, the staff and everything about the hotel is wonderful.  Love the breakfast room.  The cocktail hour in the evening before you head out to see a play, is a lovely touch.  We will stay here again in the future for sure!

title: This hotel suits us very well
text: This was our third stay (plus on stay at The Library near Grand Central Station). The reservations and front desk staff were spendidly friendly and helpful, as were all the other staff we encountered. This time, we had a room on the 14th floor with a terrace, which would have been wonderful to make use of had the weather been warmer! As with our previous stays, the room was a good size and confortably furnished.  I have only two minor gripes. One is that the shower controls need attention - just a matter of luck that we managed to find a setting which gave a decent flow of warm water. The other is that there aren't enough seats in the second floor area where breakfast is served.  Otherwise, all was good and we would stay again.

title: The Best Place To Stay!!
text: What a darling hotel!  Staff is so friendly and helpful, the community room is comfortable and fun to visit with other guests over breakfast in the morning and wine & cheese in the evening.  Well-located in midtown Manhattan.  Adjoins the Monkry Bar, which is also a fun place.  We stayed in a junior suite—it was very roomy and had a big bathroom.  Most of the people we met had stayed there before.

title: Best boutique in NYC
text:
I am hesitant to say what I feel as I do not want to find this spot unavailable for me.  Kind of like, do not recommend your electrician as he will become too busy.  I met my wife here fifteen years ago and whenever I am back in the city, it is my go too spot.  Not because of her but because of the hotel.
Just wonderful in every way.

title: Great time
text: We stayed two nights, our first trip to NYC. The hotel was great, the staff was great! We thoroughly enjoyed the wine and cheese hours, the breakfast and we also visited the hotel restaurant, The Monkey Bar for drinks. We would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone!

title: Another lovely stay
text: Always a pleasure to stay at Hotel Elysee. The staff are exceptionally nice and helpful, we are always treat so well. Rooms are nice and comfortable and we love the library for breakfast and drinks. Will always go back.

title: Great homey hotel in Midtown
text: Boutique, tranquil feeling despite being in the heart of Midtown. Service attitude and service performance are excellent. Rooms are  bright, clean, and comfortable. The hotel has been our go-to and remains so.

title: Library hotels are our favorite
text:
Great location great welcoming breakfast and wine and cheese hour. Even after shows enjoyed the Conceige room. Loved being close to Central Park shopping and Broadway 
Staff was welcoming and friendly.

title: Another great stay at Elysee
text: Great midtown location.  I was treated like an old friend when I arrived.  The hotel staff is amazing.  While this is an older hotel, it is very well kept and very comfortable.   The club room is a comfortable stop off before meetings and dinner with complementary continental break face and wine and hors d'oeuvres.

title: Home away from home.
text: We’ve been staying here for years and still love it although the place could use some sprucing up and new furniture. But the people are still terrific and the location is perfect for uptown museums and Broadway.

title: The best moments in New York!!
text: I was stay in this hotel for 2 night was really nice the hotel has hot shower and excellent breakfast. and good location high recommend. I would love to come bach again to this place  because It's really nice and we had a good memory and every body who working there It's every friendly.

title: Welcome
text: We had to postpone our trip three times and each time the staff was very understanding and helpful in securing the handicapped room we needed.  Staff members remembered our conversations and welcomed us warmly on arrival   One feels like a genuine guest.  Our names were remembered and each staff member was very attentive to our needs and very helpful.

title: A taste of Europe in Manhatten
text: Hotel Elysee was recommended by a colleague, and what a find. On 5th Avenue, easy walking distance to excellent food and shopping and sites. Quaint. Wonderful breakfasts, a wonderful dining area and library to relax with friends and extremely accommodating staffs. Worth consideration

title: Love the Elysee
text: I have stayed here 4 times and it never disappoints me.  The location is perfect for Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping and Times Square.  We really enjoy the large 2nd floor concierge room with it comfortable sofas and tables.  They have a great continental breakfast and a wonderful happy hour with wine and champagne each evening.  With 5 people in our group, that room saved us lots of money on drinks and appetizers!

title: New York Charm & Excellent Service
text: All the staff were superior and accommodating.  All was perfect. The second floor breakfast and afternoon happy hour were just the best and very full of deliciousness.   Although the hotel is old, and probably could use some renovation, it is stately, comfortable, sheets and towels were perfect and charm that doesn't happen very often. First time there and I would come back. Location is perfect too.

title: First time at The Hotel Elysee
text: Excellent small hotel, clean, good service, Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel in a good area and especially liked the complimentary continental breakfast and cocktails in early evening. The staff there at both times were very friendly and helpful.  I would say this is a very good friendly, casual hotel and wil definitely stay there again.

title: A hotel that never disappoints
text: This has become my 'go to' hotel in New York City. The central location is perfect for all kinds of activities, including theatre, restaurants & shopping. The staff is outstanding. And the complimentary continental buffet breakfast & generous happy hour are fabulous extras.

title: Elysian Fields on 54th Street
text: Every April I look forward to visiting NYC to celebrate my grandson's  birthday. This tradition includes dinner, a Broadway musical & an after-play drink. For the last few years, I've stayed at Hotel Elysee and it's been lovely. From our 2nd floor reunion with a glass of wine till the final final meeting for breakfast or a Monkey Bar toast, we've enjoyed how the special atmosphere and the courteous staff contribute to our annual celebration.  Here's hopping Elysee stays just as it is - - central, comforting, and first class!

title: Perfect in Every Way
text: From the moment I arrived I felt like I was at home. Attention to detail abounds. The staff is wonderful. I will never stay anywhere else in New York. The rooms are lovely and the linens are luxurious.

title: Perfect!!
text:
Loved our stay at this fantastic hotel. Great location, friendly staff and great room. 
This was our first trip to New York and we couldn’t have picked a better hotel. Would recommend to anyone looking for a genuine boutique style hotel in New York.
Loved the Monkey bar for end of evening cocktails!! Will definitely return one day...soon!

title: Jim & Louise 's overnight theater date
text:
The room was clean, the room was spacious .
The best thing about this hotel is that the employees are all courteous 
well trained and happy. the next best thing is the continental breakfast, it was excellent.
The happy hour with cookies was a bonus

title: Nice rooms but small
text: This hotel rooms are small but well decorated and clean. We were in the area for wedding and this was the closest hotel. Room was so small that we did not had any place for our large luggage. Staff are helpful and friendly,

title: The Best Hotel in NYC
text: The Hotel Elysee is consistently the best hotel I have ever stayed in.  The staff are wonderfully hospitable and helpful.  The rooms are comfortable, clean, and well appointed.  Daily breakfast and the evening wine reception are lovely.  This hotel is my NYC home.

title: Best hotel experience ever staff was very attentiv
text:
Began stayinga at this Famous hotel in 1962 and enjoyed the piano plzyer and lady singer act at the monkey bar ____this location pulls our all the stops to offer fantastic customer service ar all levels .
The cheese and wine evenings were very special,
Please consider bringing back a lady singer with the piano player in the Monkey Bar

title: Wonderful experience
text: Wonderful experience! The staff was so friendly and the room was a great combination of old New York with modern amenities. Complimentary breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese each night gave us time to socialize at the hotel. It’s also very close to a number of different tourist locations. We would absolutely stay there again next time we visit and would highly recommend it to anybody looking for a unique experience.

title: Great location in Manhatten
text: Friendly faces , very helpful . Love the size & history of building .Fresh flowers in lobby were noticed & appreciated . The daily breakfast buffet is great & satisfying, enjoyed the coffee drinks ! The 5 to 8 reception very nice , relaxing .

title: Another Perfect Stay
text: We have stayed at a number of hotels in NYC when we come to visit family and have finally decided to stop even looking beyond Hotel Elysee which we have enjoyed several times.  We love the comfort, the wonderful staff, the lounge, and the location.  Next trip Christmas.

title: Lovely stay
text: We first stayed at the Hotel Elysee 4 years ago and neither the hotel nor the hospitality has changed. Comfortable room, super helpful staff and loved the breakfast and wine reception. We definitely hope to be back!

title: Another perfect stay at the Elysee
text: I have been staying at the Elysee since my first visit in 1997, whenever I am in Manhattan.  It was the perfect Midtown hotel then, and it remains so.  There are very few things that one wishes would always stay the same — and the Elysee is one of those very few. Quiet old world elegance, combined with superb service (it is always a delight to see the same faces on each trip, and that says a lot about the hotel),  make it a peaceful retreat from the Midtown bustle, but only steps away from both Madison and Park.  Accept no substitutes.

title: Consistently fantastic
text: For the past 8 years we have only stayed in the Elyseé. The very friendly and helpful staff, who, by the way, seem to remain year after year, the amenities of a gorgeous breakfast and Happy Hour, the comfort of a lovely lounge/library with tea and coffee and cookies all day, make it a destination in itself! We have arrived with friends,or as many as seven  grandchildren, this hotel never disappoints!

title: Love the Elysee
text: My daughter and I enjoyed a lovely visit to NYC, and the Elysee was our home for four nights. I had been a guest several times before, but not much has changed. The location on 54th St is just about perfect.  I love the hotel.

title: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways !!!
text:
I came to New York for a sad reason: to attend a memorial for one of my closest friends, with whom I always stayed when I came to the city. So, I hadn't used a hotel for years. I went online and this place looked like the kind of place I wouldn't expect to find in the city: small, charming, including continental breakfast, wine and cheese at 5, and fresh fruit, cookies, tea and coffee available all hours, in their lovely club room. This is for ALL guests. You don't have to stay at a certain priced room.

So, my taxi pulled up and a lovely person opened the door of the taxi for me and took my bags. Another opened the door to the hotel and welcomed me. The lobby is small but pleasant. The front desk is populated with young, professional, warm, great people ! (Their parents should be proud of them !!)

I had asked for a quiet room. I went up and was immediately struck by the route to the inner part of my room after I got in the door. You know the long, continuous shot in Goodfellas where Ray Liotta and Lorraine Bracco are going through the kitchen to the front of the nightclub??? Well, I had this dramatic little winding hallway to get to my room, which was SO PRETTY, SO CHARMING! Not tiny, a perfect size. It was so tasteful , looked fresh. The bathroom was also great. There was plenty of storage and 2 bottles of water provided as needed, and a lovely chocolate bar with them.

The view was nonexistent, I faced walls and other big tanks or whatever they were, but it was QUIET, which was the most important thing to me.

They also have a lot of things that are available beyond a forgotten toothbrush: Sound machines to block noise, special pillows, eye masks, I mean it was crazy what they had ! I asked for a sound machine only because my room was right next to the elevator. Up it came and worked perfectly.

The staff could NOT have been better, from the front desk to bell persons, to the charming women that were responsible for the club room.

I felt seen and acknowledged and appreciated. When was the last time you felt that way about anything ?????!!!

I'm so grateful for the decision I made. The sadness of my trip was balanced by the happiness I felt every day I spent at the hotel.

title: Love this hotel !
text: I have  stayed in Hotel Elysee many times for the following reasons : great location , it is a small boutique hotel that is beautifully furnished with large rooms, complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour are held in a lovely sitting room, the staff is always excellent making sure that your experience is the best !

title: Fabulous
text: The people who work at this hotel make this hotel what it is-Fabulous. Every employee is eager to help, kind and  courteous. Everyone smiles all the time....best hotel in New York. I wouldn’t even consider a different hotel/property.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Travelled with my family for spring break. Wonderful stay at excellent hotel. The Elysee is centrally located with warm and welcoming staff. Included breakfast is rare in NYC.  Look forward to staying again soon. Highly recommend.

title: Hidden Gem in Midtown East
text: Beautiful luxury boutique hotel. Elegant and charming. Excellent service and a friendly staff. The access to the Club Room is another bonus. Fantastic location. Truly one of my favorite places. Excellent for business travel or staying with the family.

title: Wonderful little hotel
text: The hotel was wonderful. The front desk held our luggage as we arrived before our room was ready. They then recommended 2 wonderful places to eat lunch. The happy hour in the club room was relaxing and the servers were wonderful. The breakfast was substantial and again the servers were excellent. So friendly and helpful.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. We will definitely stay here again on our next NYC visit.

title: wonderful hotel, lovely staff, great location.... but the garbage truck noise on the street all night was unbearable
text: wonderful hotel, lovely staff, great location, the breakfast and club room were just lovely and I loved the old world feel of the bedrooms and bathrooms.... but the garbage truck noise on the street all night was unbearable.  We couldn't believe it went on all night long from 1am to 5am, and 6 days a week! We stayed on the 4th floor in the front - and while we've love to stay again, would definitely get a room in the back of the hotel or on a higher floor.

title: Great European Style Hotel.
text: My son and I stayed here for 6 days and loved it.  We would come back in a minute.  Also ran into two other families where were repeat ‘stayers’.  We all loved the same things quiet, clean, excellent service, feels more intimate, feels like a small hotel in Europe.  Good breakfast.  Wine and cheese in the afternoon and cookies and cocoa at night.  Seriously.... I’ll be back!

title: New York Meeting
text: Great room with great service.  Staff was excellent and help make the stay perfect.  Morning and Evening refreshments were a perfect touch.  Don't forget the fabulous Monkey bar for dinner or drinks.  Location is the best.

title: Great Hotel, great location
text: We stay at the Elysee every time we are in New York. The added perks like the breakfast included as well as snacks and wine are one of the reasons. The hotel is well located and the staff are friendly and very helpful. The only negative would be that we found the bed very hard. A mattress topper would really help.

title: If only I could leave a 10 star review!!
text:
We have stayed at the Elysee several times and thoroughly enjoyed it each time.   That's why we keep going back.  If you are not fond of the big hotels and/or chains and would like something with some character and impeccable service - look no further.  From the moment you arrive, you feel like you "belong".  Everyone greets you with a smile and nothing is too much to ask.  Each room is unique (no cookie cutter here) and actually they differ quite a bit.  If you call the hotel directly to make your reservation, let them know what appeals to you and they will be most willing to accomodate you.  Breakfast is included AND the happy hour which begins at 5PM (they serve wine, cheese & light snacks) is always a fun way to start the evening.

I cannot thank the staff at the Elysee for giving me the experience of the lifetime during our recent trip to NYC.  They totally blew me away with their kindness, generosity and compassion.  Thank you Hotel Elysee.  You are our NYC hotel forever!

title: Don't stay anywhere else in midtown!
text: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Elysee last weekend!   The room was very clean and comfortable.  Staff warm and helpful.  The breakfast is a huge hit - I was super impressed with the freshness of the buffet and the the staff service (toasting, cappucchino, etc.).  And of course, wine and cheese at the end of the day!

title: Nice short stay
text: Loved the room and esp that it had good lighting in the bathroom. Liked that it had real glasses and wine glasses and not paper.  Service was fantastic. The breakfast was very good and they would make latte to order for you.  The wine reception at night was especially nice with the food presented so nicely.  Front desk was helpful.  Doorman always pleasant.  Cleaning staff pleasant.  Rooms well appointed.  Towels nice and big.   The only down side was the noise at night .  We were in room 59 and the trash trucks went on and on.  Next time we will request a room in the back even though then you only look out on alley way.

title: New Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
My husband, 2 teenaged sons, and I stayed here for 3 nights during Spring break. We wanted to be close to the Theater District, but in an area that is a little quieter. 
When looking for a hotel, I was impressed by the excellent traveler reviews, especially with the reports of hospitality. I’ve lived in NYC and visited many times, but this is my new favorite place to stay. The Hotel Elysee exceeded my expections!
From the moment you pull up to the front door till the moment the staff help you load your car, everyone was genuinely nice and helpful. The manager checked on us and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. We felt like VIPs!
The rooms are classic, but have nice, modern bathrooms. And they are roomy, a rare find in NY. My husband and I could have easily shared 1 room with our boys, (but it was nice to have some privacy). The beds and furniture are comfortable and we had a large closet. There was plenty of room for our things. And we had a nice patio which we would have enjoyed if the weather had been better. If I had a kitchen, I could have lived here!
The continental breakfast was a big positive. It was great to roll out of bed to good coffee, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, good pastries, etc. Although it is buffet style, the staff will make you specialty coffee drinks and is attentive with clearing plates, etc. The only slight negative was that it is sometimes difficult to find seating for your whole group. My husband and I split up one morning and sat with a very pleasant and interesting couple from England. I enjoyed our conversation, so that worked out well. 
The happy hour was enjoyable and allowed us to have a snack before our shows, so we could have a late dinner.  
Even at this high level of service and with these perks, the room prices were about average and parking reasonably priced. 
In summary, this place was terrific! I just hope that it doesn’t get too popular, so we’ll be able to stay here again!

title: A Wonderful Boutique Hotel
text: My husband and I have stayed here many times, and each occasion has been memorable.  The staff is outstanding.  The complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine are a nice bonus.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  The location between Madison and Park Aves. is within pleasant walking distance of museums, fine restaurants, and great shopping; and easy access to public transportation to neighborhoods further away.  It is our go-to home away from home in NYC.

title: Snowbound at the Elysee
text: A nasty nor'easter last month added a night and two days to our stay here. There are worse fates. The Hotel Elysee has been a reliable luxury hotel experience for decades now. Delightfully, we were given a king room with an indoor terrace featuring wicker furniture and festooned with plants. The staff is as competent as they are unobtrusive, and the breakfast room is a delight, like having a morning snack in a 19th Century library. Fresh coffee available 24 hours a day. If you like staying in Midtown Manhattan, this quiet hotel is a winner.

title: A New York City classic
text: A gem in the middle of mid-town.  Read the history (Google it) of this gem before you arrive.  It will enhance your enjoyment of your stay and raise your awareness of the history and legends that are The Elysee.  And the Monkey Bar has a great history of it’s own.

title: Fabulous hotel with wonderful amenities and a staff that is unbeatable
text: We have stayed at the Hotel Elysee many times and always look forward to our next stay.  The staff makes you feel like family, the rooms are very cozy with a European flair. The breakfast and cocktails that are served on the mezzanine level makes your stay that much more pleasant.  All in all a very excellent and unique hotel

title: Babymoon at Elysee
text:
My husband and I spent a week at Hotel Elysee in March getting prepared for our baby to come.  It was our 7th visit to New York and by far the best accommodation we’ve been in.  I loved every aspect of the hotel.  
The reception was friendly and very helpful.  We arrived a little earlier than checkin from a long oversees flight and they managed to accommodate us.   They also helped with tips and recommendations.
The room was large for NY standards and cozy in French decor.  Water was complimentary and a bottle of wine was also waiting for us.  Super for husband that was able to enjoy it.. I had to watch.  
We had to ask for coffee maker.  If there is any room for improvement I would suggest getting new Coffe makers and leaving them in the rooms.  I would also suggest new larger tubs in the bathroom.  The current ones are shallow.  Room service was always around to make sure we were taken care of ❤️.
Complimentary Breakfast is simple but very well prepared and just enough to get you going for the day.  The girls at breakfast are suuuper friendly and helpful.  It was a joyful moment to have breakfast every morning.  The only issues is that seating is limited and it can get crowded.
There is coffee and cookies all day around.  Major bonus since their coffee is delicious.  
In the evening there is a happy hour with drinks and cheese.  Again, husband was very happy and was able to enjoy the complimentary wine.
To top it off, the hotel bar, the Monkey bar, is a great place to spend the evening.  
In sum! We were super happy with our choice and just found our new favorite place to stay in NY.

title: Great location, nights sleep and a haven in the city
text:
“Included” is the operating word here. Wifi, no charge.5-8 pm Bartended wine and cheese with Prosecco, red and white wines. Cocktail snacks-no charge.
Cookies tea and coffee always available - no charge.
Continental breakfast- no charge. Centrallismo location, extremely attentive and friendly charming doormen, cleaners, servers, and desk staff. Great bed and slept like a baby. 1 pm check out!! I love this place , oh and its reasonsbly priced for all of that!

title: Perfect in NYC
text: Hotel Elysee is a luxurious boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan. The location is perfect to explore Manhattan even by walk. My suite was fabulous with a rich and luxurious interior design and an amazing view from its own terrace. Nice basic breakfast with fresh fruits, cereals, coffee, juices and eggs. Returning to the hotel, it was always great to enjoy its signature wine and cheese offers in the afternoons, with a complimentary selection of cheese, vegetables and nice cookies. Friendly and helpful attitude of the staff.

title: A touch of Paris in Manhattan
text: What a lovely little hotel!  Reminiscent of charming boutique hotels in Europe, it's on a quiet street well situated for shopping, visiting museums or strolling in the park.  The staff members were warm and welcoming, from those at the door and front desk to the dispensers of the afternoon Prosecco, a delightful treat at the end of the day.  We also ate a delicious dinner in the hotel restaurant.  In fact, we would happily redo the whole experience and I hope it won't be long before we do!

title: NYC Hotel, none better!
text: Heart of New York, Great stay, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast and snacks, great room.  A lot of fun chatting with other travellers in the comfortable lounge, complete with coffee, tea, cookies etc. from morning til late night . Will certainly stay here next time we are in the city and all at a very reasonable price.

title: Homebase in Midtown
text: We have stayed at Elysee 14 nights during two trips to NYC. It is so peaceful in the midst of the city. Welcoming, lovely breakfast without blaring televisions. Just conversation and newspapers. Same during the evening wine and cheese reception. All complimentary with your stay. Will check out another Library Hotel next while in Midtown just to check out another area of Manhattan. You can’t go wrong with the attention to detail and hospitality of The Library Collection.

title: Live the Elysee
text: I have stayed here several times and just love the old world European flavor of the hotel.  The breakfast and wine and cheese make it extra special and I will be back soon.  Service is wonderful and it is a great place to stayl.

title: Great location and hospitality
text: Hotel Elysee is a boutique hotel in the midtown east area of Manhattan.  The location is perfect.  It is close to Central Park but not on it. Close to Times Square, but not on it.  Right in the heart of quality shopping and many of the best NYC attractions. I was able to comfortably walk or take a subway and walk to anyplace I wanted to go in Manhattan.  There are two different subway stops 2-3 blocks away.  My room was a good size for NYC and clean.  It faced 54th street and there was some street noise, but the hotel offers free earplugs, sound machines, fans and anything else you might need to help get a good night's sleep.  The continental breakfast was wonderful, with fresh fruit, fresh bakery items, cereal, coffee, juices, bagels, and eggs each morning. The happy hour was also great, and for several days I was actually able to skip dinner!  The happy hour had free wine, a selection of nice cheeses, crackers, fresh vegetables, bread and cookies. The front desk staff were attentive and helpful.  The doormen polite.  I had zero problems or complaints.  I wanted a hotel experience that was different than the big chain hotels, and this was it and did not disappoint.

title: Fine boutique hotel
text: Once again we have returned to this fine hotel. The location is great. The staff very friendly, outgoing, and helpful. The included breakfast and afternoon happy area are both bountiful and good quality. Overall a very warm and restful experience.

title: Another enjoyable stay!
text: After having a nice experience on an earlier trip to NYC I chose Hotel Elysee again. The location is very walkable to Grand Central Station and convenient to so many attractions and theatre district. The wine and cheese offerings at night, light breakfast in the morning and light refreshments throughout the day is so appreciated. I like bringing a cup of tea and some cookies up to my room in the evening. And all is complimentary!

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC
text: A soothing, charming refuge from the wonderful but hurried pace of New York.  Staff very friendly and accommodating, fabulous breakfast beautifully served.  The icing on the cake is that the hotel is a great value.

title: A Nice Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: We have stayed there many times.  Nothing fancy.  Just a comfortable, predictable landing spot in Midtown.  Decent room.  Decent breakfast.  Decent wine/cheese offering.  Good location.  Nice amenities.  I will stay there again.

title: Ottimo hotel in ottima posizione
text: Camere ampie con arredamento sufficientemente curato. Personale molto gentile e sollecito. Posizione molto buona. Pulizia più che ok. Prezzi sotto la media a parità di qualità e posizione. Consigliato.

title: A home like calm and warmth in the middle of the action.
text: Great location. Clean, elegant old world style. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was wonderful in all areas. I truly loved it! The doormen were efficient and friendly as were the front desk staff. The ladies assisting in the club room made us feel welcome and seemed happy to provide excellent service. Having such a quality restaurant as the Monkey Bar within the hotel was wonderful! I am happy to recommend this hotel.

title: my go-to NYC hotel
text:
After first visiting this hotel ten years ago I have returned close to a dozen times, it's always a welcoming, relaxing stay with old world charm.  The staff are consistently pleasant and helpful, and the rooms are lovely with top amenities. We always enjoy the complimentary continental breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening which add significantly to the stay's value. 
On this most recent visit I stayed in the Grand King Suite with my sisters, it was the size of an apartment with a large living room with pullout sofa, dining area and desk and a large king bedroom - so awesome, highly recommend.

title: A Gem of a Hotel
text: This was a real home away from home. The staff went out of their way to treat you like family. The room was very large and well appointed. The breakfast and happy hour were delightful. The Monkey Bar was very good and an added convenience. I am looking forward to my next stay at Hotel Elysee.

title: The Gem of the City
text: We have stayed here at least a dozen times and feel like it's our home in NYC. It's cozy friendly and well located. We have stayed in many different rooms and found them all fine.The afternoon wine and hearty breakfasts are delightful.

title: NYC  fun and relaxation!!!!
text: Staff were wonderful, friendly, and so helpful.  If there was a concern it was immediately dealt with and taken care of.  The breakfast was wonderful. The one recommendation I would have is if there could be more seating space in the breakfast area.  The bed was comfortable and provided a goodnight sleep.  The hotel is in a perfect location.  Walking distance to so many sites and locations.

title: Excellent location, wonderful atmosphere.
text: Beautiful boutique Hotel with a nice elegant vibe. Very well kept and exquisite style just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Times Square and a block away from 5th avenue. Staff is amazing throughout the hotel. Breakfast and the cheese and wine are absolutely and added commodity, will definitely stay here again.

title: Back to the old time :)
text:
As travel/lifestyle instagrammers, we really enjoyed staying there.
The room we had (Grand King Suite) are clean and really spacious compare to other hotels we’ve been to and this is for us really appreciated as we do have a lot of suitcases while traveling for our photo sessions.
The staff is really nice and the hotel is well located, close to every major sightseeing in NYC.
We loved the old French style furniture, it’s nicely decorated and not over done which brings the perfect atmosphere to the place.
We appreciated the professionalism of the staff and their great advices on where to go and what to do around.
We also enjoyed the complimentary drinks and snacks all day providing at the lounge area and it’s kind of their signature plus as it is also provided by all the Library Collection Hotels.
Unfortunately, our stay was short and we didn’t have time to enjoy the hotel facilities but we will on our next trip there as we will definitely choose this hotel again.

title: Rich
text: Great intimate luxury hotel in the 50’s. The staff is terrific waiting on you hand and foot. They also have a free continental breakfast and wine and cheese every evening. Next door to the hotel is The Monkey Bar restaurant which is a wonderful restaurant with America fare The restaurant dates back to the 30’s.

title: Awesome stay!
text:
This was our 3rd stay at Hotel Elysee and we will be back. It is fabulous from the location, to rooms and service!  The walk to Times Square is only about 12 blocks which is awesome. Our room was on the 11th floor with a great view of the street for people watching. Breakfast is delightful with fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, pastries and yummy bagels. Staff are on hand to toast bagels and deliver to your table. The evening social provides a snack of cheese and other delights before heading out for the evening. 
I can’t say enough about the doormen and front desk staff. They are informative and friendly. Our trips to NYC would not be the same without staying at Hotel Elysee!

title: small and splendid
text: best small hotel in NY. great staff and fine atmosphere . my wife and I have stayed there for many years now and always look forward to checking in. The manager keeps up very high quality of service from all staff

title: Many stays, always happy
text: Love the small size, professional and helpful staff, convenient midtown location, relaxing breakfast.  Great for a getaway.   Rooms are cosy but we like cosy.  We have stayed many times and always return.

title: Great Location - treats you well
text: Good stay at this property.  I would stay here again.  Felt very European.  High touch service.  Bathroom was well lit.  Room felt a bit old world and only 1 elevator for the whole place.  But the Club Room being available all day was fantastic.  Was able to work there and have a meeting.  The breakfast and HH was a great amenity.  I did use the workout facility that was off site - while it was close, I would rather have one in the building because our weather was cold.  Staff was very friendly and willing to help.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: The Elysee was as an absolute treat. A quaint and beautiful hotel in a superb location, close to everything and yet slightly removed from the hustle and bustle. Breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese reception in the early evening are complimentary and much appreciated. I will be back for sure!

title: Home away from home
text: We don't like staying anywhere else but Hotel Elysee. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location is ideal and away from all the craziness. The breakfast and evening happy hour make you feel like you are in your own home.

title: Good European style hotel at a good price
text: We were there for only one night.  The location is excellent.  The service was very good.  We appreciated the extensive breakfast included in the room rate.  The breakfast room was too small and one had to wit for seating.  Our room was comfortable but we had no heat.  This we discovered in the middle of the night so we bundled up and survived.  The reception staff was very apologetic.  I am certain that the problem would have been fixed promptly  We would definitely consider this hotel again.

title: Perfect Stay in NYC
text: I first stayed with Elysee in 2008 with my parents. I was in high school considering education up in the New Englandish area; however, I chose to go to Georgia. This past month, I came back with my girl friend and spent a night re-living what I remembered at an older age (happy hour thankfully, which I do recommend). We both had an excellent time. Our rooms were ready prior to the stated time and they even kept our baggage for a day out on Saturday for our next stay/adventure. I highly recommend the Elysee and their staff. If you have a request, they can do it. I recommend the Elysee to everyone I know venturing up the NYC, Brooklyn, Long Island, Jersey Area. Thanks!

title: A Great Hotel Stay
text: Everything about the Elysee is superlative, from the warm personal welcome, to the delicious breakfasts, to elevator rides with other guests who extoll the Elysee, to  responsive housekeeping,  to checking out with the resolve to return again.

title: Ten Stars
text: Staying here is like being with close friends who take care of your every wish. From the front desk to the lovely people in the club room, the most attentive staff you can imagine. The beds are extremely comfy, the rooms a good size and the buffet breakfast perfect. A charming, very European type hotel, I can’t wait to come back !

title: Elegant and classy
text: This is an amazing hotel. The service was outstanding. The room was a good size and very clean and comfortable. Each evening there is a n opportunity for guests to gather in the communal lounge for some cheese and nibbles. You can access the nearby sports club as part of your stay

title: 4 nätter
text:
Ett mysigt hotell med god service. Hotellet serverar frukost, kaffe och kaka under dagen samt vin och ost på eftermiddagen.
Det ligger bra till om man vill han nära till Central Park, Time Square, Empire State Building, Trump Tower m.m.

title: Nice and different hotel with a special touch
text:
We spent 6 days in New York and divided our stay between two hotels belonging to the " library collection".
We were very pleased by the different styles of these two hotels ( the giraffe and ELysee ) there are some similarities ( the breakfast and the wine and cheese at 5 PM) but there are some differences as well.
The giraffe is more modern and maybe the rooms are bigger and more convenient, the Elysee is much old - fashioned though there is some charm in it and we do appreciate old furniture, it is nevertheless smaller and it was difficult to store our toiletries for example in the bathroom because we did not have the room.
There was a large choice of teas and we really appreciated this as the days were a bit rainy and we were exhausted.
Maybe the improvement at the Elysee should concern the way the waitresses and the staff take into account the customers, I am not saying we were badly treated but the staff seems either to be shy or not spontaneous .
They do their jobs but they perhaps should be more responsive to what the customers want or anticipate; but on the whole ,we  were satisfied to find  such tiny hotels compared to big ones without any charm and cold.

title: Home-away-from-home in NYC
text:
Best location for enjoying the immensity of NYC. Go up or downtown easily.
Love breakfast and appreciate some hot tea & cookies before bed! 
Good sleep quality and lots of room to spread out.
Classic European decor is always a plus. We have stayed here many times and will continue to return. This was our only trip with a glitch on our room reservation but the staff did its best to reconcile the problem;  guests which were to check out of the suite we had paid in advance for decided to stay longer. I still cant wrap my head around people who do not understand the meaning of a reservation.....

title: Great Hotel Cholce
text: I love this hotel for many reasons: the location, comfortable rooms, nice breakfast and afternoon tea included, good concierge service and the Monkey Bar. The hotel is unpretentious and really nothing fancy but very welcoming and feels like home. We had a corner room on the 10th floor facing the street, which we liked but if street noise is an issue for you, perhaps request a room in the back. We plan to stay here again on our next NYC trip.

title: Charming and Quiet Place to Stay in Midtown
text: I can count the number of times I have been to Manhattan on my fingers.  The Hotel Elysee location was very convenient for me on this trip.  I was able to walk to Central Park, dinner and a Broadway show (off West 44th) and Bloomingdale's.  It took me 45 minutes by Uber at 3pm in the afternoon on a Thursday to get from Newark airport to the hotel (call it luck or timing as some folks said it would take 2 hours).  Front desk check-in was quick and the staff friendly. Dropped off my suitcase, went down to the 2nd floor to enjoy the wine and cheese "happy hour" offered by the hotel, got another Uber and 20 minutes later was sitting with my son (NYU law student) at a contemporary Korean restaurant in the East Village. I came back to the hotel and had a cup of tea and some cookies, also on the second floor.  I stayed in a suite and it was gigantic except for the bathroom which was a bit cramped but comfortable. I really enjoyed the small details like bottled water, a bar of Leonidas chocolate, hotel stationary and a card wishing me happy birthday.  The room feels and looks old European.  I was fine with it but some people prefer a more modern look and feel.  The television sets definitely need to be upgraded but wifi was perfect. During breakfast (cheerful staff and decent variety of food, coffee/tea, juice) I had a chance to see  guests staying at the hotel: majority were in their 40s, 50s, 60s, 70s.   If you are looking for a place to see and be seen, with a younger crowd, Hotel Elysee is not the place.  The front desk organized dinner reservations for a group of 6 at a local Italian restaurant, on a Saturday night and on short notice.  Very helpful and well done! Enjoyed a pastrami sandwich in Queens one day but traffic coming back to the hotel was horrible on a Sunday late afternoon (congestion getting on to the Williamsburg Bridge).  Overall,  I had a very good experience and think Hotel Elysee was great value for the money.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Elysee. It is a short walk from Grand Central Station. Conveniently located close to NY attractions and very good restaurants. It is like a little bit of Paris right in NYC! Great breakfast, beautifully appointed rooms. Would definitely stay here again!

title: An Oasis of Refinement and Pleasure
text:
This lovely European hotel may have been around a long time, but it far surpasses some of the newer glitzy hotels in the neighborhood. The room was comfortable with considerate touches, like one hair dryer attached to the wall plus an extra if you want to sit down.  
The free continental breakfast is excellent, as is the evening wine and cheese spread, complete with numerous wines, excellent cheeses, crudites and more.
The staff is professional without having an attitude. All this, and only two blocks from the shopping center of Fifth Avenue. This was a memorable stay, and I will return the next time I visit NYC.

title: Always relaxing
text: Our favorite hotel in NYC because of location, friendliness of staff, comfortable rooms, 24-hour supply of coffee and an excellent breakfast.  We enjoy the happy hour (with cheese and crackers) when having dinner after a show.

title: Nice hotel, BUT....
text:
On arrival the reception staff were very pleasant and check in was quick and easy.
The room we were given was on the 10th floor and the decoration and furniture all matched the aged and style of the hotel and the overall effect was great.
The room was large with a corridor to a nice bathroom. 
The hotel lounge on the 2nd floor provided a lovely breakfast in the morning, with fruit, cereal, various breads which the staff were happy to toast for you if requested. 
Also during the day coffee and fruit was available.
In the early evening the hotel lay on a really nice wine and cheese hour (or two).
It so nice to go down to the lounge for a couple of glasses of prosecco before an evening out.
The problem and it is the only problem with this hotel is trying to sleep at night.
The noise from the street was like sleeping on a building site with dust carts turning up every 1/2hr and every night about 2am think a giant bin full of bottles from a local bar or restaurant got emptied.
The other noise, which made sleeping impossible was the airconditioning fan that only operated on a really high speed fan, the noise was so bad it drowned out the dust carts.
We were using the a/c for heating and this was the only source of heat in the room. February in New York you do need heating but we decided to not bother at night and suffer the dust carts.
I did sleep reasonably well on the last night but I left the TV on and also it was Friday night/Saturday morning which may make a difference.
It's such a shame about the noise issues because I really enjoyed the hotel and if they sorted out the windows and a/c I would return without hesitation.

title: great
text: We enjoyed the Elysee very much. We always have a wonderful time and always feel like we are home when we arrive. The staff treats like family and the rooms and second floor relaxing area are the best. I would highly recommend the Elysee to all that ask.

title: Jewel Hotel in New York!
text: We love staying at the Hotel Elysee.  The rooms are lovely and extremely quiet.  The staff is wonderful. Breakfast, snack all day, and wine and cheese in the late afternoon are all included in the room rate.  And, the price is incredibly reasonable.  We won't stay anywhere else in New York!

title: Mid-Town Gem
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Elysee Hotel.  Great location, excellent staff and a comfortable, relaxed vibe that made our week in NYC very pleasant.  Our room had enough room, lots of storage, great bed and good wifi.  Our unexpected overlap with restaurant week made for very reasonably priced dinners out, when combined with the half priced hotel room made for a surprisingly affordable NYC experience.  We will be back to the Elysee in the future!!

title: My only place to stay in NYC
text: We love this place!  Will not stay anywhere else!  Love the wonderful staff, the club room atmosphere and snacks and the beautiful rooms!  If you like boutique hotels with personal attention then this is the one!

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This lovely hotel is a gem.  We had a quiet room on the back side away from any street noise.  The complimentary breakfast and evening wine & cheese made this a good value.  The lounge was a comfortable place to read and visit on a chill, rainy February weekend.  Every staff member we encountered was polite, friendly and helpful.  The location was very convenient for walking to the MoMA, train, and even Broadway. We also enjoyed Bill's piano bar across the steet for a night cap

title: Warm wonderful hospitality
text: We were very pleased with this hotel! Instead of putting their money into modernizing bathrooms (the bathrooms are very nice, just not super modern!), they invested in hospitality! All day they have an open club room with good food, pleasant furnishings and snacks. At breakfast and supper, they have a nice European style breakfast, and good appetizers that the guests can have instead of supper. And the staff is extremely friendly and helpful!

title: Another great stay!
text: Love this hotel.  Great price and location with a nice breakfast and cocktail hour included. Only suggestion would be to request a room toward the back or ask for earplugs from the front desk to cancel out street noise.

title: Friendly, old world charm.
text: Great location. Very friendly. I loved the old world charm of this hotel. The service was excellent. It was great value as breakfast was included. The room was spacious and comfortable. My only criticism might be that the décor was just a little dated but in some way it added to the old world charm. I would have no hesitation staying here again.

title: Reliably excellent in all regards.
text: Very friendly staff throughout. Walkable to mid and up town museums, theatre, restaurants, shopping, etc. We rarely call a cab for day or night outings and that's a big relief! We are very enthusiastic about the second floor offerings of breakfast, snacks throughout the day, wine and cheeses at afternoon and coffee and cookies at night. We have stayed here twice a year for 3-5 days for the past 5-6 years! Wonderful, feels like home!

title: A frequent visitors perspective
text: Lovely hotel, friendly staff, the biggest negative is the poor mattress quality...it would be wise to upgrade to higher quality tempurpedic type beds. There should be pillow options and perhsps a Keurig style coffee machine for early am coffee

title: Exceeded all expectations
text:
I have stayed several times at Hotel Elysee and always been impressed with the friendly staff, great location, plentiful breakfast and happy hour. I always stay in a king room street side and find it extremely comfortable. The hotel staff are fantastic and nothing is too much trouble for them. 

I want to particularly mention Gustavo who is extremely courteous and professional. I left the hotel yesterday and was getting the subway to the airport from 53rd and Lexington. I had just got into the subway when I saw Gustavo waving at me, I had left my handbag on the floor of the hotel and he had raced down to the subway to get it to me. Apart from everything else, it had my passport in it. I was so focussed on navigating the subway with a large suitcase and a smaller carry on case that I had completely missed my handbag. I was so grateful and can't thank Gustavo enough. 

I am already planning my next visit to Hotel Elysee, a Christmas in New York holiday with my partner. I am looking forward to it already. Thank you again for all your efforts to make people feel like Hotel Elysee is a home away from home.

title: Charming hotel, excellent service, great location!
text: The service at this elegant, boutique-style hotel was excellent from the moment we arrived until the moment we checked-out. Wonderful staff, charming guestrooms and an added bonus of complimentary breakfast + wine & cheese in the evening. Great location as well! I would definitely stay here again.

title: Th best of the best
text:
We have stayed at this wonderful boutique hotel many times
It’s where we celebrate our birthdays, anniversaries and just a weekend away in the city
We are always greeted at the front desk staff by Jason, Justin, Greg Helena and Steven
All of them always make us feel welcome as we were old friends,  Their commitment to making our stay even more enjoyable show in their thoughtful and caring ways
Our special thank you goes to Cheryl Golde who has always made each visit a celebration of love
Her professional, knowledgeable and thoughtfulness adds in everyway and shows how
are treated and welcomed
The hotel is situated in the heart of the city close to Central Park, Theatre, opera and ballets
or just walk around the city
The hotel offers free continental breakfast and in the evenings  fine wine, cheese and hors d’oeuvres
Cookies, coffee: teas and fresh fruit are also available all day every day
There is no other hotel my husband and I would stay while in New York City
Thank you for always making our visits such wonderful memories
Arthur and Terry Ott

title: Has that old city luxury feel -- loved it!!
text:
This hotel was a random find on my part. I had a good amount of points on my credit card and it was located near my friend's apartment -- we were going out that night to see some live music. 

It is quaint, luxurious, classy, and had great service. My only complaint is that the rooms are outdated for sure. They could use some loving.

There was a lot that came with the room but the international breakfast was notable. Nothing too crazy but provided a warm and welcoming environment. 

We also had a free wine tasting during happy hour. Would love to come back to this hotel or another owned by the same management. Highly recommend checking it out!

title: A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Manhattan
text: I went there with my niece for a "girlfriend getaway." The staff was so accommodating. The room was lovely and clean. Continental breakfast and wine & cheese came as an amenity. Such value for the money. And convenient to everything. I loved that it was a small hotel. if I could do more than 5 stars, I would. - Caroline

title: Classy hotel in excellent location
text: Spent four nights here in February for a theatre and museum weekend. Even with below freezing weather we were able to walk most everywhere. Rooms were comfortable--bed was especially nice. The continental breakfast was in a lovely room with generous choice of daily newspapers. Food choices were limited but more than adequate. Coffee, tea and cookies available all day, and wine and appetizers every evening. The Monkey Bar was very lively with good food options. Even on the 15th floor, the street noise was noticeable, but that is New York. We talked to a couple of people who were actually staying in the hotel for 3 and 4 weeks and I could easily see why.

title: Lovely welcoming hotel in heart of Manhattan
text: As always we had a delightful stay in our favorite hotel in New York. From arrival, when they helped us with our car, parking next door at a very reasonable rate, to dinner in the superb Monkey Bar, a lovely room, turn down service, buffet breakfast in their lounge with sofas we could snuggle into with our croissants and the Sunday papers, right through to a generous 1 pm checkout and again help with our car, it was a pleasure. Until next time!

title: A Favorite
text: Classic hotel. Great location. Close to theater district and Lincoln Center. Courteous and helpful staff. We love staying here.  I love that they give you a real hairdryer!!  Love the continental breakfast and wine and cheese reception!

title: Good Service. Rooms are hit or miss
text: The first time I stayed at this hotel, I was "upgraded" to their nicest suite. Very impressive. Every time after that, I have gotten a small room on the back of the hotel with no view on a low floor. So, rooms are average at best. Service is terrific and location is good.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: Past trips to NY I have stayed in some of the larger hotel chains (expensive, bland, tiny rooms) and even tried an AirB&B (don't even get me started on that disaster!). So what a delightful surprise I had checking into Hotel Elysee!  The staff at Elysee is so friendly and goes above & beyond to assist you and make your stay pleasant.  The hotel is a very inviting boutique hotel with an old world charm.  I enjoyed perusing the paintings on the walls and learning a bit of the history of the hotel. My room (54) was on a corner and extremely spacious and comfortable with a king bed, a separate dressing room with a chest of drawers and closet, and the bathroom.  The rates are very reasonable considering they include continental breakfast, evening snacks and wine, WiFi and no resort fee that some hotels like to tack on. I had dinner one evening in the lively Monkey Bar which was delicious!  I am planning a trip to NY in June and am looking forward to returning to Hotel Elysee!

title: Excellent
text: Cozy, intimate - old world charm...the level of service was top notch as they helped my wife load the car after getting it out of the garage. A little noisy with construction across the street but that will stop at one point.

title: Our favorite boutique
text:
We don't get back to New York as frequently as we would like, but one of our incentives is Elysee.  The ambiance, the staff, the location and all the great perks (did I mention the Monkey Bar?) make it the perfect place to start and end your day in the City.
I have already recommended to friends and strangers since returning.

title: Fantastic as always
text: The Elysee has all the charm of a European hotel. Love the second floor salon for breakfast and tea.The staff is amazingly attentive and friendly. It is also superbly located in midtown east. We consider this our home base whenever we visit New York.

title: Always extraordinary!
text: We have stayed at the Elysee for 25 years and never been disappointed. The staff is gracious and accomadating and nothing beats the free nightly happy hour and breakfasts on the second floor.  It’s a true gem in Manhattan!

title: A Rich History
text: The Hotel Elysee is a wonderful hotel located in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Clean, modern efficient while retaining a quaint charm missing in most contemporary hotels. The hotel's rich history is reinforced with the Monkey Bar and restaurant located off the hotel lobby, Be sure to visit both and inquire about the history. A story worth discovering. I've visited several times and do not hesitate to recommend.

title: The Perfect Place to Curl Up With a Good Book
text: This my second visit to Hotel Elysee. Both of my trips to NYC have been centered around intense work on a novel. The setting is calm and comfortable. The staff are friendly, professional and very helpful. Knowing that Tennessee Williams walked these hallways adds so much to the history of the hotel. The Monkey Bar serves up savory meals and treats, while the breakfast room is always welcoming. Hotel Elysee is a wonderful respite from busy city streets as well as being an ideal setting to focus on the work at hand.

title: NYC favorite
text: If I am traveling to NYC I’m staying at Hotel Elysee.  Always.  Love the size, location, comfort, management, and club lounge amenities    A good value    I have stayed there four times.   It’s a short walk to numerous good restaurants, some just across the street .  And then there is the famous Monkey Bar on premises.  You can’t go wrong staying here

title: 建物は古いが
text: 建物は古くて、明け方スチームの配管が鳴ってうるさかったのですが、スタッフは親切ですし、トランプタワーまで徒歩5分のロケーション抜群です。また2階では朝7時から10時までパン、ジュース、コーヒー、ティー、フルーツ、ゆで卵などの朝食が、夕方５時から8時まではちょっとしたつまみをアルコール類が無料で頂けます。ちなみにコーヒーは四六時中用意されてます。窓から隣のビルが見える裏のスイートルームは56平方メートルと広くてソファーベッドを利用すれば親子4人はokです。ミニキッチンの部屋も付いていて流し台、冷蔵庫、電子レンジがあり、居間には広いテーブルがあるので、自炊も可能です。

title: A gem in Midtown.
text: I hate to risk funding this hotel booked next trip to NYC, but this hotel is really special.  We have visited over 10 times, and I note that many of the guests on every trip are repeaters.  A large lounge/salon offers complimentary breakfast and tea or wine in the afternoon.  The theme is books, and there is a large borrowing selection.  The rooms are big enough, well furinishrf and updated, and the staff couldn’t be more friendly.  And, 54th bet Madison and Park couldn’t be a better location.

title: Hotel Elysee means hospitality!
text: We have stayed at the Elysee five times in the past year. It is a very nice hotel. The staff are warm and welcoming and seem to like their job and their guests. The rooms have always been clean and nice and we are grateful for the occasional upgrade and the F&F pricing. The happy hour is very congenial and ample. The breakfast is simple but satisfactory. The lounge area is a wonderful place for sitting and reading, or engaging with the guests from all over the U.S. and the world. Finally, the location is perfect for accessing most areas of New York via foot or subway from the 51st. Street Station. Oh, and at $30 per night, the parking is a very fine deal as well. Five ***** for the Elysee, and thanks!

title: Delightful Charming Hotel, delicious restaurant
text: We loved our stay at the Hotel Elysee.  This small, charming hotel is perfectly located in mid-town making it easy to reach our museum and broadway and shopping destinations.  We enjoyed delicious dinners at the Monkey Bar, an old school dining room with contemporary food. Our well-priced room was spacious.  The customer service is amazing, we enjoyed the very attentive, genuinely helpful staff in the dining room, breakfast room, at the desk and in our room care.  Reasonable parking rates, we drove from Baltimore.  Delightful, an antidote to cold, digital contemporary hotels.

title: Another annual treat at Hotel Elysee
text: My daughter and I celebrated her birthday at Hotel Elysee as we have done each year since 2012. It is the perfect small European boutique hotel. The midtown location is near museums and restaurants which we go to. We are so pleased with all facets of the hotel. Our room had two queen beds and was quite spacious. Manager John Avina has a wonderful staff. We enjoy the intimate library where we have complimentary breakfast and wine with appetizers in the evening. We always meet interesting people as well. We look forward to next year.

title: Quality and Dependability
text: This was our second time staying at Hotel Elysee and it did not disappoint.  The staff are professional and friendly and the rooms are comfortable, clean and have a lot of character.  We absolutely love the included breakfast and cocktail hour.  The location is superb.  All in all this is extremely good value for NYC.  Truly a boutique hotel that delivers what it promises.

title: Hotel is a winner
text: The hotel is charming. The rooms are quite cozy and clean. The bed pillows and blankets were very fluffy and I wish I could have taken them home.  The staff was extremely polite and helpful. This hotel is a winner.

title: Great location, but you pay a price when you pre-pay for a room: No leverage.
text:
Nice enough hotel, if it weren’t for the rooms and noise. Location is awesome on 54th between Madison and Park. Ideal for virtually everything midtown. Except sleep before midnight.

I pre-paid for the room through Trip-Advisor and Agoda;  checked in at around 3:30 PM. At that time the very nice and pleasant hotel clerk checked me in and gave me a room on the THIRD floor. I asked for a room on a higher floor. “Sorry, we’re sold out; that is the only room available.” I went to the room, opened the door and found THE DARKEST HOTEL ROOM I’VE EVER SEEN. Mind you, this was mid-day and the window shades were open. I stumbled around and found the lights, and managed to get them on. The room itself is fine, if dated a bit, just dark during the day without the lights turned on.

Then I heard the street noise. I figured that it would subside by evening, and went downstairs to go to a mid-town meeting. That was about 4PM and I saw about four parties checking in...wonder if they got the third floor too? 

After a business dinner, I went to the Monkey Bar, inside the hotel. Very nice — great dessert, and great piano music that sounded like the soundtrack for a Woody Allen movie. Got back to my room around 11 and it was pretty quiet. Very, very comfortable bed. My room was next to a stairway, and noise from the stairs and from the street was easily heard.

Bathroom small but usable...great water pressure. They could do better by installing a shelf for toiletries.  Housekeeping did a great job...in and out of the room very quickly and efficiently.

The breakfast served in the hotel is very nice for a continental breakfast and includes all NY newspapers, rolls, coffee, fruit, etc. Served in a perfectly lovely room on the second floor. 

Besides meetings today outside of the hotel, I worked in the room and the street noise wasn’t terrible. Went to dinner, came back and demolition was going on at the building on the other side of 54th street, resulting in ongoing LOUD noise from a trash truck processing the refuse. Doorman advises that it goes until approximately midnight. OUCH! I have a 6AM train. 

Front desk was very nice and offered ear plugs. The demolition isn’t their fault...however, they gave me the noisiest room in the hotel because they could. Lesson learned...when you pre-pay, you’ve got no leverage. Had I not pre-paid, and they had only offered me the third floor, I would have walked. I may give the Elysee a chance again, but not before getting assurance about room location. I wish I could record the noise I’m currently hearing to share...you’d understand much better.

Again, very nice staff. Awesome location. Good breakfast. Comfortable bed. Just wish they I hadn’t drawn the short straw on room selection...aided by my prepayment!

title: Primeira opção em ny
text: Hotel de extremo bom gosto e excelente atendimento. Localização ótima. Café da manhã não é extraordinário, mas cumpre sua função. Problema que só há um elevador e se o hotel estiver cheio, pode demorar um pouco. Além disso tudo, está colado ao the monkey bar, um restaurante com história e que vale a pena visitar.

title: Elegant atmosphere; superior customer service
text:
Our stay was beyond our expectation.  It has the ambience and charm of European hotels. The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of space. 
The staff is genuinely helpful. Will surely return next time!

title: Fantastic Value and Location!
text:
We stumbled upon this little gem on our last visit to NYC and put it on top of our list for our next visit, we weren't disappointed.  

It should be noted that this is a boutique hotel, with heaps of European charm.  While we didn't partake of the perks including free continental breakfast and gracious happy hour our fellow guest constantly raved about the services provided by the hotel.

What I can say is the rooms are charming and well appointed.  Although the bathroom was on the small side it was very similar to the size you'd encounter in a European hotel.  As for location you're very close to the subway and an easy walk to many popular locations.  

Probably our favourite aspect of the hotel is Monkey Bar and the accompanying restaurant, this is what first attracted us to this hotel and will keep us coming back.

title: Hospitality at its Finest
text: My long weekend trip was to include my daughter and two grandsons—they got snowed in at their airport.  Elysee staff were very understanding and accommodating.  The breakfast is excellent—the lounge area warm and inviting on a cold winter weekend.  The beds are very comfortable, as well as the entire room.  Will definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

title: Fabulous
text:
Put this hotel on your bucket list. It's quaint with lots of ambience. Try the Monkey Bar for dinner or drinks.
The breakfast is to die for. European flair with free passes to a nearby sports club. In a great part of the City. You can stroll to Bloomingdales.

title: Never fails to please
text: My husband and I always enjoy staying at the Elysee when we are in New York.  It is a small boutique hotel with a wonderful location on 54th and Madison.  Each room is different and feels as though you are staying in a friend's home.  During the week wine and cheese are served on the second floor.  There is a great continental breakfast served every morning as well as tea and fruit available all day long.  The staff is very friendly and always go out of their way to make your visit more comfortable.

title: Excellent boutique hotel in wonderful location
text: The hotel is well located in mid-town near the theater, shopping and  businesses.  The staff is very accommodating, can provide good restaurant ideas and is very professional.  I recommend you stay here if location and budget are considerations

title: Excellent hotel couldn’t have asked for a nicer hotel and services we had.
text: Excellent hotel spent one week at this hotel and couldn’t fault it one bit. Would highly recommend and the location is excellent. The chease and wine was wounderfull to relax at the evening after sightseeing in new york

title: My second home
text: From the moment you arrive you know you are a welcome guest! The morning breakfast and evening treats are a real plus. John does a great job of making the Elysee and wonderful place to stay. I look forward to my return.

title: We’ve been coming here for 20 years
text: We love this hotel.  The location, the rooms, the bathrooms, the staff, the monkey bar, all lovely and welcoming.  It’s not glitzy, but it’s completely dependable and comfortable.  Included are nice breakfasts and tea time wines and snacks.

title: The place to stay in Midtown Manhattan
text: Hotel Elysée offers a convenient location and the ambience of a small, well-run hotel. The staff seem highly motivated to offer friendly service to the guests. The morning continental breakfast with plenty of fruit is matched by the late afternoon wine-and-cheese offering, to make one feel at home. The hotel rooms are attractively furnished and everything works. While I am sure the establishment welcomes families, I see relatively few children here. The clientele is also international, with several languages heard.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
This was my first time staying at Hotel Elysee and I would stay again.
The location, close by to MOMA is perfect. it was an easy walk to The Metropolitan Museum.
I was in NYC this past weekend when it was very cold and windy outside.
I loved that I didn’t have to go outside for breakfast (continental breakfast provided). 
I had a late lunch on Sunday and wasn’t hungry for a big di Nner. The 5-8 pm snack offerings did the trick for the evening. 
The staff was very helpful.
My room was exceptional.
I generally come to NYC 1-2times a year and often stay near Times Square because of the theater district. Hotel Elysee is also very accessible to Broadway. (I did see a play during my stay)

title: a bargain in Manhattan
text: A very well located hotel with character and charm.  The lounge with a good nourishing breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese, and other snacks. in the afternoon distinguish the Elysee from other hotels.

title: Elysee an oasis in Manhattan
text: As always, we had a wonderful stay at the Elysee.  The staff treats everyone with great care and consideration.   It’s quiet, elegant, a home away from home.  There are many amenities, including breakfast and wine and cheese in the evenings.  We would never think of staying anywhere else when we visit NYC.

title: Great Again
text: My wife and I visit NYC annually and always stay at the Élysées because it is so friendly, well-run and maintained.  It was great this time as usual.  We also love the evening drinks and snacks as well as breakfast.  The staff are so eager to be helpful.

title: Always wonderful
text: The hotel is lovely, small, traditional and we love it. The staff is fantastic from the front desk to the doormen and the people working at breakfast. The room was comfortable, clean and had everything we needed. We wil most definitely return.

title: Always Excellent!
text: Terrific, small, European-style hotel.  Wonderful staff, always helpful.  Lovely breakfast/happy hour rooms.  Love staying here each time in New York.  Conveniently located with easy access both Uptown and Downtown, and of course, Midtown!

title: Great hotel starting to look run down.
text: We love the Elysee, been staying there for years. Will stay there again. Love the place, love the people. But the place needs to be spruced up. The second floor lounge could use new furniture and carpet.

title: Wouldn’t stay anywhere else
text: I love this hotel and have been coming for a number of years.  All about it is great...the graciousness and welcome of staff, the lounge, the books left in the lounge, the breakfast and happy hour, the size of the hotel, the location, the other guests.  One VERY MINOR criticism is that the peer is on,y one elevator and it is slow. but that is not a concern and makes no difference.

title: best kept secret in new york
text: love staying at elysee when in new york...would not consider staying anywhere else.perfect location,wonderful staff,great rooms and amenities. hats off to the owners. i would rate it ten stars if i could.

title: elegant and cozy
text: beautiful amaryllis bouquets in the lobby were a welcome sight in midwinter. Great location.   excellent service at front desk. lovely breakfasts and wine and cheese hours with friendly staff.  comfortable rooms with elegant décor.

title: Perfect Location in the City
text: My room was very nice, clean and comfortable and the staff was very attentive.  They offer a cocktail hour with wine and cheese, and breakfast each day.  The Club Room has coffee, tea and cookies all the time.

title: Perfect location; all great
text: Lovely boutique hotel in mid-town. Perfect for a visit to NYC. We especially loved the Club Room with buffet breakfast and wine/appetizers in early evening. Staff was A+ and we loved the bedding too. would highly recommend.

title: Location, style, value
text: Super midtown east location. Wonderful friendly staff. Rooms are small (it’s Manhattan) but comfortable and well laid out. I especially like the entry area with closet and desk, separated from the main guest room. The furnishings and style of the hotel are classic and traditional — appealing to a clientele of a certain age, people with expectations and standards. The second floor Club Room, which is furnished like a comfortable living room on a country estate, fills with guests from around the world for a buffet continental breakfast in the morning and for wine and hors d’oeuvres in the evening. Couples, families (with well-behaved children), business people, mother-daughter travelers, quiet conversation, Sirius Symphony Hall playing in the background. It’s all very civilized. We shared a table with an Italian IT professional with whom we spoke about world affairs, New York attractions, and comparative politics.

title: Terrific as always
text: Our favorite NYC hotel! We will be back! Great room, love the second floor common space for happy hour, breakfast, or just relaxing in during the day. And the staff is so friendly and helpful. Great location.

title: The Best Place to Survive a Blizzard
text: Ii spent 4 nights in this hotel the first week in January in freezing temperatures and a blizzard.  There were two days when I never left the hotel and i cant imagine a better place to be stranded!  My room on the 5th floor was very spacious, the breakfasts every morning delicious and the cheeses, wine and snacks at happy hour were substantial enough for a dinner.  It is a delightful place and I recommend it highly.

title: What a brilliant hotel
text: From its perfect location in mid Manhattan to the comfortable rooms, to the great service this is a hotel I have no hesitation in recommending - and breakfast is included. The staff are really helpful, I would call this a 'grown-up' hotel, it's not super trendy, there are plenty of those in NYC, but if you want a sophisticated, warm and welcoming hotel this is the one you might want to check out.

title: Fantastic location in NYC
text: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Elysee.  The location could not be beat.  Easy walking distance to shopping, great restaurants, Broadway, and Central Park.  The rooms were very spacious and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The hotel has character and charm.  The happy hour was a nice added bonus.

title: Simply the best....
text:
In January 2013 my wife and I stayed at Hotel Elysee for five nights (the link to my review from that stay is below)
https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d93340-r150247266-Hotel_Elysee_by_Library_Hotel_Collection-New_York_City_New_York.html

So impressed were we with Hotel Elysee in 2013 that when we decided to fulfil a "bucket list" wish and spend Christmas / New Year in NYC in 2017 with our two adult daughters, we had no hesitation in booking Hotel Elysee. I am happy to say the hotel completely met our expectations again. 

We were assigned side-by-side rooms on the quiet side of level 12. My wife and I had a room with large queen sized bed and sofa, and our daughters shared a larger sized room with two king single beds. 

The hotel is only served by one lift for guests and we often experienced lengthy waits for the lift (by lengthy, I am talking 2 - 3 minutes maximum!). This was the only 'complaint'.

What continues to set Hotel Elysee (and other Library collection hotels) apart from the rest is that generous breakfast is included in the room price, as are Hors d'oeuvres (wine, champagne, cheese, crackers, pretzels and vegetable crudités) from 5.00pm to 8.00pm. We made it a ritual to meet up on level 2 most nights for drinks and canapés, before heading off to dinner. 

Staff at Hotel Elysee were always friendly and obliging. On a few occasions we sought assistance in securing restaurant bookings and the staff were only too willing to assist.

As my wife and I discovered five years ago, after a long day exploring NYC it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel at night. 

Across the road from Hotel Elysee are three restaurants. We ate at two - Bills, and Cellini. On New year's eve we booked a table at the hotel's own iconic restaurant, the Monkey Bar. For those who may be interested, I discovered the Monkey Bar has featured in two TV shows, Sex in the City and Mad Men.

title: My place at NY
text:
honestly I do not know if the last time I have been there was March or April. But I fo very often to this place and it occurred to me (while waiting for this terrible Latam flight four hours delayed) that I had never evaluated it to TA. In fact, this is my favorite place to stay when I am at NY for business. Sometimes it can be very expensive, as Manhattan is always unpredictable. The place makes me feel at home. When I arrive early from meetings, around 6pm, they always have cheese and wine at the lounge in the second floor, adjacent to the library, and I love to do laptop work with a glass of wine. This is the same place were they serve breakfast, a very good buffet which is included in the room rate. The rooms are not very big, as the hotel is small, and for that reason, charming. You’ve Monkeys Bar adjacent to the hotel, what is a very good choice to eat at night, when you are tired and alone.
The only negative are the elevators. They have only two for several floors and when the hotel is busy it can be stressing to wait. Other than that, if you want to avoid big-chain hotels and not pay a lot of money, this is the place to go.
D.M.Pinho Neto

title: Once again, wonderful!
text: This was my second time at this hotel and I’m just as enthusiastic as the first. We stayed for four days after visiting family in the area and, once again, the hotel did not disappoint. The rooms are comfortable (small), the location is fantastic and the service is excellent. One of the highlights is breakfast and happy hour (both included) where you will meet other guests and have great conversations. We look forward to coming back!

title: A Perfect Spot to Enjoy New Year’s Weekend!
text: Hotel Elysee was recommended to us by friends who stay often. My husband and I decided to change from our usual larger hotels. We absolutely loved our stay!  The Hotel is friendly and charming. Our suite was “old style European” with a modern bathroom. We enjoyed the Club room, light breakfast, all day coffee and late afternoon snacks.
