The location is wonderful and our room was very quiet, for a sixth floor NYC space. The concierge was extremely helpful with a few questions we had. We felt like we were very well taken care of...just what we were looking for, for our four day weekend visit!

title: Excellent once again.
text:
This year we decided to visit New York pre-Christmas to experience once again that “New York Christmas feeling”. Fortunately we were able to get into hotel and as this is our fourth visit we did not have to pre-order anything! Everything we had requested previously for our room- pillows, kettle etc. was there waiting for us. This is what hospitality is about and the staff at the Elysee understands that. 
Being pre-Christmas, as you would expect, the hotel was full so we were little concerned regarding space at breakfast but didn’t have a problem. And how great for staff to remember that on my cereal I have hot milk!
We have used the same room now for the last three visits which is a junior suite. Lots of hanging space (which we need for our ten day stay) although it has very limited view it is so quiet you forget you are in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. 
Reception staff was great in arranging cars and trips for us. We used the Monkey Bar a couple of times for drinks and snacks and although very busy it has that real New York atmosphere in spades. I don’t think we will be going back to New York pre-Christmas again but we will certainly be going back to New York and staying at the Elysee Hotel.

title: We’ll be back!
text: Two-night stay in frigid weather. The room was toasty (but thermostat was adjustable for when it got too toasty). Nice sized room, esp for a NYC hotel. Fantastic lounge for included breakfast, happy hour, late-night tea and cookies. Staff was unfailingly helpful and courteous. Great location...walking distance to theaters, etc. What more can you ask for? This is the kind of hotel that makes you swear off Airbnb.

title: A gem of a hotel
text: I really like this hotel. It is a wonderful boutique hotel that feels homey and yet his comfortable and elegant. It staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable.

title: Excelente atención
text: Es un hotel boutique bien ubicado en el corazón de Manhattan, pequeño, acogedor, con un excelente servicio. Llegamos muy temprano en la mañana y, a pesar de que el check in es a las 15:00, al contar con disponibilidad nos dieron la habitación de inmediato, lo cual es poco usual. Tiene un desayuno continental incluido y vino con quesos por la tarde. La atención de todo el personal es excelente. Sin duda regresaríamos.

title: Wonderful Weekend
text: We had the most wonderful weekend at Hotel Elysee.  We stayed in a junior suite for two days and the room was absolutely beautiful.  The service was wonderful from the doorman, to the front desk to the wait staff.  Everyone was very friendly and quick to help us with any of our needs.  The complimentary breakfast and happy hour every day was fantastic.  We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the area!

title: Great accommodations
text: We stayed in one of the presidential suites.  It was glorious.  The room was super big with a piano in the living room. (Need to tune the piano though).  It has a full kitchen also.  This would be a fine place to spend a week in NYC. Great location.

title: Hotel elysee is NYC's finest
text:
Fabulous service by the front desk! Great Happy Hour and breakfast in the AM.
Lovely 'boutique' hotel. Beats the rat race of the corporate hotels.
Walking distance to everything.
I will return to NYC and stay at the Hotel Elysee.
Top drawer

title: Lovely Christmas 2017 at the Elysee
text: We spent 5 nights  during the Christmas season, and all was well done each day. The staff is accommodating, the breakfast and afternoon tea/wine each day were plentiful. Good newspapers, a warm, cozy room to read on a cold winters day.  Having the Monkey Bar below is the best. Definitely will stay at the Elysee on our next trip to NYC. The location is ideal for easy walking to Central Park , loved the location.

title: outstanding customer service
text: We chose to stay Christmas Eve in this lovely boutique hotel. We had a room on the 14th floor with an outdoor terrace that would have been well served in the warmer months. We had apprehension concerning noise being located right next to the "lift" but the room was very quiet. Regarding the room it was adequate for a one night stay. The bathroom was an issue in that they have a pedestal sink and absolutely no room to lay out toiletries. Although clean the tub and shower combination had a shower curtain. The rug is due for a change, very worn and stained. On the plus side the wine and cheese reception was very well done and the complimentary breakfast in the morning was more than adequate. We would like to give a special thanks to Cheryl Golde.

title: Good value for the cost
text:
Accepting the cold, hard fact that hotels are really pricey in New York City (especially Manhattan), this hotel was a good deal.

Four reasons:
1. The cost includes a sturdy buffet breakfast of high quality (with fresh cut fruit, fresh bagels and breads) cereals, yogurt and other standard items of a cold breakfast.
2. The cost also includes, every late afternoon, a cocktail party featuring wine and a good selection of snacks. No one will deny you a second glass of wine if you want it.
3. Those two features will enable you to cut down on other expenses of your stay (you need not eat three meals a day at expensive restaurants, nor need you inflate your costs by buying drinks at bars or restaurants). But these two features are not just a chance to eat but an opportunity to meet fellow travelers. The large "club room" has upholstered chairs and sofas, circular and rectangular glass-topped cocktail tables, and a few standard tables built just for eating meals. The wait staff was excellent at both breakfast and cocktail hour, and we never felt rushed to eat and run.You could bring your family into this room and sit around a large table, or enter it alone and sit at a cocktail table and find interesting and convivial guests to chat with. We were there during the week between Christmas and New Year's, and many guests had children and teens with them. It's a bit like a bread-and- breakfast in the middle of a great city rather than in the quiet countryside.
4.The hotel is near high-end shopping and the superb museums arrayed along the east side of Central Park.
This is an older, small, comfortable place to stay, not a new harsh glass-and-steel behemoth. Its decor reflects the hotel's name. 
The only drawback is that there is only one elevator, but that's certainly not a deal-breaker for this hotel.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: Fabulous hotel in heart of New York, great rooms, great location, great staff, highly recommend . The 1 lift is pretty busy in peak times, but that is our only criticism , everything else was terrific, They served cheeses and snacks and bubbly every night in the library - fabulous !!! will be back !

title: Family XMAS
text: good location ~ excellent staff - delightful stay ~ we especially appreciated the continental breakfast, (very nice assortment and great coffee!) wine & cheese each evening (which had a variety of samplings) ~ and use of the Club Room to welcome our friends

title: Great Location
text:
I’m a native New Yorker, now living in Florida, looking for my home away from home in NYC.
Well, I’ve found it.
Located on 54th Street, steps away from Park Avenue’s iconic Lever House, the Hotel Elysee welcomes you.
From the elegant doorman to the greeting and service from top notch professionals at the desk, this is a class act.
Breakfast and an amazing happy hour with plentiful small plates and wines are served on the second floor. With three large windows overlooking 54th Street, attractive guests mingle (or not) and are comfortable on an array of casual seating choices.
It has the feeling of a small private club.
My room, well laid out and a nice size was traditional in decor and could use updating. But the bed was comfortable, the linens a good quality and all kept very clean.
A true value for a happy experience.
Cynthia
West Palm Beach, FL

title: A Wonderful Hotel
text: This is a wonderful hotel.  It is centrally located, the room was delightful, the staff was equally as delightful.  I will definitely return here.  It was quiet, the breakfast was perfect, and the wine hour was an extra added treat.

title: Continues to be welcoming and well run
text: My husband and I stayed at the Elysee hotel for the second time together over the Christmas holiday and were as pleased as our previous visit. The staff is courteous and helpful and always wanting to please. The value is excellent as there is a lovely enhanced continental breakfast and wine and h’ordeourves hour in the afternoon in the lounge that are included. This is a smaller boutique hotel which has classic furnishing and decor. If you’re looking for sleek and modern, this is not for you. The staff keeps everything very clean and inviting. This hotel seems to appeal to a wide range of travelers. Families with children of all ages, Europeans, couples of all ages, and even the occasional business person all find their way here. The lounge area is conducive to chatting with other guests., so one can learn a lot about other travelers this way. We both highly recommend Elysee to others who are looking for value with care.

title: Recent Christmas stay
text:
This was my second stay at Hotel Elysee.
Room was very comfortable and very clean.  Breakfast and happy hour are excellent.  The staff is
Very helpful and pleasant.  Looking forward to my next visit!! Home away from home!

title: Thumbs up.
text: It was very friendly and cosy.. The tea room was especially nice. We appreciated the breakfast; they had a very good selection of breakfast items. We also loved the  afternoon wine treat. We have stayed here before and wii definitely stay here again.

title: Another stay at Elysee
text: This is a smaller, quiet and friendly hotel in the heart of Midtown. Of course, the staff are friendly and attentive, but so are most of the guests. People entering and exiting the elevator typically greet each other. This contrasts with my experience at some other hotels. Generally, the halls are quiet at night. The club room on the second floor is a gem. It is open for breakfast and a happy hour with no additional charge. The Monkey bar room service menu is limited but the food is well prepared and tasty. As a frequent hotel resident, I must say that I like the fact that all of the lamps have the same kind of switch rather than each being different and hard to find. I have stayed in this hotel from before it was in the Library chain and given its location and ambiance, I  will do so again.

title: Loving Hotel Elysee
text: I have stayed at Hotel Elysee before and chose it again because of the service, the charm and the delightful employees.The hotel is located in the center of the experience I wanted to share with my granddaughter.  We plan to return again in the future.

title: Enyoed thisbhotel
text: Friendly, central location near 5 th Ave, Central Park and Time Square. Clean, nice breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese. Also comfortable bed and pillows. The only thing is a small bathroom with pedestal sink

title: WE WILL RETURN!
text: I had read about the Hotel Elysee several years ago and, being that we wanted to be mid-town so we could walk 5th Avenue and visit points of interest, we decided on Hotel Elysee.  From the warmth and helpfulness of the staff, to the club room which we really enjoyed for morning coffee and paper-reading ...  the afternoon wine and cheese ... The Monkey Room which was always buzzing with activity ... why not want to come back year after year?  We'll return!

title: Love this hotel!
text: The Elysee staff makes you feel welcome and cared for. It’s the little touches that really stand out: bottled water in your room every day, a lovely breakfast every morning, access to coffee, tea, and ice water all day long.

title: Charming small hotel
text: We chose this hotel as we had stayed once before and loved it. The staff is very courteous and welcoming. The second floor provides afternoon wine and cheese, and the included continental breakfast a real plus in the morning.

title: A wonderful trip to New York City thanks to the Hotel Elysee
text: I have traveled all over the world and have never stayed at a more enjoyable hotel.  The staff at the Hotel Elysee are the best!  Take my word for it; you will not find a better hotel anywhere in New York.  You will feel at home and your accomodations will please you.  The rooms are quiet and the beds are the best.  I slept like a log every night.

title: Always unique
text:
We love the friendliness of the staff.They are always courteous and very helpful.
The hotel has a unique feeling.
The lounge serving food throughout the day is unique.
The whole experience makes a stay in New York relaxing.

title: Another great stay
text:
Always a pleasure to stay here. The staff is just wonderful, they go out of their way to be nice and helpful.  Nice  small boutique hotel, clean rooms, cozy feel, great location, warm staff, and breakfast ncluded. Would 
not stay anywhere else in the city!

title: Fantastic location and wonderful staff made for a great NYC stay
text:
My daughter and I had the good fortune to enjoy a weekend getaway to NYC - we wanted to see some shows and enjoy the city during the holiday season.    Booked directly with the hotel, choosing a room with two double beds which was surprisingly difficult to locate in the city so we were glad to have that option.    

We received a warm welcome upon arrival and the hotel stored our luggage for us while we headed a short distance down the street to MoMa.  When we returned, our room was ready and Rich cheerfully took our bags up for us and demonstrated lights, heating/cooling - the usual.  Room was on the 11th floor and while it didn't offer a view of anything, instead overlooking heating/cooling units, it was very quiet. There is only one elevator in the hotel but the only time we really had to wait appeared to be during breakfast and wine and cheese times so it was not an issue at all for us.  

The beds were very comfortable, ample pillows and blankets available. Nice bathrobes if one had a need.   Bathroom was large and spacious.  Room was very, very clean, promptly made up each day with fresh sheets, towels and toiletries.  

We did not take advantage of the wine/cheese reception times as we had plans each evening, but it seemed very popular.  We saw several groups of friends and families who clearly came here year after year.  Breakfast was fine for a bite, nothing substantial but an assortment of fresh fruits, yogurts, pastries, bagels and bread, hard boiled eggs, coffee and juices.  Enough to hold one over!  Again very popular, cheerful and welcoming staff.  Each time we departed or returned to the hotel, we were greeted by staff at the front desk and of course the wonderful doormen.  

I really enjoyed my stay here.  Quieter, older clientele but comfortable accommodations and a welcoming atmosphere made for a great stay.  It was convenient to everything we wanted to do and reasonable prices during a peak time.  I can't wait to return and bring my husband this time.

title: Library collection does it again! Wonderful stay
text: We ended up at Hotel Elysee because the Casablanca Hotel was not available at the time we were traveling. We chose Elysee because of our experience at the Casablanca; we were not disappointed. The staff was friendly, helpful. The room (queen size) was well appointed and the "porch" area was cozy and perfect for morning coffee and paper. The lounge for both breakfast and cocktails was comfortable, the selection of cookies, bagels, cheese, crackers was satisfying. I love the European style of the library collection. We will be going back to New York and based on our experience at the Casablanca and the Elysee we will be staying at one of the Library Collection hotels

title: European Home in New York!
text: I have stayed many times at Hotel Elysee and feel very much at home. I especially like the European feel to this lovely boutique hotel and the location is uptown best!  Staff extremely warm and helpful.

title: Great New York place
text: This is a very nice place to stay. It is convenient to the subway and in a nice area near the south end of Central Park. But what makes it really stand out are the staff-from the doormen to the front desk staff to the staff attending to you in the coffee/light breakfast area-afternoon wine lounge on the second floor. They are very courteous, friendly, and efficient

title: DISAPPOINTING
text: First shown to room with wallpaper coming off all four walls. Sheets not changed until I put in two requests.  Bathtub was not cleaned and used shower gels were not removed.  Back of bath room door was absolutely grimy. Had to request replacement of washcloths.  Very disappointing but the staff was  polite and nice.
